placeInfo/address: Beach Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Pat cash & keep your receipts!
text:
The location is amazing, it’s literally on the sea front with stunning views, great pools & bars, the food is very good too, particularly at Tuna Turners.
However the whole place could do with a lick of varnish, the stickers are half peeled off the restaurant windows & there are a few chips in the pool tiles. Other than the sun lounger cushions everything is spotlessly clean.
95% of the staff are exceptional, in fact I had to stop them doing the simplest of things for me, however if you are there for a couple of days you do learn a handful of them are only paying lip service to you, not actually doing what they said they would
Then we have money. I was told I could boom drinks to the room on the first day & duly did with 1 roiled for less than a tenner. However at breakfast the next morning I was confronted by a stern looking gentleman explaining it was a mistake & I needed to pay. It seemed he posted a waiter at my table to escort me to my room immediately to settle up. I soon shoed him off, finished my breakfast in peace then returned to my room when 2 minutes later he was knocking at the door! I explained it would be settled within the next 15 minutes & made my way down to reception to sort it. They didn’t seem bothered at the harassment but I settled up & made it quite clear I didn’t want another knock at the door. Which is exactly what I got 30 minutes later!
I would have let it drop, even though they have a habit of presenting the bill halfway through a meal, but the icing on the cake was on the last night, in bed early for a 2am start when at 10am the phone rang followed by a knock at the door from the same guy saying I had a bill to settle up! Needless to say I was furious, of course the manager wasn’t available so I settled it, but these little things leaves big negative impression
title: Should be amazing, but let down by simple things

text:
The location of the property and the views from the room are excellent.
The staff at check-in and check-out are good.
However, the service at the hotels is extremely slow. Extremely.
A cup of coffee can anywhere above 40 minutes.
Room service can take over an hour to deliver a meal.
At billing we found a discrepancy in our bill and had to be revised.
There is no coffee machine at the buffet and we had to order it from the cafe on the other side of the property and this would be available only after 9AM.
Watermelon juice was served with the seeds crushed into it. Had to specifically ask them not to do this.
The pool adjoining the rooms could cleaner.
The A/c's in one of the rooms was erratic.
The staff is obviously trained to ask for reviews and to specifically mention staff names, which is very clear from the reviews on Trip Advisor.

placeInfo/address: Beach Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed at Ekho surf for our 2nd week after touring round for a week with our personal tour guide, so looking forward to a chilled out 2nd week. Hotel ok but needs a little tlc in places.OIn arrival we were met in reception, first hotel we have ever been to where we were not met with a welcome drink and after an epic over 7 hour drive to get there a drink would have been nice. We were given our all inclusive wrist bands and taken to our room. On arrival I asked for anniron as we had been living out of our suitcase for the previous week staying at various hotels, twice I went to reception to ask and finaly at the 3rd attempt and at 2230 an iron was sent to our room. All inclusive is not worth it here, you could have drinks in the resteraunt whilst open or the cafe but the only bar to sit and chill and drink was called the cosy bar and that's open 2200 to midnight but on each occasion we went in it was never staffed, we were expected to get the staff from the resteraunt bar to come up stairs to serve us. The staff were great in the resteraunt , friendly and we noticed after giving tips to some of the helpful ones, others were going  out of their way to serve us. We noticed whilst there that we were the only ones all inclusive, even in the evening the place to sit out was Tuna Turner but even though this was part of the hotel you had to pay for drinks here. The towels for the pool were very thin and needed replacing, we were told if we lost our towel cards, first time is was 3,000 Rupees and 2nd time would be 7,000 (around £17). The location is great and with a beautiful beach. No entertainment in the evenings other than on the first night a dj set at Tuna Turner, every other night there were musicians playing whilst you're eating in the reteraunt.
title: Location good, but needs a little tlc

placeInfo/address: Beach Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
We chose this hotel to finish off our tour of Sri Lanka and as we do not like large hotels where meals are often included we decided to plump for the Ekho Surf.
The good bits:
Rooms have a good layout and are conveniently located for the sun beds which are directly in front of your room. The hotel is only a few steps away from the beach. 
The hotel has a boutique feel to it with a simple decor and rustic charm. 
It is ideally located next to restaurants on the other side of the train track.
The not so good bits:
The room looked tired in places and required some updating. 
Pools towels and the sun bed cushions are not in the greatest condition with frayed edges and stains.
Service is slow and staff do not appear to be as courteous or as friendly as other hotels we have stayed during our time in Sri Lanka or other areas of Asia.
Breakfast tables are not relayed in a timely manner and the replenishment of hot water and coffee can be very slow.
We returned to our room one day to find our room door hadn’t been closed properly by the cleaner.
We also had to complain about the fluctuation of the shower water temperature which went from scalding hot to cold. 
There is no full length wardrobe and so it is only for purpose for shirts and tops. Items like dresses and trousers had draped o er the sofa or hung on the edge of the wardrobe.

I think it’s a shame as with some TLC and attention to detail this could be a really lovely hotel
title: Could be a fantastic hotel

text:
A lovely hotel in a great location with modern, clean rooms. 

The restaurant can be chaotic with tables not cleared and basics like coffee or glasses for juice not being topped up. Only booked B&B so can't comment on service for other meals.

The pool staff are excellent, but struggle with dirty and old sunbeds of which there are nowhere near enough. On most days the beds had all been reserved by 8am.

Tuna Turner is in a great spot beside the beach but on a couple of occasions was ruined by excessively loud music and beach parties organised by the hotel. Great if that's your thing but no getting away from it if not!

Finally, I do wonder how many of the reviews for Ekho Surf are genuine. Grammar is often poor and many are first time reviewers or new to TripAdvisor.
title: Potentially a great hotel, let down by ineffective management.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear blueboy1985,

Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about your recent stay.

We would like to start thanking you for the constructive comments and we take each feedback very seriously. I as well regret that we have fallen short of your expectations.

We strive to make each stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible, and we will use your comments to review our services in order to provide a better experience in the future.

placeInfo/address: Beach Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It's worth upgrading to a deluxe room. It is NOT worth upgrading board to all inclusive, there are just too many restrictions.
text:
Our expectations for our stay here were partly based on the description of the property on the Tui website and partly our experience of similarly marketed 4-5* hotels we have previously booked in Greece, Thailand, Canary Islands and Egypt, all on an all-inclusive board basis.
First impression on arrival was very positive, with the driveway and entrance understated and tidy, with attractive water features and well maintained exterior. The feel is low-key and relaxed rather than attempting grandeur and extravagance. This feel extends into the lobby, which is simple and comfortable as a reception area and the staff were very friendly and welcoming.
Unfortunately it was at this point, whilst checking in, that the limitations of our ‘all-inclusive’ package started to become apparent (more on this).
The route to the rooms is rather awkward, either up or down steps from the lobby to corridors along the back of the accommodation wings. The first floor route through the ‘north’ wing also requires negotiating sets of heavy (presumably soundproof) narrow double doors taking you through the rather random feeling ‘Karaoke Lounge’ which was unused all week. The ground floor route to upper rooms passes through a small café area.
This brought us to our room; we had paid a supplement to upgrade to a Deluxe room, which was spacious, attractive and well furnished. In direct comparison to the five hotels we had stayed in over the previous 7 nights, the bed certainly rated as one of the most comfortable. It was also arranged to face towards the windows, which was nice. The balcony had two cushioned sunloungers and enjoys views out over the pool serving the swim-up rooms, to the beach and sea beyond. All first floor rooms have good sea views, with ground floor rooms also all facing seawards. Storage is somewhat limited with a wardrobe for hanging clothing but only a set of narrow shelves (approx. 7-8 inches deep) adjacent to this on which to place anything else.
The bathroom was also plenty big enough for our needs, with a basin recessed in a large vanity unit complemented by a fully mirrored wall. The shower was very generously sized and included a ‘rainforest’ shower head, unfortunately the heat/pressure was intermittent to begin with and following assessment by the maintenance team, only the pressure was resolved, leaving us rarely being able to enjoy anything more than a warm shower. This has been highlighted in other reviews so is clearly an ongoing issue. The cleanliness level, on arrival, was also below what could reasonably be expected but this was resolved by the housekeeping team and kept to a good standard for the remainder of the week.
Food
The restaurant was a pleasant environment in which to dine, with tables seating up to 4 persons along the glass frontage. Outside there is a decking terrace with views of the beach across the lawn and tables are set when the weather allows. Evening meals consist of a buffet of both local, Indian and international cuisine although the variety was good over the course of the week, choices each evening were more limited but still plentiful. The chef station prepares ‘to order’ dishes of the day both at breakfast and dinner. Again, there are plenty of hot and cold options, cereals, breads and pastries at the breakfast buffet.
Due to low occupancy, provision of a lunchtime buffet is uneconomical for the hotel, so a la carte dining was the only option outside of the busier weekends. This was a bit of a surprise when we first arrived, wanting only a light snack and being presented with a 4-course menu. We had already experienced the disappointment of being told wine was not included with our all-inclusive upgrade, so we were unable to enjoy a much anticipated glass of chilled white with our lunch to begin our holiday. Wine by the bottle is available at extra cost and the management were kind enough to waive the cost of our first bottle after we raised the issue of the limited value of our wrist-band.
The seafood restaurant is not available as part of the all-inclusive package, guests are able to eat here at additional cost. When we asked for bottled water at the adjoining bar we were told we would also be charged for these and it transpired that drinks from this, the only outdoor pool/beach bar, are also not included in the ‘all-inclusive’ package. There is a small café with a terrace at the end of the main pool (which at over 50m is great for swimming lengths!) and this serves tea, coffee, beer and soft drinks. Be warned though, local black coffee is included in the all-inclusive package; lattes, cappuccinos, Americanos etc are not! The morning & afternoon snacks promised in the marketing material were never available, the cabinet in the café remaining conspicuously empty for the entire week of our stay.
Pool area
Poolside time was spent at the long pool which runs along the front of the ‘swim-up’ rooms and looks out past trees onto the beach. There are the usual loungers and parasols, though both the loungers and the cushions are looking a bit tired, they serve a purpose and are comfortable enough. The pool staff did a good job of finding us a spot, bringing cushions and setting up our furniture and were always friendly and polite. Don’t, though, expect attentive poolside service which you might typically receive at a similarly rated hotel elsewhere (the 4* Khao Lak Merlin in Thailand comes to mind) bringing cocktails to your sunspot. Mainly because, you guessed it, cocktails are not included in the all-inclusive package. Drinks are available from the adjacent café, but the selection is limited.
The pool at the other end of the property is much smaller and great for a dip, but the area surrounding appears a bit haphazard with a beach volleyball court, a handful of loungers and a firepit all thrown together with some other features next to the beach bar.
Local area
The beach running along the front of the hotel is easily accessed, beautiful golden sands with some lovely spots to walk to, including a temple amongst the trees on the headland to the north. There is private surf board hire and tuition at several locations along the beach, make the most of the cheap deals if the surf is looking good! The tide rises quite high at certain times so there are no beach lounging facilities provided by the hotel, though several frames were being temporarily erected to accomodate some form of seating/lying area. Presumably these were to be ready for the peak season.
There is a railway station immediately outside the hotel entrance with a fairly regular service to Ahungalla, Hikkaduwa, Galle and beyond to Matala southbound, Colombo to the north. The diesel locomotives trains are loud and services start early so worth noting if you are a light sleeper, though we were never really bothered by this. The town of Aluthgama is a short walk away with market stalls, spice shops and supermarkets.
In summary, a comfortable enough stay, with friendly and enthusiastic service but sadly fails to meet expectations in delivering a genuine 4* experience. TUI are probably nearer the mark in awarding this hotel a ‘3T’ rating, but still sell it on services it doesn’t appear able to provide. A bit of investment by the owners of Ekho hotels in the infrastructure and facilities could improve this greatly and this is evident from a similar experience staying at another of their properties, Ekho Safari, only days earlier. The generous Tripadvisor rating appears heavily influenced by guests from the region staying weekends with family groups who may have very different expectations to the seasoned international traveller looking to book an everything-taken-care-of hassle-free package holiday.
title: Great location, overall experience disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Dear valued guest,

Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay with us. We are grateful you are taking the time to share your experience.

We are always improving our activities as complete satisfaction is our goal and it would be our pleasure to have the chance of welcoming you back at EKHO Surf Bentota and make your stay with lots of love and happiness!

With kindest regards,
placeInfo/address: Beach Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text: Nice hotel but spoilt on our last day there by a group of ladies with their portable music player blaring on the beach. So loud one couldn’t think and after an hour we and several other clients left the beach to go to our room away from the noise. Management were not prepared to do anything until the spa complained that they couldn’t hear their soothing music whilst treating their clients but this was at four o’clock. Also breakfast and meal times a chaos. Half the time there were not enough crockery or cutlery. Soup often ran out and the juices were watered down and tasteless. Very disappointing
title: Last five night stay in Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Dear valued guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I sincerely apologize that your stay did not meet your expectations. 

We understand how important it is to feel that you are receiving value for your stay, and we regret that we fell short in this regard.

The team and I appreciate your constructive feedback and hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a much-improved experience should you choose to return.

Kind regards,
placeInfo/address: Beach Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka

The service was a little too late...

title: Good but bad ‎‎‎                                                          ‎‎

placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed for one night in the second week of July. The rooms were spacious and and had a very rustic feel to it. The room had a good view of the sea and the pool. However the quality of the food wasn't very good. Given that majority of our group was vegetarian, there wasn't much of choice. In the lunch menu, there were no vegetarian mains mentioned and my sister ended up having the same meal she had the night before and what was later recommended by staff to myself was of poor quality. For breakfast we had to suggest what they could make for vegetarians as they weren't sure what to offer. We couldn't enjoy the beach much either as it was quite rough, and someone recommended that we drive towards the city centre to enjoy the beach.
title: Not a great place for Vegetarians

placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We ended our two week tour of Sri-Lanka here and to be honest it was a bit of a let down. We were a larger group, occupying four of the six rooms. Check-in was a long process and no one seemed to want to tell us what was taking so long. Staff were very helpful in taking bags up to our rooms.  Rooms were spacious, beds quite large, views were really beautiful and the bathroom décor was very impressive, but the cleaniness needs to be questioned. I don't believe the linen was dirty, but the stains on the bedding, the curtains, the furniture really was disgusting. The towels are in desperate need of an upgrade. When the towels are fraying, it's clear they need to be replaced. We were shocked to find out that alcohol is not served...a little disappointed at not being able to enjoy a cocktail by the pool. But BY is not a problem. They were able to provide glassware, bottle openers and ice buckets when asked. Need to advise guests of the requirement of giving plenty of notice to the kitchen if you wish to have dinner, or order a Sri-Lankan breakfast. We waited for two hours for dinner....with two hungry children in tow! And then a childs order was wrong. No apology from the chef, no offer to correct the order...very frustrating. The meals were okay, but after the food we had experienced during our two weeks in SL the food here was a let down. The location is good. The beach was very rough due to monsoon season, so care must be taken if you plan on playing in the waves. A special thank you to the staff who organized the Australian Network channel for us, we really appreciated the efforts and to the staff who rose early to help us with our departure and packed breakfast for us, that too was really appreciated by all members of our group.
title: Not as we expected...disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Thank you for your comments we appreciate that.
Firstly let me thank you again for the positive comments you have made with regard to the hotel. Corrective action will taken where necessary. 
With regard to the price ... Were you aware at the time of checking in the price you were paying for the room?  If not please let me know.

We are a 6 room boutique hotel. Which means we have most of the facilities of a 5 star and additional privacy and personalised service. We have a total of 16 staff,( professional ) well equipped kitchen, full sized swimming pool , luxury large rooms , satellite TV, unlimited Wi-Fi , the hotel is well maintained with high cleanliness & hygienic standards, 24 hr security etc. Unfortunately all our fixed costs need to be recovered with just 6 rooms. Hence the rates that we need  to charge to operate effectively. It is not unusual to find this kind of rates being charged by boutique hotels in all parts of the globe. 
On the contrary Most of the larger hotels can afford to offer better rates and it is a well known fact.
We are sorry that we have not been able to fall in line with your price expectations!

Best regards
Shiran Anthony
placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: question the price especially out of season..it's over rated...
text: I arrived at night time at the Roman Beach and chose it because I was tired of travelling that day. It looked calm ...I have to say that the rooms with spacious bathroom and balcony were really nice. One of the staff kept asking me about Englsih classes which was  a little annoying ...The swimming pool was nice and everthing was pleasing...I am a resident in Sri Lanka and I do feel that the price was really excessive...I paid  Rs 20000 (90GPB- 150 $) more expensive than the Galle Face one of the more prestigious hotels in SL and similar the the wonderful Heritage, Dambulla though for that price there was an individual luxury bungalow and half board..!! The Chaya in Trinco is cheaper with private beach and massive array of food for breakfast...The food at the Roman Beach although nicely presented offered no choice, same old egg and toast and jam fruit etc.just like a cheaper guest house.....again for the price not good enough...This was out of season so I thought that making me pay that amount was really not honest...
title: Why so expensive??

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest.

May I first thank you for your review even though it is very disturbing to have received such a shocking one! after getting used to glowing tributes by most of our guests this came in like a thunder bolt out of the blues. My first reaction was... could this be from a competitor. However given the benefit of the doubt & probably thinking that it had been the WORST DAY at Roman Beach I would like to clarify as follows
We have 16 staff members for a 6 roomed boutique hotel. We do not serve buffet meals as expected by some guests. yes we do have a limited choice in our A' la carte Menue in total about 50 varieties but we strive to maintain very high quality & Quantity standards to be amongst the best in the industry.. 
WE ARE RANKED AS # 1 IN HIKKADUWA IN TRIP ADVISOR ACCORDING TO VISITOR REVIEWS. We couldn't have got any where  close to that  if our other guests though about us the same way!

We are very sorry that we have not been able to match up to your expected high standards  however we will strive even harder so that our glowing tributes would get even better!!!

Best Regards
placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: No choice of food. Full menu is not served. Soups and salads were only served in dinner. Fresh juices were only served when guest request. Portion served were not enough.poor service and not enough staff. Rooms were good. Expensive but not worth for money. Lot to improve.
title: Poor service and not worth for money.

ownerResponse/text:
Hi
Thank you for your constructive review. It looks like it had been a 'off day' for Roman Beach! My apologies if we have failed to live upto your expectations.   We have looked into all areas that you have complained / commented about. What ever needs to be corrected we have already attended to.
Some times it is difficult to please all the people all the time :-) however that is our vision.

Thank you again.
Best Wishes
Shiran Anthony
placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a small hotel by the beach with 6 rooms in total.
The beach right behind the hotel is not safe for swimming, one needs to walk 10 to 15 mins towards your right as you enter the beach to do some swimming.
The food was ok, nothing exceptional.
The rooms are very nice and quiet big and same with the bathrooms, but we found a lot of small red ants all over the hotel (in the room, bathroom, restaurant tables and near the pool).
The service is decent but for the price you pay i was expecting far better service.

Eg,
1) The room was not ready when i reached the hotel (by around 2:30 PM). had to wait around 25 mins at the reception.
 
2) My return flight was preponed by 12 Hours which ment that i had to check out a day in advance than what i had booked for and requested the onsite manager if this could be done, he could not help me and asked me to talk to their booking manager who was not available on site, the least i expected was the hotel to connect the right person over phone either from the reception or patch the call to the room. Eventually my airlines put me on the next days flight and i didnt have to check out earlier.

3) I had asked for a mosquito coil to be provided in the balcony as there were lots of mosquitos,    room boy first came with an electric repellent, the balcony does not have a power socket, i sent him back to get the mosquito coil and he didnt come back for the next 20 mins, i had to call the reception again as they had forgotten about it and they finally sent it to my room after almost 30 mins after my first call. 

Having said that, this is a nice hotel, they brought a cake to the restaurant on our wedding anniversary and all the staff were there to greet us.
title: Decent Little Boutique Hotel but Expensive for what it is.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Traveller, 

We would like to thank you very much for your review, we do apologize for the belated reply, however we wished to thank you for your review. 

We have changed our procedures over the years in particular to the service and have taken comments such as yours under advisement , therefore would like to thank you for contributing to the overall improvement of our establishment

If you do decide to visit us again , please do inform and we will arrange a direct booking discount for your stay. 

Thank you again !

Yours sincerely – 
Romantha De Silva 
Director 
Roman Hotels
Email: Director@romanhotels.lk
placeInfo/address: 777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a very new hotel which is quite impressive in some ways but needs to develop its service further. (For example, following me back to my room from the pool area to present me with a bill for a bottle of water they had forgotten to add to the previous night's dinner bill. I'll pay it when I check out thank you!)

I think for me personally, Roman Beach is an impressive building in a not-particularly-impressive location; Hikkaduwa isn't a very smart place and Roman Beach would be more at home in Miami. I felt the garden area was a bit too small and I ended up wanting a bigger and more relaxed hotel.

That said, the room was good, the bathroom impressive, the seafood good. If you are a boutique hotel kind of person it's probably worth a look.
title: Needs a little work on service

roomTip: Get out and see Galle
text:
We found the hotel was a little shabby around the edges. Our AC unit made so much noise we had to keep turning it off. 

The beach area was spotless and well looked after by a beach guard. The beach is a private cove with views over to Galle.  It's great for swimming but there's no ability to go for long walks along the beach. The pool is salt water and runs alongside the hotel. Gets lots of shade which probably is a plus point in the heat!

The staff were very chatty, attentive and friendly. 

Food was of a high quality. Lots of choice for breakfast and lunch. However, the evening meal was very restrictive with a set menu offering limited choice. The vegetarian menu didn't seem to change from day to day. We found this very frustrating. 

Really easy to visit Unwatuna or Galle from here. Tuk Tuks wait at the end of the lane and cost c 1,000R to get into Galle for example. 

Perhaps our personal preferences weren't suited to CocoBay - limited evening meals, everything centered around a small cove. If you like a small hotel with everything focused around a beach then this should be great.
title: Is a fine hotel - not sure it's as 5* as the reviews say

ownerResponse/text: We are sorry your stay was below expectations and we will look into your comments and take action accordingly. We hope you will visit us again and regret the inconvenience caused to you.
text: Honestly for the price point we payed we didn’t feel too mad especially with what the average hotel prices are in this area. However room had an odd smell the entire time, we found serval hairs in our room (we told staff they did come and clean up but we found more hairs after), the beach isn’t great as the sea was brown at times and on a main road so wouldn’t recommend if you want to go for the beach. However for getting too and from Galle location was good so depends what you want. Staff although were friendly and helpful so can’t complain on that. I guess you kinda get what you pay for.
title: Average

ownerResponse/text: We are sorry for your mixed experience, and rest assured that action will be taken where necessary to improve the hotel's standards. This is the monsoon period, and you will not find a beach to swim in due to high waves and strong currents. We hope you will visit again during the season to enjoy the wonderful sea in all its aspects.
text: I chose this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews that seem overly inflated. The most disappointing thing about this hotel is that you can’t swim in the ocean! There is a huge constant surf that will knock you down. There are red warning flags that discourage swimming. You can wade in knee deep but that’s it. Had I known this I would have never chosen this hotel. It is low season and the hotel is almost empty. There is no need for the wait staff to rush diners. The waiter constantly comes to the table and takes your plate before you have finished eating. So rude! They don’t allow you to pour your own milk in your tea or coffee so it does not taste right. They need to serve the food and pick up the plates after the guest leaves the table. The waitstaff is too overbearing. Also, there are dogs in the resort. The first time we ate a dog was begging for food.  This would be a great place for some peace and quiet ( nice balcony and view) without the fawning staff. A massage man knocked on the door offering service. It was scary since I didn’t know if he was legit. If you like to chill, swim and mind your own business this is not the right place for you.
title: No swimming

ownerResponse/text: We are glad you enjoyed your stay and wish you a warm welcome back to the COCO BAY.
text:
The hotel is decent, had some nice features, like a plunge pool right outside the bedroom, selection of pillows, offered and the beach is private.  Food at restaurant could be better, however, the Sri Lankan breakfast was great.

I also had a ayuravedic massage and the therapist was really good. I think his name was Vidura.
title: Quiet hotel with quite nice rooms.

ownerResponse/text: We thank you for your review and have noted your mixed comments. Action where necessary on your comments will be taken and we wish you both a warm welcome back to the COCO BAY.
text:
Attended for a birthday party. Large rooms, huge bed - reasonably comfortable, large bathroom, beautiful view, large breakfast- many items available, staff very pleasant. 

AC in room wasnt working,  had to call maintenance to come and fix it.  Fixtures and fittings in bedroom and common areas run down.  Hotel needs a lick of paint, and upgrade of some bathroom fittings and fixtures.  During the busy evening period the bar was full of dirty plates and dirty glasses, lots of staff around but nobody cleaning and no staff working on the bar to order a drink, slow service - need for improvement. 

Overall the location and view was amazing,  but i did feel the hotel is largely overpriced for the amenities it offered. Unlikely to stay again.
title: Great location. Hotel requires some improvements

ownerResponse/text: We are sorry you had a mixed experience during your stay. The style of decor and the price charged for a boutique resort on a private beach with comprehensive facilities including a private jacuzzi in all rooms can be assessed by our guests. Please note this is not a weekend operation catering only to Sri Lankans. 90% of our guests are foreign tourists and as we are working on a high level of occupancy, we need to enforce the 12 noon check out. However if we have some rooms free, we will always extend a late check out till a certain time.
text:
PROS:
The location works very well for the stay.
The room was large, with all basic facilities.
Fantastic bathroom, had a jacuzzi na dwe were offered handmade soaps at check in.
The room had a great view of the the ocean in front of it and the accessibility of the beach is another major plus.
Staff are courteous and nice in general.

CONS:
Decor is subjective, but we felt that the decor is overdone/weird/mix of way too many things.
The pricing of the property at almost INR 10,000 (USD 120) per night, doesn't meet the expectation standards, there are a lot of options to choose from around the area.
At the price charged per night, you'd expect a buffet breakfast. Unfortunately, an extremely limited breakfast set menu is on offer, which is not adequate as a breakfast, leave alone for a star hotel breakfast.
With the checkout time at 12:00 p.m., the front desk called us at 12:25 p.m. and informed that a full day charge would be levied if we stayed beyond 12:30 p.m. Basically they shoo'd us away. Didn't expect that from a hotel on a Monday when all the guests are checking out and barely any new customers are walking in.
The front desk lady was rude in general, not just this incident.
title: Look elsewhere!

text:
We stayed on 22nd and 23rd august 2020 in 304 grande riviera familly room.
Ok..good things first...the front office staff was very friendly and helpful...the room was great, spacious and had all the facilities you expect in a star class hotel including a good modern spacious bathroom. It was very close to the beach and the veiw was fantastic. We had a jacuzzi in the balcony. It was an old one with some taps not working..but passable for a short stay. The AC was put on only after we arrived and it took good two or three hours for the room to be properly cooled. The welcome drink and the fruit platter were delayed and we only received them after we came to the room after a request by us. There was no buffet so we had to go for set menues. The selections available were poor and lacked variation. There were not many vegetarian options for my wife and they were not flexible either. Kids also didnt have much to eat. However the restaurant staff was nice and friendly. I would suggest to skip set menues and go for alacarte, though it will be far highly priced than expected for the hotel class. The taste was ok..but its just like normal food you eat daily..nothing exceptional. As a result we had to change our full board to HB and eat our lunch outside. Pool was clean but very small..and the baby pool was just few feet wide and far too small. Both got very cogested even with an average crowd. The baby pool was not safe either as the deep part was right around it and a parent always had to keep an eye. So nothing much to relax there. However the pool guy was very helpful and watchful. The small private beach was clean and had a good view over the bay. Its safe for a sea bath too. So if you are going..go for alacarte and dont expect a good pool experience. Will we be going there again??...well..probably not.
title: Great room, fine location,poor food and pool

ownerResponse/text:
We are sorry you had a mixed experience during your stay. It is very rarely that we get a complaint on the restaurant service but apologize for this. As for breakfast which is served till 12 noon, we offer a selection of western breakfast with several options, Eastern breakfast also with many options, a healthy breakfast and also days special breakfast.
The variety offered is normally appreciated by almost all our guests and we are sorry if you found this inadequate.
text:
We liked the relaxed atmosphere of this hotel and the staff was very friendly. We didn't want the hassle of Unawatuna Beach and enjoyed the private beach.
We stayed at "Aqua Romance" room which was a bit outdated but nice in general and had a private plunge pool. The bed in the room wasn't very comfortable.
The food was good but the service at the restaurant was slow even though it was still low season and the hotel was half empty. The breakfast menu had only a couple of options.
title: Peaceful location

ownerResponse/text:
We are sorry you had a disappointing stay with us. Your comments are surprising as we do a full quality check on all rooms regularly. It is regretted that these points were not brought to our notice during your stay. We maintain high standards at the resort and the guest reviews will confirm this.
This room was checked by the manager on reading your review and found to be in order.
text:
It was unfortunate how run down the beds and furniture in the room were. The sheets on our bed were torn and had brown marks. We found Layers of dust in our wardrobe while unpacking.  
Our beds were so out of form that it sunk extremely low under the heavy parts of the body, which made it so uncomfortable. It definitely needs to be replaced and the rooms need to be well maintained. Was so disappointed with the standards especially since we booked the suite! 

The good part is the food is exceptional! And this is Coming from a non foodie and picky eater like me. 
I have to mention the staff are super friendly and helpful.
title: My experience was okay

ownerResponse/text:
We are sorry your experience did not live up to expectations. We are glad you enjoyed the beach and the level of service. We are a small 16 roomed boutique resort and the small gym is sufficient for our guests. We offer Yoga with a experienced instructor and in room or on the beach herbal massage to our guests only. We do not have a SPA but offer a variety of other activities.
We hope you will try us again on your next visit and wish you all a warm welcome back.
text:
We knew it was out of season when we planned to stay  here for the last few days of our 3 week trip around Sri Lanka but this was supposed to be the luxury bit of our holiday and we thought that with the Spa/ yoga + the great food we’d read about, we’d be happy even if it rained. Sadly we discovered there is no spa just. a male masseur who comes to your room (which we didn’t fancy for our daughters), a v small gym and the restaurant was over priced, lacking in atmosphere  and not half as good as several in town. 
On the positive side, the small, private beach is lovely and well maintained; the staff are all incredibly friendly and you are even assigned your own personal room butler who carves up your choice of handmade soap when you arrive. They also made a lovely fuss of our daughter for her birthday with balloons on her door and Happy Birthday written on her bed in flowers. However the hotel never quite delivers as the luxury boutique experience it claims to be.
title: Lovely private beach but disappointing restaurant & facilities

ownerResponse/text:
We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us.This is the first time that we have received a complaint about the service mindedness of our security. They have been trained in guest relations with both Sri Lankan and foreign tourists. Our sincere apologies if you think you were not properly addressed and taken care of. We have taken your complaint seriously with the security staff.
Being a boutique resort , we only serve fine dining set menu's and offer a varied a la carte menu which is in conformity with a 16 room resort. From the previous reviews you will note that we get rave reviews on our cuisine. If you wished to have buffets, perhaps you selected the wrong hotel
roomTip: Ground floor Aqua Romance Deluxe would be good if someone prefer for some Privacy. It facilitated with Private plunge pool
text:
I came to the hotel by a tuk tuk & dropped near the main gate. The gate was fully opened & I walked straight towards the front office. After I pass the gate, the security person called me & ask me "where I am going" . Security personals in a hotel are not like the security in a private property. when they questioning a guest, it needs to be a more polite approach. It is not a fault of the security person. It is the responsibility of the management to provide them proper training & development.  

All the staff & their service at front office, restaurant, room service & housekeeping are very good & specially Upul at front office gave us a good support. 

But the worst experience was the foods. It was a low occupancy day & It is understood that the hotel normally does not facilitate with buffet. Their A la carte menu was not up to the stranded of a luxury hotel & it does not worth the money. The management should consider more on the foods they offer. Also the hotel seems a bit old property which need some renovation for a luxury hotel.

Finally, it is not the place for a someone who like to enjoy the luxury experience.
title: Place with good staff but poor management

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. While noting your comments we hasten to add that no one else can open your safe as you put in your own secret code. We have never had a similar incident previously.
text:
the hotel located on perfect spot with a private beach , i really enjoyed the complimentary treats and the tasty food at  la mer restaurant it was amazing also cleanliness was remarkable .
 the only thing i need to warn about is not to keep a cash at the room even in the safe , i had a bad experience that some money was taken from my room
title: excellent hotel but ..

ownerResponse/text: We are glad you enjoyed your food and apologize for the indifferent service you experienced. We have taken up this matter and assure you that this type of negligence will not be repeated.
roomTip: best views
text: I visited this hotel with some of my friends from Colombo for lunch. The food was very delicious, specially the Sri Lankan rice and curry. All the dishes very taste from the beef curry to the yellow rice, but one can't phrase the service because when we asked the steward, to another table because few people were visiting us for lunch, he seemed disapointed and not happy that hotel were getting more customers.
title: Overall Experience

ownerResponse/text: We are sorry you had a mixed dining experience and have looked into it. We thank you for your review and hope you will visit us again.
text:
lovely location by the sea. easilky accessible. 2 to 3 minutes from galle expressway exit . turn left at the T junction. 
the food was brought after about 30 min. visited with family for lunch. soup was aweful tho it very watery...vegitable soup. the western dishes were lacking quantity. portion can be better. The Rice and curry is served in a very impressive way...many items served. its a good choice and spread. around 1k to 1.5k per person.
title: good rice and curry but overall taste could be better

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. We are looking into your remarks and will improve where we can.We hope to welcome you back to the COCO BAY.
text: The rooms are very spacious with jacuzzis in each room. They have a really nice selection of soaps that they make you choose to your room when you arrive. Lovely private beach perfect for kids. The food isn't great , but plenty of places of eat out in the area. We were on a huge discount so it made it worth our while. Usual normal rates are a bit much I feel for the hotel. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly.
title: Lovely rooms and nice private beach

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for staying with us and providing a feedback on your experience. We have noted the mixed experience you encountered and will seriously look into some of the issues. It is a pity that you did not speak to anyone regarding some of the issues you had like with the TV as our maintenance team would have attended to it without delay. Being so closely located to the Indian ocean does create a lot of 
maintenance problems.
We have noted your opinion on the interior but hasten to add that most of our guests have complimented us on the interior decor on the past reviews.
We are once again sorry you did not have a good experience with us.
text:
We have recently spent a few nights at Coco Bay after a two week tour around Sri Lanka. We spent a lot of time researching resorts on the southwestern coastline and were willing to pay a ‘premium’ for that extra special experience. So after investing what we considered a lot of money into our stay, we clearly had much reason to be hopeful.
So starting with some of the positives... Clearly, the position of the hotel on the beach front is great and the private beach is well maintained. However, don’t look too far in either direction or you’ll be gazing over building works or run down areas. Views of uninterrupted Sri Lankan waterfronts they are not!
We ate most meals at the hotel which ranged from pretty good to decidedly average. The breakfast menu, while quite extensive, is really not up to scratch and needs to be refined. One interesting meal proved to be the deep fried seafood which unbeknown to us, half contained fried empty prawn shells.
One serious plus point I would like to add at this stage is that the hotel staff were all fabulous and could not have done more to help us during our stay. The service was great and they were all very friendly and helpful.

I think my real reason for reviewing and the advice it brings, needs to be centred around the outdated feel of the resort and the lack of creature comforts. Visually it does need some serious modernisation. It has a feel of a throw back holiday resort rather than a piece of luxury, as we had believed it would be. The awards on the wall indicate a top 25 Sri Lankan retreat but it was one of the most disappointing places we stayed.
The towels were very old and of poor quality, the sun loungers were faded, tatty and needed replacing. The tv was a health hazard and after much crackling, we decided it was safer just to pull the plug out if the wall.
I think it was fair to say that we were much younger than most other couples staying and I’m sure that many would enjoy the older feel, but I believe if Coco Bay wants to attract a future market of holiday goers, it would be well advised to move with the times.
title: Underwhelmed

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your detailed review.
We are glad you enjoyed most aspects of your stay.
All our rooms and the restaurant have spectacular sunsets and unfortunately as we have a sunset view , the sunrise view is at the back.
Please note that early January is the peak of the Winter season and the highest priced period due to the heavy demand.
The Grand Riviera Suite is our most expensive Suite and the website rate for the period 10th to the 12th January was an average of USD 435 per day including B'fast , dinner and all taxes.
We are sorry you feel that it was not value for money but please note the average rate for this room on half board year round is about USD 375 for 2 persons including b'fast , dinner and taxes.
We send our best wishes and hope you will visit us again perhaps for a meal.
text:
We had spent our anniversary in Cocobay Unawatuna earlier in January. Due to very unfortunate circumstances, we had missed our flight to Sri Lanka and it threw our schedule off by 1 day. However, determined to stick to the plan and not let the airport staff in Jeddah Saudi Arabia ruin our anniversary, we still made it to the hotel by 330am.

The Pros:

Customer service: The management was prompt in replying e-mails and were more than willing to entertain our late check-in request. 

2) Room: The room (Privilege Suite with Sea View) was spacious, clean, and the bathroom was just nice (the staff that checked us in also provided us with a selection of homemade soap bars, which we thought was neat). The balcony had a jacuzzi overlooking the bar and the beach.

4) Going the extra mile: I had requested the hotel to make some complimentary arrangements for our anniversary and they did. The bed was decorated with fresh leaves and flowers, and we also received light refreshments in the form of fresh fruit platters, salads, sandwiches and a small vanilla cake with an anniversary wish.

The Cons:

1) View from room: Unfortunately the hotel was not facing the sunrise so we missed a timelapse-video-worthy moment, however, you may get to witness the sunset (do check other reviews to confirm this). 

2) Value for money: When it comes to what you get for what you pay, Cocobay is overpriced. For more than USD500 (inclusive of all extra taxes and fees) a night, you should be expecting a maldives-esque view with pristine waters or something close to it. If we were to grade the beach and sea itself, it would merely get a 2.5/5.
title: Decent hotel, but overpriced

We’re pleased to hear that you found certain aspects of our hotel enjoyable, such as its proximity to the airport, the greenery, and the swimming pool. However, we sincerely regret that other elements of your stay did not meet your expectations.

We take your concerns seriously, particularly regarding cleanliness, the dining experience, and the service at our reception. Your comments about the smell in the corridor and the check-in experience are concerning, and we will be addressing them with our team to ensure improvements are made. Additionally, we apologize for the misunderstanding regarding the bar charges—this is certainly not the experience we aim to provide.

Your feedback is invaluable to us as we continuously strive to enhance the guest experience. Please know that we will be taking proactive steps to address these concerns. If you have any further details you'd like to share or if there's anything we can do to make it right, we would be happy to assist.

We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again and provide you with a much-improved stay.
text:
Stayed twice in recent weeks on overnight stays between two Sri Lankan Airlines flights having stayed there in the past. 

This could be a really nice hotel and it has some qualities, but a lot of aspects are also a little disappointing. 

The hotel is quite close to the airport (about 10 minutes drive) and has a bit of a resorty feel with nice greenery and a good pool. The rooms are clean but fairly basic - comfortable bed, shower room, fairly basic amenities (no bathrobe or slippers but soap, shampoo etc). 

The hotel shows a lot of wear and tear. On both my visits, the corridor by the room (transit passengers seem to be only given first floor rooms) had a really unpleasant smell of sick.

Restaurant quality has gone down since my earlier visits. Breakfast was fine, dinner ok, lunch not very good. As noted earlier, swimming pool is nice on the other hand. 

Finally, the biggest disappointment perhaps is that I didn't find staff very pleasant, especially reception. They just seemed bored and uninterested, took over 20 minutes for them to process the check in both times, and one of my two stays, the staff tried to charge me for a bar consumption I hadn't made. It took ages to resolve this and staff kept insisting on making me pay for this until a manager checked and found that most obviously, the signature on the bill had absolutely nothing in common with mine. 

Fine for an overnight transit and again the bed is comfortable which is good, but not quite as nice as it could be.
title: OK but a little disappointing

roomTip: Expect noise from planes, barking dogs, and early morning prayers—bring earplugs! The buffet is underwhelming, so consider dining elsewhere
text:
We stayed one night at Vivanta Colombo before flying to the Maldives the next day. It serves its purpose as an airport hotel, but don’t expect luxury.

While the drive up to the hotel is beautiful, with palm trees and fountains, the service upon arrival was underwhelming—no staff came out to help with our luggage, so our driver had to go inside to find assistance.

On the positive side, our room was very spacious, almost like a small apartment, with a kitchen, two bathrooms, and plenty of space (almost too much, haha!). The welcome fruit and cake platter was a highlight for our kids (5 and 7 years old).

However, the restaurant was a letdown. The buffet was uninspiring, small, and forgettable—we’ve had much better at other 4-star hotels in Sri Lanka. It felt temporary, just like the hotel itself, and that’s a shame because if the food had been better, we might have considered staying here again in a similar situation. The restaurant furniture was just as dull as the food, and the long walk to find the restaurant made it even less appealing.

The biggest issue was sleep quality—or lack thereof. While we expected some noise from airplanes, what really kept us up were the barking dogs throughout the night and the mosque next door, with morning prayers at 5:00 AM. With no proper soundproofing, this made for a very restless night, which isn’t ideal when you have an early flight.

Overall, this was the most underwhelming 4-star hotel we stayed at during our two-week trip in Sri Lanka. It feels old and tired, but if you need a place close to the airport with easy transport, it does the job.

Would we stay again? Only if necessary.
title: Convenient Airport location, but lacking in comfort

text:
We visited at the end of a rather tiring trip, selected this property because it is a Taj and due to its proximity to the airport (12-15min away).

The property is situated on a massive (35 acres!) plot and is well away from the main road. It isn't easy to access or leave unless you have some form of transport booked in advance.

While being tucked away does guarantee a bit of privacy, we felt it gave a very isolated and gloomy feel to the entire property. The dim lighting in the common areas, the complicated layout and very low yellow lighting in the rooms didn't help.

We opted for a higher category of room, but sorry to say it reeked of a typical mid range airport hotel - which honestly we didn't expect from a Taj. The sofa had stains and the linen was not clean. One of the towels was torn. I shudder to think what the lower category rooms were like.

The bathroom was moderately clean but layout a bit confusing (cupboards on either side of the sink). Amenities were sparse (no shower gel provided) and were not of great quality. Luckily we had our own shower gel and shampoo. 

The staff here are wonderful though, and almost make up for the gloomy and run-down property.  Special thanks to the kind Guest Relations officer.

I didn't try the pool or gym so can't comment.

We left too early for breakfast but the staff were kind enough to pack a sandwich for us which we ate en route to the airport.

In sum, definitely not a Taj. Reminded me of the age-old Gateway properties that don't exist in India anymore. Would highly recommend that you save your hard earned money, and stay at some other more cheerful and modern hotel in the vicinity.
title: Amazing staff, bit of a gloomy property

placeInfo/locationString: Gintota, Galle, Galle District, Southern Province
text:
We stayed at the Postcard for three nights. Theoretically, the hotel has everything it needs to be an outstanding hotel: only a handful of rooms, very kind staff throughout, a peaceful and idyllic location, beautiful colonial vibes. We loved the manager at the breakfast who also helped out at the reception. Prices inside the hotel are also fair, and the a la carte breakfast was excellent. For thus far, the hotel could be a gem, and my review could be short and positive.

Now come the big concerns, the hotel showed some big, big no-nos to us:

- Complete mayhem with our reservation beforehand (be careful!): the hotel requires a prepayment, which is of course fine. But the hotel wanted us to pay outside of Booking.com where we reserved, that is, through an internet link they sent us. After stating several times that we would prefer having the prepayment made through Booking.com (as it is done everywhere else we ever stayed), we paid through the link not to get the reservation canceled. That actually worked, we got a confirmation from the hotel by email. At the same time, a confirmation in the Booking.com chat was not given even after repeated requests. Then it became shady: we received another message from the hotel that we should use another link to register our card (once again?) despite the prepayment. Although this link looked sketchy, like a scam, and not like the previous one. Later that day, we indeed received another message from the hotel that we should not use any such link because it was „spam“. Were they hacked and someone is sending out scam links? It was really not clear what was going on, but it certainly was a horrible start. We reported this to the hotel manager, who downplayed the issue completely, saying that it was a standard „spam“ message sent out by Booking.com, although this was clearly not the case. I recommend everyone to be extremely careful with such payment links from the hotel. 
- Questionable practices with Tuktuks: Someone at the hotel seems to fight Uber and Pick me, two common and very comfortable options for ordering a cab or Tuktuk. As there is practically nothing around the hotel, you will likely need a Tuktuk to go places. The „regular“ prices one would negotiate are actually pretty high (~1500 LKR). Uber and Pick me are much cheaper (~400-500 LKR). Yet four different drivers independently told us that the hotel security would put drivers in trouble with the local Tuktuk association that wants to implement the higher prices instead. One driver said he would get beaten if the security guard noted his plate number and two of the drivers dropped us somewhere nearby so as not to be seen by security. We reported this to the hotel manager, who then spoke to his staff and a driver. The manager told us that the hotel had no such policy and basically that nothing like that could have ever happened. Again not sure what’s going on here, but the manager‘s story appears simply not credible given the four drivers reporting the same thing who have no incentive to invent this story after all. In any case, the hotel manager does not seem to care (enough). To us, this seemed like some kind of mafia thing going on, but at the minimum such practices are unprofessional and to the disadvantage of travelers like us. 
- Last but not least, we had several cockroaches in our bathroom during our stay. Although the hotel appeared very clean overall, I guess things like that may happen in countries like Sri Lanka (but also it was our only hotel here with cockroaches). The insects seemed to come through the bathroom sewage. The hotel absolutely needs to take action. We told the manager who sent someone to remove the cockroaches, and he apologized for the inconvenience, but that’s about it. 
- The second time we had cockroaches and we let him know after checkout, he did not even react anymore. The same goes for another message about a Tuktuk driver explaining the situation above. Overall, it’s seems like the manager (who was very friendly at first), does not care too much.
title: Could be outstanding but then…

placeInfo/address: 607/10 Colombo Road, Gintota, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Gintota, Galle, Galle District, Southern Province
roomTip: Not close to the beach but close to the Galle fort, maritime museum.
text:
Mixed reviews: I had my doubts when I dealt with Karan Kumar but the property had come with high recommendations, I decided to go ahead. The positives: Mr V.P Ajith, the operations manager at Galle, a rather humble man who went out of his way to get us a celebratory Anniversary cake.  
2) friendly staff- always helpful and smiling and very pro active.
3) love the anytime breakfast concept.
4) beds super comfy!!

Negatives: the rooms was paid in full and in advance but  the evening before (as I requested to settle any outstanding dues, as I head to head out to Colombo the next morning and it was an early start), I was handed an extra lkr 50,000 bill and I was told the Sri Lankan government had increased the taxes. Until that moment 
no one had informed me either in writing or otherwise about these additional charges. I got a written confirmation on the 2nd April of payment in full received and no additional charges were due. But when I check out on the 10th April, I am given an invoice of LKR 50000 + more!!
2) location is good for Galle Fort, Maritime museum but not so good for the beaches, surfing like the Ahangama beach.
3) pool rather small and jacuzzi in the room didn’t work.
4) no fridge or hair dryer in the room.

The background of the Oberoi group does no justice to the way hospitality is being practiced or conducted in The postcard hotel. A lot of too and fro finally managed to sort out the stress.
title: Wonderful staff, peaceful comfy setting..

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your feedback! We're glad you enjoyed the spacious rooms and the tea factory experience. Regarding the soundproofing, the tin sheets used for partitions are part of maintaining the authentic tea factory vibe, though they can limit soundproofing.

As for the pool, its outdoor location in the mountain range makes temperature control challenging, and we appreciate your understanding of the cooler water. We're also sorry for the room configuration issue and are working to avoid such misunderstandings in the future.

We value your feedback and are grateful for your recognition of our helpful team. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Thank you.

Regards
Buddhika Kohona
placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
We had a fairly decent stay at the hotel. Rooms are spacious and have a whole different vibe to match the tea factory experience. Rooms are not sound proof which is a downside. With the 30% off local residents offer , you can’t expect much variation in food items. All three meals were set menu and overall very normal, cant complain too much against the cost, but could have been better.
Pool is not heated, so bit uncomfortable until you get used to the cold water. There was a field visit sort of experience where you can experience the whole tea making process.
Need to mention that the reservation and management was helpful with amendments to my booking because I’ve accidentally booked for March instead of February. However our whole stay got complicated by the false advertising about having 2 double beds in Periya Dorei Family room, because the hotel allocated a single double bed and 2 single beds, which is very disappointing as they were unable to accommodate what has been advertised.
title: Fair stay at Mandaram Nuwara

text: Hotel location was good. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are large enough but the shower cubical was too small. The walls of the rooms are built from very cheep materials ( asbestos sheet & Metal sheets) . You can hear conversations clearly from other rooms. At midnight you can hear sounds even from 4 rooms away. Will never recommend this to a honeymoon couple or a couple who is ready to have private conversations with in their room. placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text: The property had one of the best scenic views I have experienced and the food and staff service from front office and restaurants were superb. The leaf to cup experience was a first-time experience and the guide did an excellent job in explaining the entire process. Due to the time restrictions we had to skip the waterfall trekking. This whole trip would have been a memorable one but due to the perverted actions of the spa therapist our entire trip was ruined. The spa therapist had tried to sexually harass my younger sister when she went in for a head massage. Although we had handed the manager a written statement of this disgusting event, we have not yet received any response from them regarding the action they have taken against this employee (Asanka). For any guest who is planning to visit this property, please refrain from visiting the spa.
title: Bad experience at Tea and Experience Factory

placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text: Tea & Experience Factory offers a great getaway in the middle of the hills. The renovated tea factory gets you up close and personal with Sri Lanka's famed tea industry and its past. The rooms are neatly renovated to demonstrate this past while the factory tour provides a unique insight into the tea-making process. The food is delectable and richly made. The culinary team at this hotel deserve a special award.
title: An amazing hideaway in the mountains

placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
The concept of tea and factory experience didn’t live up to the hype. I felt the overall attempt at the concept was a tad below par.

SriLankaN food was good western items need improvement 

Rooms and toilets very comfortable clean and spacious but sound proofing we felt was an issue.
title: Friends visited

placeInfo/name: Tea and Experience Factory - Thema Collection
text:
The staff were the only good thing about this hotel. Chathuranga, Viran and Rajitha are the only reason I gave the hotel 3 stars and not 1 star. Their service was outstanding- some of the best I’ve had in the country. Chathuranga accompanied us to a beautiful waterfall which was the highlight of the trip. Viran and Rajitha who were at the restaurant knew what we needed even before we asked. 

The hotel and amenities were however severely lacking. There was no soundproofing at all between the rooms and you could even hear conversations happening in adjoining rooms. While they did warn us about the lack of soundproofing, the reality was much worse than we anticipated. We were woken up at 6am on both days by snoring, running children and a plethora of other noises. 

I would strongly advise against booking this hotel if you are travelling with a group as there is no common area to relax or hang out. Because of COVID, we couldn’t use the indoor bar area. On our last night we were allowed to use the indoor tea machine area however the night before that, we had to make do with sitting outside in the cold. We couldn’t even use a room because we would disturb the other guests upstairs because of the lack of soundproofing. 

All in all, not a great experience.
title: The staff were the only good thing about this hotel

placeInfo/address: 59 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
A very comfortable hotel. Great location, wonderful breakfast, comfortable room. Unfortunately the day we checked in - was in all my years one of the worst experienced by us and fellow travellers. We had already completed part of the check in earlier on, was asked to return at 2. At 2, there were an entire gaggle of us with 3 overwhelmed staff dealing with exhausted passengers. We stood and we stood and we stood. At no time did we notice senior staff calming things down, instead there were older men in different coloured shirts hovering around … the other annoying piece was that there were a number of folks not standing in line, staff then continued to serve them over those of us who were in line… and we had to speak up/speak out and even then it did not change much. One check-in staff explained that there was some computer inter-face issue, so I wonder why we were all asked to check-in at the same time if you were aware of the issue. Also perhaps signage explaining there will be a delay???? It’s always about senior management, and I have been to other hotels where seniors staff are out and about making sure things are ok. 
I also wanted to add that while staff were friendly and helpful if one had a question, noticed that at the delicious breakfast there was lots of wait staff out and about, trying not to make eye-contact. An exception were the two fantastic hopper making ladies…. Once again management/leadership needs to up their game.
title: Great location, unfortunate check-in experience (hoping it is not a trend)

text:
When I checked in I was told my room was non smoking but I could smell stale smoke and the corridor when I exited the lift smelled of cigarettes.  Eventually I found matches so I knew it was a smoking room.  I went to reception and Luwis was very helpful and immediately moved me to a non smoking one.  The other plus was that I was able to decide a late check out for half the room price. 
Having stayed in several Cinnamon hotels during my time here where the rooms and bathrooms were well appointed,  I was disappointed here.  There were no hand towels, just bath towels.  There was soap (and shower gel/ shampoo in the shower) but nothing else,  not even a shower cap. There was toilet paper in the holder but no spare roll.  Also, arriving with a large suitcase, two back packs, a handbag, a shopping bag and a tube holding pictures, there was no one taking the bags to my room. And I am not young.  Fortunately I am fit and managed.  All in all it was a disappointing end to my holiday.
title: Disappointing end to my holiday

Dear Shammi,
Thanks for choosing Cinnamon Red Colombo.
We appreciate your review and understand your concerns regarding the recent changes in our operational procedures. We regret any inconvenience caused by the changes, particularly the removal of an early check-in and late check-out facility.
The changes are in direct response to the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority's (SLTDA) new minimum rate policy, which took effect on October 1st, 2023. According to this policy, hotels are required to adhere to a set minimum rate for their services, as well as follow certain guidelines laid by the authorities. We are seeking clarity on certain matters connected to the new guidelines, and our staff will be in touch with you once this has been obtained.
We hope this will not deter you from staying with us again.

text: I have booked this hotel three times so far, and even the 4th time this month, but this time I am not satisfied with the room. The reason for this is that we booked a room for three adults. That means 3 adults need three single beds, but we got 2 single beds and a sofa, that doesn't work at all (the sofa bed is for a child but for a person who is 190 cm and 91 kg, that's not good) In this one I have two more bookings this month! I hope I get the room as I expect it, otherwise we'll book another hotel next time.
title: Bed for 3 adults ( 1 adult need one bed not a sofa))

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Yosef,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay with us. We appreciate your review. 
Firstly, we'd like to address the issue of our staff's welcoming approach. At our property, we have a unique concept where we do not escort guests to their rooms or provide room introductions. This information is provided at the point of check-in as well as printed on the keycard pouch for easy reference. We understand that this approach may differ from what you have experienced in other hotels, but it's designed to give guests the freedom to settle in at their own pace. However, we are always available to assist guests with any requests, including luggage assistance, upon their request.
In regards to the bathroom issue, we take your feedback seriously and have conducted a thorough investigation. It's reassuring to know that there were no issues before your arrival, after your departure, or during the current occupancy of the room. This suggests that the problem may have been related to the use of the flush button. We appreciate your understanding in this matter.
We would like to clarify that our breakfast service follows international standards. Plates are made available on the buffet, and guests are encouraged to help themselves. We apologize if you were not aware of this.
Your feedback regarding our staff's demeanor is essential to us, and we regret if you felt our team was not as responsive as you expected. 
While we aim to provide a sophisticated and comfortable environment, we apologize if your overall experience did not meet your expectations.
Thank you for choosing our hotel, and we look forward to the possibility of serving you better in the future.
Best regards!
placeInfo/address: 59 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: Staff was not very welcoming. 4 people are standing in the desk, no one to be inviting over. No smiles at all. Promised “small compliment” for our honeymoon, got none. No help with luggage. No room introduction. Room is okay, bathroom was broken (spring of flush sometimes got stuck, had to wait for hot water). Breakfast was messy, had to ask for glasses and plates, staff was ignoring until approached. Overall feel of a very fancy hotel and snob staff, while in reality it does not meet its own standards, and does not worth the money. If you been to other Cinnamon hotels, this one is different.
title: Of all Cinnamon experiences, worst one.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your review following your recent stay.

We'd like to address your comments as follows:
In terms of transportation options, we do not provide a shuttle service. The taxis at the hotel are available as a service, and to be used at the discretion of our guests. We are aware that there are cheaper options available.
Regarding dining, we offer a variety of options. Our à la carte lunch is available at our 8th-floor flavored restaurant from 12 noon to 2:30 p.m., and in-room snack delivery service is accessible from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. In the evenings, our CloudRed Bar serves a tapas menu from 5 p.m. to 11:30 p.m. 

Luggage service is available upon request, and guests are welcome to wait in our lobby on level 7.

We apologize if you were unaware of the facilities that are available at Cinnamon Red Colombo.

Best Wishes!
placeInfo/address: 59 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: Average Hotel. No place to wait near the gate, no shuttle service, no luggage service. No Alacarte food facility. Rich buffet but very expensive. Hotel taxi rates multiple times of the taxi rates available outside hotel.
title: Business visit during 5th to 9th Sep'23 to LK

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Jennifer, 
Thank you for choosing Cinnamon Red Colombo for your recent visit.
We acknowledge your ratings and are delighted to note that you enjoyed the view and the breakfast we offered 
Regarding the incident at the infinity pool, upon reviewing our CCTV footage, we have observed that the individuals seen taking photographs by the pool were indeed our guests, including the visiting chefs who were staying over at Cinnamon Red, as they were a part of a competition taking place in Colombo. It is important to note that our staff are prohibited from carrying personal mobile phones while on duty, and the official phones provided to them do not have cameras installed.

Best wishes!

text: Staff need training to not stare and take photos when a lone woman is swimming in the pool. they also need to communicate better between their teams. Despite that, the staff were polite. Breakfast was great and room and view were great.
title: Great but staff nee more training.

 We are delighted to see that you enjoyed your visit and our facilities; it is always such a pleasure to read reviews from our guests.
