text: We had a surprise birthday party for my husband at their restaurant.the place was recommended by finance department staff Ishan Perera and I was directed to Wasim f&b manager. I must thank Wasim and the team for their excellent service and the crew was very friendly and supportive.specially the billing counter staff and tuan & Rusiru.
title: Surprise birthday party at Flavoured restaurant

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Fantastic location in the tea plantation hill county.

Colonial style hotel. There’s a nice feel here. 

The open communal lounge area inside is a nice space. Interesting books on local wildlife and tea plantation history. There are also some lovely photos of the owner and his family and some local people. 

The covered veranda dining area outside is also lovely with beautiful views across the valley and hills opposite. 

There’s a chance to chat to other guests in this environment. 

The main person on site (duty manager?) who looked after us was a lovely polite young man - I didn’t get his name. He was very attentive and had excellent English and was happy to advise on things to do. 

We took a walk to One Tree Hill - lovely views - takes about 1 hour to get there - take about 300-500 rupees per person as there is an entry fee to the site.

The walk to the waterfall in the grounds was nice - not far - but a steep short climb back up - you’ll puff a bit! 

The pool is a nice spot to relax in the sun. There’s a small slide at one end - which is fun but there’s quite a quick drop - hold your nose!! And take care as there’s a hole in the pool floor.

Unfortunately I have to make a few slightly negative comments. It feels wrong to complain about some of these things in a country where the majority of people generally have very little. But the hotel costs are quite high/getting close to western prices and if it wants to continue to do so some improvements are needed.
The general style appears to be shabby sheek if I’m polite - but it is tending more towards the shabby at the moment - the hotel does need a bit of TLC. Curtain pole fell off wall in one room. Lightbulb fell off bedside lamp in the other - exposing the electric cable. Blinds didn’t all open properly. Some ripped. Drain in floor of pool not covered leaving potentially hazardous hole. 
The food was Ok to good. Western style mostly. Sensible portions compared to some other hotels we stayed in where there was excess and waste - so that was good. But it wasn’t excellent food and it was very expensive for what it was.
The tea plantation tour I also thought was a little disappointing - I expected to walk through a larger area/go further in to the plantation. Instead we walked up the drive and along the local road (which we’d already done ourselves) We did meet some of the pickers for a short while and did get some interesting information but it wasn’t very in depth and the guide at times seemed a bit more interested in taking silly posed photos for us. 

Overall a nice stay in a very special spot. Lovely polite management staff. With a bit of investment in repairs and refurbishment, this could be an exceptional hotel.
title: Lovely spot. Kind polite staff. Could be exceptional but needs some refurbishment. Meals overpriced for what they were.

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an enjoyable time at Ashburnham but the hotel is in need of some TLC to keep it looking like the photos on the website.

Our first night was in the smallest room (The Bay Room) which looks out at a wall.  The room just needed some money spending as the sofa had water stains on it, the paint was peeling and the white wall and floor outside was grey and unattractive to look out on - not helped that dogs had done their business out there! 

We were moved after one night to a much nicer room - although still the windows did not shut properly and you could not lock the door (not that this was a problem for us in such a small hotel but still I mention as it may be for some).

The food is ok but the Western dishes are priced very highly.  The first night's dinner was not very nice (perhaps we just ate after other guests and our fish had been left for a long time as it was very dry and came in a pineapple sauce which seemed odd.) After the first night we asked for Sri Lankan food and the staff were super accommodating (especially lovely Vish) and the food we ate after that was very good and was offered to us at half the price of the Western food. 

The staff are lovely and we greatly appreciated their efforts taking a picnic down to the lovely waterfall for us. We also did a nice guided walk up One Tree Hill and saw much more tea than is visible around the hotel. (I mention this as the tea was a big thing for me. My husband was born on a tea estate in India and I have always wanted to go and see a tea estate, but now there is very little actually around the hotel at Asburnham and the trees have been allowed to grow so tall that the views from the hotel are limited.) 

All in all, the staff are great, very friendly and hard working, but the owner needs to spend some money on the hotel as it simply does not look like the photos.
title: A lovely hotel in need of some TLC

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
I have to preface this review by saying that we ended up having a very relaxing and enjoyable time at Ashburnham despite a shaky start. I write this review with mixed feelings as Ashburnham lodge was intended to be the culmination of our holiday in Sri Lanka - a bit of luxury before we headed home.  There are a number of reasons why I can’t give this hotel a five star review;
On arrival, after a very awkward interaction, we established that the lodge was unable to serve alcohol. They had had it all confiscated by the authorities as they are not licensed. They did send someone to purchase some alcohol for us but I feel this disclosure should have come before our arrival as we had been in contact several times. 
The rooms: While quaint and clean, our room had a lingering musty, damp smell and no air conditioning. The decor is intended to reflect that of an old english colonial home but in many respects, it is in dire need of upgrading. There are fiddly complimentary liquid soaps etc, again far from worthy of a four star rating. 
The food: dinner was good, small portions but adequate. 
Wifi: There is limited access in the rooms and unreliable access in the main dining area. It is fair to note that we were there during the Easter terror attacks so internet access could have been affected by this. 
We did the cooking course with Reggie, the chef - it was great! He is a very accomplished chef and so willing to share his knowledge. 
My son did the naturist walk with Anna which he loved. 
All in all, this accommodation felt more like a home stay, not the luxury we were expecting and certainly paying for.  I think this is where the photos and advertising is slightly misleading. 
I have since taken the time to thoroughly read through all of the reviews and suggest that if you are considering Ashburnham, you do the same. Many of the comments are quite justified - I just wish I’d taken more care to do so before choosing this hotel. I am certainly not sorry with our choice, I just wish I had been more informed. Nonetheless, the staff were exceptionally responsive and helpful and it truly is a magical location.
title: Family holiday

placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: This really is a stunning setting but the lack of AC really was a problem for us and meant sleeping was near on impossible. Our room was small but it was only a standard so would avoid that as all the other rooms looked very spacious. I get what they are trying to offer here which is a unique experience but it does need some TLC to bring it up to standard. The pool area needs attention and more seating and the bathroom needed updating plus we could only close our door if we locked it - perhaps they have plans for this? The guide Anna was lovely and very knowledgeable plus the chef here is very good so they have this part sorted. Phi and Bryony are very helpful but feel this is a bit of an extended gap year for them plus they did have friends staying so perhaps that was a bit of a distraction. We couldn't understand why the owner doesn't employ Sri Lankan hosts. This was booked as part of a tour so perhaps I should have checked for AC as this was our main problem, I accepted this hotel based on the reviews so feel I need to honest as it won't suit everyone.
title: Faded Grandeur

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your feedback and we are sorry that you didn’t have a great time with us. We are pleased though that the friends who you were travelling with did actually decide to extend their stay by an extra night. 

We very much tried to go out of our way to make you as comfortable and welcome as possible, such as the very late dinner on your arrival night at 11pm, meaning that our kitchen staff were not released from duty until 1am. 

With reference to price we are certainly not in the 5 star bracket at under $149 for a double room and most of our guests find both accommodation and dining very good value and plenty of variety with the option of both western and Sri Lanka dishes. 

Lastly we are incredibly proud of our management and staff (most of whom are from the surrounding villages which we are keen to promote) and we run as a homely guesthouse, which again is normally received very well by our guests. 

We wish you all the best in your onward travels.
placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Priced at five star level but delivering sub standard service with poorly trained but polite and energetic staff. Daily menu is aimed at a European palette with minuscule portions and exorbitant wine prices. Locals may need to carry their own food & drinks to feel content. Location and view is super but I wouldn't stay there again.
title: Great location but inexperienced management!

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you very much for your feedback.
We do value all of our guests opinions and feedback very much. 

The pool is cleaned every morning by our groundsmen but there is a problem with the filter, which has been ordered and will be replaced very soon.
Reggie’s food is normally a highlight for our guests so we are extremely sorry you didn’t receive the same standards. Cold food is certainly not acceptable. Should you decide to come back we would be delighted to offer you a complimentary dinner for 2 people.

Whilst many guests enjoy the style of the hotel in terms of its décor we also understand the need for continue review and updating so again thank you for you comment on these.

We do hope to welcome you back to Ashburnham.

The Ashburnham Management.
placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Amazing location but there were many setbacks. Starting from the pool it wasn't clean at all, the food was ice cold and the service isn't that great. There was only one person servicing all the guests although he did a great job, it wasn't convenient.
I guess the rooms need to be updated since you charge a price similar to that of a 4 star hotel in colmbo.
I loved the whole concept of the bungalow. Very quiet and peaceful.
I guess I would love to visit again if not for the above limitations.
title: Misty Mountains

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Reviewer
Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts, we appreciate the many lovely comments you made. However, we are shocked to hear that you felt the food to be disappointing; looking through our guestbook there is praise after praise for the food. Whilst you were staying with us, you had the rice and curry for lunch and dinner for two days, I’m surprised you had it so often if you say you were not enjoying it. We serve a range of Western dishes, which you could have chosen. We are friendly, socialable hosts and are always available; therefore, if you had any problems we were here for you to raise them to and are disappointed you didn’t mention your thoughts when we could have done something to rectify it. 
As stated on our website, there is a range of activities that you can do whilst staying at Ashburnham Estate, including beautiful walks and stunning scenery to enjoy, you can also take day-trips to Kandy, Dambulla and Sigiriya; no guest should ever get bored!
placeInfo/address: B416 - Elkaduwa Road, Elkaduwa 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Loved the location of this bungalow, off the usual tourist path and surrounded by the tea plantations. Watching and learning about the tea picking process was excellent and there is a good walk to an old factory nearby.

The staff are lovely and the rooms are spacious and comfortable.  The pool is nice for a dip and the lounge comfortable for relaxing. The house is a little tired looking in places.

I was disappointed by the food. Very expensive by Sri Lankan standards ($28 for 2) and very (I never expected to say this about sri lankan food) bland!  One day we were given the same curries for lunch and dinner, one dish we really disliked and didn't eat it yet we got it again that evening. Another evening the dinner was completely cold. We were never asked if the food was ok. There is no where else to eat and the food is extra to the room price.

Overall, it is a nice place to stay but over priced compared to other places. There isn't lots to do in the area, one or two nights would be enough.
title: Lovely location, food disappointing

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text: In line with a previous review, we have a mitigated point of view for this hotel. Of course the architecture of the hotel is fantastic and the remote location in the mountains near tea gardens is also great … and maybe it is worth visiting it for this … also, lunch and dinner that are included are really gourmet style ….BUT because there are several BUT … there is absolutely no soundproofing for the cabin as there are open to outdoors … this means that you can ear whatever is happening in the cabin next to you… the service is not a five star hotel one: the lady at the spa reception is not at all friendly … there are usually shortage of towels at spa … and there is almost no resting seats at spa (2 only !)… the take away breakfast for our last day was very average … even not a bottle of water in it …. AND … and it is not the least all services are overpriced (and we met some clients that were also sharing the same view and were chocked at the prices). Being a remote place you may want to take a massage there as part of your retreat … but you should know that any massage here will cost you approx 4 to 5 times more than in any other places in Sri Lanka . … even twice the price of a luxury hotel we vis sites in Sigiriya … the cheapest 1 hour massage is approx 200 dollars … on another aspect a cocktail is 21 dollars … something you may want to be aware of before going there …. As strangely once you try to access the spa menu from their website for example it is not working . This hotel is an architecturally interesting cash machine
title: Architecturally interesting cash machine

placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
Quelle déception l endroit est magnifique perdu au milieu de nul part mais c est tout
Ah si la cuisine et le personnel
Sinon il faut presque des bottes pour aller dans sa chambre . La chambre est sans plus et surtout sans clim et ouvert à tous les bruits. La nature mais aussi les voisins. Le spa une plaisanterie , dommage car c est très jolie. Le prix des massages à ne pas en faire . Aucun service à la piscine même pas une glacière avec un peu d eau. Et ne pas oublié plus d une heure de kandy
title: Quel dommage

ownerResponse/text:
Dear tlhtlh,

Thank you for the very detailed analysis and the review. We apologise for short comings you have experienced such as steam and sauna being not on or the therapist croaking. These are not certainly up to the standards we have set over 6 years. 

Unfortunately though you are referring to our responses as defensive or pointing out other reviews, that is not the case, We are just pointing out facts. While an individual review is an opinion of a personal experience and expectations and understanding,  its a fact that Santani has a FIVE star rating over 6 years and over 96% of our guests recommend us. It is the same over every rating platform from google, Expedia, Booking.com etc and we are in the top 5% of properties globally. On top of that, experts in the industry from Travel + Leisure, CNT, CNN Travel, BBC Travel, Telegraph, TIME, Forbes, How to Spend it on FT, etc etc has rated us as one of the best hotels, wellness retreats, etc in the world with Travel and Leisure listing us as the best global wellness retreat just 3 months ago and TIME listing us as one of the 100 greatest places on earth.

The above is not positioning or marketing but facts. We do not understand your intentions as you kept trying to say you were an expert in design and architecture to food to spa etc but above ratings and recognitions is the summary of over 3000 guest feedback and its not about us being defensive or giving excuses. 

You may have noticed since you have analysed other reviews as well that just few reviews below there was a couple who extended their stay within 5 minutes of arrival around the same time period you stayed. So while we absolutely respect your personal opinion, we are just responding with the overall feedback we have received from over 3000 guests over 6 years. 

We understand Santani is unique and we are not about being a product. Its not about selling a room, a meal, a spa treatment. Its about creating feelings and peace of mind. Unfortunately, anyone looking at Santani as a simple physical product will fall short. Unfortunately, your stay seems to be focused on analysing with the purpose of reviewing rather than enjoying your stay. We also noticed that you did not review any other property in Sri Lanka. Also you refer to another property to point our that its an excellent brand but spa treatments are cheaper. What you had missed is that hotel has a much lower rating than Santani in every platform but their overall rates are double that of Santani. 

Thank you,
placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
- Get a driver to take you around SL. Santani provides driver accomm.
- depending on time of year, book for 1 night, and see if you like it
text:
- Summary - 

A beautiful property in a beautiful location with attentive staff, let down by an overall low price to value ratio. Santani’s marketing implies an alternative eco luxury experience for the discerning, but the product falls short of the entry price and the hotel’s ‘positioning’ ends up feeling more like an excuse for its shortcomings.

- The Details - 

We booked the Mountain View Suite for one night, with the intention to stay for three if we loved the hotel. 24 Hours in Santani gives you space to experience the product. We experienced the full board (three meals), had a 90 minute SPA treatment on day one and used the SPA facilities, did morning Yoga on day 2, and chose to relax by the pool instead of opting in for one of the other activities (a hike or walk to the river). The option to extend had been communicated to management and the availability was open, but we chose to end our stay after one night and see the rest of what Sri Lanka had to offer. A guest we spoke to indicated they wished they had chosen a similar strategy.

- Property - 

The property is in a beautiful location and it’s a mission to get to (just ask our local driver). The design is respectful of the landscape and well integrated within it. There is a special silence in the place, and you do feel as though you are occupying a part of the natural world that is occupied by few. When the wind blows you hear a soothing whistling in the trees unfamiliar for those of us who live in large cities.

The pictures are an accurate representation of what you’ll find overall. The SPA design felt a little basic and given its importance to the property did not meet expectations. I would liken the design to almost like a military barracks, with some nice touches like large  indoor/ outdoor massage spaces.

Arrival is quite special. After ascending a winding jungle road you are greeted with a beverage and checked in at a concrete pavilion away from the main property. This is also where you check out.

- Mountain View Suite -

Each suite is an independent outbuilding, this is nice and creates a sense of privacy. We opted for twin beds as we were friends sharing. However, some suites are closer then is ideal, if I was there with my partner I’d worry about noise transfer.

As pictured, the view and panorama from the suite is spectacular and really wonderful to wake up to. However, for me - this is completely let down by a critical design feature. This is a design feature also mentioned by other reviewers, and so we were aware of it before coming to the property.

To be clear, I am a lover of design and have commissioned my own architecture-led renovation projects. At ~$1000 per night, nobody, nobody can convince me that building Suites with unenclosed toilets was a good idea. You are literally defecating and urinating in the same open space as the bedroom, and there is not enough distance between the toilet and living area to ensure that bathroom ‘noise’ isn’t heard in the living space. I was here with a friend, so we rotated out of the room, which I think is ridiculous for this ticket price. If I was here with my girlfriend we would have done the same (is it romantic to listen to each other poo?). There is nothing discerning or interesting about this design choice, by objective architecture and design standards it’s bad, and just not justifiable for a hotel charging these fees.

I can’t remember if there was a turn down service, I think there was. However, having experienced other hotels in the region Santani needs to do a better job; you share the domicile with insects (the hotel is transparent about this), so in keeping with the standards set by much cheaper hotels in Sri Lanka - the bed area should be enclosed with the mosquito net as part of the turn down for when you return to your room after dinner (@santani - this is east to implement)

Other much cheaper hotels provided natural / eco Mosquito Repellent and natural / eco After Sun in the room - Santani didn’t. I’m a mosquito magnet and got mauled by mosquitos at Santani. 

- Staff - 

Are courteous, nice, personal, and balance formality and informality well. 

- SPA Treatments - 

The SPA ecosystem in Sri Lanka is very mature, and it has the best price to value ratio for treatments I’ve experienced anywhere in the world. We had amazing massages at 5 star hotels ($40 for both a 90 minute and 60 minute signature massage), and at small village outlets ($10). We always paid a fraction of what we would in Europe.

Unfortunately, Santani has elected for a different model.

The SPA treatments at Santani are the most expensive we experienced in Sri Lanka. A fellow guest brought up the subject poolside and said the same. For two massages (both 90 minutes), our bill was $400. The Aman in Galle - one of the premiere luxury hotel brands in the world - charges $125 for its signature 90 minute massage.

Our trip to Santani was very much about relaxation, and at this price point we had high expectations - they were not met.

My masseuse was croaking and clearing his throat constantly during my treatment, which for 45 minutes (until the loud rain blocked out the sound) was distracting and not commensurate with the price point. I did ask him if he needed to take a minute to clear his throat, and he politely said no, I didn’t want to press the issue for fear of being rude to him. I was also positioned in the massage bed in a way that bent my neck as if I was looking up - I didn’t realise it at the time but it killed my neck until I adjusted after the first 30 minutes. I didn’t want to complain about him to management for fear of getting him in trouble as he was a nice man (@Santani - speak to your whole team). The massage itself was good, but there was nothing phenomenal, differentiated or memorable about it to justify the premium.

The nicest element was that it was partially outdoors but covered, and the hard rain was soothing. I had not experienced that combination before. The masseuse encouraged me to come back for another massage to address some back issues we discussed and asked me the next day how my back was doing which was nice. There was absolutely no way I was going ‘back’. 

Before the massage you are encouraged to use the SPA facilitates, to steam, sauna and dip in the thermal pool. Both the Steam and Sauna had not been switched on. This is unacceptable, how hard is it to prepare the facilities for your guests at this price point? I switched both of them on myself and they didn’t start functioning before we started the treatments. They were ready for use (and functioning well) after our treatments, and also being used by other guests.

The thermal pool is really nice, and nicely designed, but nothing about it justifies the highest SPA costs we experienced in Sri Lanka.

Also one of the showers didn’t work (I think there are two). 

- Pool - 

Nice and relaxing, with incredible views and nature happening all around. Albeit small and shallow. The growth of the jungle has mostly obscured the infinity view of the long side of the pool.

- Dining - 

At check in you’re walked to the main lobby building which feels very woowoo, where you sit, take in the views, and the chef asks if you have any dietary requirements and if you want western or Sri Lankan meals (for a short stay not based around a package or goal, this is the extent of the personalised menu, and similar to other hotels in Sri Lanka).

I opted for Sri Lankan as I had and continued to do all trip. This gave me a good view of what good looked like. I’d say the food at Santani is fine compared to the standards set at properties across the country. It absolutely does feel clean, and healthy, and home made. Other reviewers think the food is amazing here, I am really into food, and I do not think it is. You can take that for what it’s worth to you :). 

As someone who is not trying to lose weight, and needs to eat to keep weight on - the portions were too small for me, so by dinner time I asked for additional portions and the team were very willing and provided them. It’s slightly uncomfortable to ask for ‘more’ in a relatively formal setting, so I think this should be offered up front given the intention of the resort is to cater for different client health needs and goals.

- Yoga - 

Morning Yoga was really excellent. It was a 90 minute session, challenging, with a phenomenal instructor who showed passion and humour. It was memorable to do the practice early in the morning, on an open polished concrete platform, with the sound of nature, and the sun breaks through the trees. I also spotted a TRX which I’d have used if I stayed longer (as there is no gym).

- Management response -

I’ve noticed the management approach on Trip Advisor tends to be quite defensive. I don’t think this is a good look for a luxury hotel and not in keeping with the standards of the industry. I’d like to advise the management to stop;

(I) pointing to other excellent customer reviews as evidence there is nothing wrong with your service

(II) implying that the issue is actually with the customer, and them not understanding your product (it’s really not that different or hard to understand) 

(III) making excuses instead of actively addressing the issues your customers raise, in order to improve the overall delivery of your product.

- Would I recommend Santani -

I’m not sure.
title: Does not meet expectations

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Luis, 
 
Thanks for the positive comments on the views, room, pool, spa etc.
 
We are also sorry to hear about your experience specially on the service and food as we have have a 100% record on service and food. Even the review that came on the same day from someone who stayed the same time has confirmed that Santani gave them the best service and cuisine in whole of Sri Lanka. This has been a key focus for us and continually strive toupgrade the skills of our team and service. 
 
We have undertaken a thorough investigation of your comments and unfortunately we believe some of your negative comments are factually incorrect and genuinely questionable.
  
You had contacted us and had asked for a special rate saying you are a Travel Agent and in the process of setting up a new Travel Agency and this was a Familiarisation visit. We have made an exception (as we do not provide discounts unless its from an existing travel agent) and had given you a discounted rate that is less than half the 300 pounds you claim you paid for a view. We deal with over 200 travel agents and has hosted many an agent on familiarisation visits and no agent posts reviews on TripAdvisor as its simply unethical as an agent to do so. You are promoting multiple properties and your review can be influenced by a competing property. Agents on familiarisation visits discuss with us if there are any aspects that may not work well for their guests and we work around them and inform the potential clients about the design and why certain things are a certain way.
 
It seems you had simply lied to get a lower industry rate.
 
You say Santani is 1.5 - 2 hours away from Kandy and 4 hours from Sigiriya, which both incorrect. We are not sure where you came from or which route you took when you arrived but Kandy city center with the Temple is only 1 hr away and Sigiriya is only 2.5 hours.  
 
Also, conceptually, we believe you have not understood Santani nor has sought understanding, which is the main goal of a Familiarisation visit. In fact you have not even asked for a fact sheet. All mountain view chalets have the same breathtaking view and you don't have to be lucky if you opt for a mountain view chalet, which we have 16. We have discussed the lack of a door in the toilet many a times and it’s a conceptual element where we want any guest to be 100% comfortable with yourself and who you are with. That is when you achieve true freedom and happiness as well. Also, though there is no door, no one can see inside the toilet, which is its own cubicle. These are all parts of the overall concept of getting our guests as close as possible to nature with an architectural silence in our buildings aimed at achieving an emotional silence, which is the new luxury and an intelligent luxury. It’s not at all about paying just for a view.
 
Whilst we always welcome genuine and constructive feedback from our customers, we believe in this instance majority of the comments are factually incorrect or misrepresented.

Thank you,
Vickum
placeInfo/address: Aratenna Estate Rd, Werapitiya 20908 Sri Lanka
text:
Interesting minimalistic concept on top of a mountain.
It is located 1.5-2h away from Kandy and almost 4h away from Sigiriya.
Service is really bad. Management is totally absent. Very poor service in the restaurant where the waiters didn’t even know the soft drinks available. The staff try their best but they need more training.
Very disappointing dinner, small portions and not very tasty. Breakfast is ok, a la carte.
Breathtaking views if you are lucky with your cabin.
The only problem was that there is no door in the toilet so no privacy at all. Rooms are very clean and beds are comfortable.
The pool is ok but quite small.
WiFi only in your room.
SPA, luxurious but they didn’t have availability to book a massage, they gave us the option to book it at 8am the following day. 
Bring a jumper as mornings and evenings are quite chilly.
I think this hotel is a great idea but it’s in the wrong country... would you pay £300+ for a view?
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get upper room for best river view
text: The hotel occupies a stunning spot overlooking the river with distant hill views. Up an insanely steep hill and close enough to town to get in and out quickly. The owner/manager converted it from his house and it is small enough to be charming and intimate. Our room was good but felt a little tired - also our bathroom had a treacherously slippy floor, shared by the toilet and shower. We stayed a couple of nights and didn't have dinner - the breakfasts were excellent. The hotel has no pool but offers free access to a large pool at a hotel down the road - I went for a quick swim and this worked perfectly. The welcome was a little brisk and efficient (and we got some misleading advice about how far away our resto booking was) but, as ever in this country, the local staff were wonderfully polite, charming and efficient. No real complaints but we'd recommend staying at  the Kandy House (stunning old building with modern flourishes, awesome restaurant) rather than here
title: Great views but

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We were looking forward to our two night stay unfortunately the lack of air conditioning in our room made it quite uncomfortable at night. We did however have lovely views from the terrace. What made up for the shortcomings in the room was the enthusiastic service from the lovely young staff who were a delight and very very helpful.
title: lovely Sri Lankan staff

ownerResponse/text:
People are different - and places are different, and sometimes it happens that both do not match. From the very beginning in 2003 we never ever had a swimming pool at our premises (put down in a hotel, you can see from Villa Rosa the pool we offer our guests incl. transport free of charge). We never had TV in the rooms and we never ever had a telefon in the room. This we explain on our webpage and those guests who need these facilities have chosen the wrong place. About ants and mosquitoes we think they are part of Sri Lanka - but they should not be in your bed- or bathroom. We try to divert them but it does not make any sense to us to realise a building where you integrate inside and outside in a very special location once you want to ban ants and mosquitoes from the premises. You can put poision everywhere, you can seal every room - but we do not want to do that. Our guests can enjoy breakfast or dinner outside with a view - but there might be one or two mosquitoes. For that we have citronella.
Yes we are in the capotal of the hill country - with a very special view - but to enjoy that, you have to climb the hill. Thats life.
placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: This is a boutique hotel, so no in room service such as mini bar/tea and coffee making/televisions. A simple room with en-suite. Wifi is a little problematic from some of the rooms and is switched off over night to avoid them getting huge and unexpected bills. Staff are friendly and you have a choice of either Western or Local for dinner. You can specific times for breakfast/evening meal as they cater to you. They have an arrangement with another hotel to use their pool, but we didn't go due to our itinerary. Villa has three dogs when we stayed. Friendly enough, but if you don't like dogs it could be an issue. One big problem for us was the ants on the wall - they didn't bother us, so we didn't bother them - but not a great sight in both the bedroom and bathroom. We could have called them to see to them, but we just didn't. It overlooks the river and at dusk you can see the fruit bats flies out. We were bothered by the mosquitoes. Bigger than the ones we see back home and they liked us. We'd been in country and not been troubled - here we were bitten several times despite repellent. Thankfully only stayed for a couple of nights. we could have faced the bites for longer than that. The drive to and from the villa is through a number of narrow and winding roads up into the hills. Our room was the only one with AC we were told. We assume the other rooms had fans.
title: Good location and views - shame about the mosquitoes

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
As all the reviews say, the views from Villa Rosa are stunning, the Sri Lankan food is delicious and the staff are really friendly.

Our first room (3) had a broken boiler so cold showers for us. The owner was extremely disinterested in our situation and delegated the problem to the staff who said they'd fix it by morning. It was a rough night as the bed wasn't very comfortable either.

The next morning the lovely staff transferred us to the honeymoon suite and that was much better. We had hot water, water pressure and a good night's sleep. 

We wouldn't go back.
title: Honeymoon suite was great

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: I really wanted to give this hotel a 5 star review, because the location is stunning, the terraces beautiful and our room (the honeymoon suite) enormous and luxurious, with its own wonderful terrace and fabulous new bathroom. The whole place is very clean and well appointed and the views over the river are beautiful. But, out of all the hotels we stayed at during our 16 days in beautiful Sri Lanka, it was the only one where we didn't feel a real sense of Sri Lankan hospitality. There was no real welcome as such when we arrived - no manager visible, although the German owner was around, but not very friendly and rather unapproachable initially. There were no welcome notes in the bedroom with information about meal times, menus, bar prices, wifi etc... we had to continually find one of the staff and ask, which made us feel uncomfortable.(we had no idea how much we were paying for drinks until we got the bill at the end of our stay) The staff themselves were all very polite, pleasant and keen to help, but to be honest they seemed a bit out of their depth at times and when things went wrong ( no red wine available to have with our evening meal - " sorry we have no red wine in the house' - being told there was no bacon for breakfast after being offered it when our order was taken; my evening meal arriving forty minutes after my husband's) they did their best to help, and were very apologetic, but there was never any sign of a manager to deal with the issues. Also there were three dogs in residence - we are both dog lovers, but didn't really appreciate having dogs around our table as we were eating - some people would find this very off putting. There are many excellent reviews here for this hotel, and indeed many aspects of our stay were superb - but both my husband and I felt that this could be a truly top notch establishment with just a bit more effort from the owner and/or manager (whoever he or she might be).
title: beautiful place, but disappointing in some ways

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We loved the location up in the hills above Kandy, overlooking forests and a large river far below. We had rooms in the first floor of a separate house, one for our family of four and one for the nanny. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated, with two bathrooms and a narrow but long balcony towards the road leading down to Kandy. All beds had mosquito nets.

We had some problems with the hot water and the water pressure during the first day, then it was fixed, but the pressure was never very high.

Food was good, we had breakfast and dinner daily and one occational lunch. The curries were quite hot, but you could also order western food for the children.

Service was good, the hotel arranged pick-up from the airport in Colombo, which was convenient. We also used their tuk-tuks and the van for different excursions in the Kandy area.

The only thing that disturbed us were the hotel dogs, which were barking away at wild hogs and other things at night, regulary waking us up. And the bread van, which announced its daily arrival at 6.45 with a very loud and peristing tune.
title: Wonderful location

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: honeymoon suite is lovely if you can afford it. no A/C but not needed as it is quite breezy.
text: This boutique hotel is very well located, assuming you have a car with driver who can negotiate the steep climb up to the top of a hill, from which the views are admittedly amazing. We splurged for the honeymoon suite as all the others were taken. The room is fantastic and made us feel like Kandyan royalty. The service, however, was lacklustre at best, in part due to the owner who doesn't seem to care much about his guests, in part due to not terribly well trained local staff, which seems to be quite common in Sri Lanka. There is no accommodation for drivers, we could not access the wifi from our room and we were charged for a "complementary" welcome drink which had been promised to us on arrival. Not a bad stay overall, but we stayed in much nicer and cheaper places throughout our trip.
title: wonderful location, beautiful room if you can afford it, grumpy owner

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Touring Sri Lanka throughout the month of January we began to get a real feel for the quality of hotel and service on our trip. Had this been the only hotel we stayed at my opinion would be different. But after 7 hotel stays this was the worst, or to be fair....the least excellent. The stay was ruined by the total inability of the German proprietor to interact with the guests, using instead his Sri Lankan staff to muddle on without proper training.
We were not greeted upon our arrival. No one said goodbye when we left. We were not informed about the eating arrangements, not told about the set menu each night, not told about the bell to be used in the absence of a room telephone. There was no reception area. It was a stay that was a d-i-y (do it yourself) experience. A message to the owner. Please train your wonderful staff on how to meet, greet and interact with the guests. Please make an effort. Do not simply sit behind a desk with your wonderful dog and expect that everything will sort itself out. Your guests need to be looked after. You have one asset and one asset only. That is the stunning location of this hotel and the undoubted loyalty of your (largely untrained) Sri Lankan staff.
title: A disappointment amongst truly memorable hotels

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Helpful and friendly staff. Food reasonable but not amazing. Perfect to explore Kandy and go to the Perehera (an elephant festival in August)  which was fantastic and the highlight of our stay.
title: Simple hotel with stunning views.

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We were "out of season" so proved to be the only guests.

I think that the first thing to say is that it is better to count this as being a private house in which you will be a guest, rather than counting it as even a "boutique hotel". Once one enters that mind set it is easier to understand how things work and you are less likely to be disappointed.

Service is kind and efficient. Our food was much more representative of local foods than in other hotels that we visited on the trip.

The view down to the river was excellent and we were able to look down on a fish eagle; however, gaining the altitude to do this involves approaching via a very steep and narrow road with some big pot holes!

Our room wascomfortable and clean but the bathroom was small and not well designed. The plumbing had some complexities that could result in temperature changes, while the shower mat ineviatably got soaked and was not changed.

This was a reasonable base from which to visit Kandy and surrounding sites. We were lucky enough to be in town for a Poya night (full moon); we were able to see someof the parade from the tooth temple. A trip to see the local dances, which was not originally planned, turned out to be very worthwhile; if you are a health and safety expert - don't go!
title: A base near Kandy

placeInfo/address: 71, 18 M. B. Dodanwala Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Villa Rosa in Dec. 06 for 2 nights. The rate was 180 USD per night + food.
Pros:
- great views
- good food
- quiet location
- good service
- internet on property
Cons:
- rooms very tired, need new furniture urgently (if the charged 50 USD per night that would be ok, but for 180 USD, it's really overpriced)
- no hairdryer (for the money spent!)
On our previous visit to Kandy, we stayed at the Kandy House, which is a stunning property, in another category really, however they charge a lot for the use of internet.
If we visit Kandy again, we will not stay at Villa Rosa, but at the Kandy House
title: Overpriced but OK

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
roomTip: Add 15 extra minutes to get down the mountain
text:
A good stay in the end but a bit more dated than we thought, based on the photos. 

Excellent service by every person we encountered.
Good food in dinner. 

About a 15 minute tuk tuk into town. 

Bathroom could really use a Reno ( very old tub I thought I might fall through when showering). As with the balcony. 

Because people are likely out and about during the day, it was quite empty on arrival which was a weird energy. We thought we were the only ones there and it felt a bit lonely - but come meal times people seemed to be around.

I was a bit disappointed on arrival but did end up leaving feeling it was a good stay, so overall a 4 star experience, a 3 star hotel,  but 5 stars for service.
title: Good stay outside of the city center

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: The view over Kandy is lovely, particularly at night. The staff were kind as all Sri Lankans are, but the hotel is super tired and it was such a disappointment to us that we curtailed our trip by a night. Although the room was fairly clean, the furnishings were very cheap including the bathroom. The word is everywhere looked tired.  The food was disappointing too which is a shame as the outdoor terrace overlooking the view is lovely.  Maybe this hotel was good once upon a time, but it needs a very serious makeover, as it has huge potential because of its location high up on the hill. It was sadly the worst of the hotels we visited in Sri Lanka.
title: Disappointing hotel

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
The hotel is in a good location and the staff are very friendly. The food is very good and well presented but when we were there no Sri Lankan dishes were offered at dinner but they did have Mexican, Italian or Chinese. However, I was able to order something from the lunch menu to satisfy my desire for something local.
Our room was spacious,  had a balcony and was well appointed. However, it was rather spoiled by the strong smell of mildew coming from the bathroom. The grouting between the wall, and floor, tiles was black with mould....not  nice. This issue could certainly be remedied so I would hope the management decide to tackle it.
title: Good in parts

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
Absolutely nothing wrong with this place if one can get past the fact there is no way it's 5 star as was suggested to us, it would be a solid 3 star in our estimation.

The room we had was fine, spacious and with a good view, when the monsoon allowed that is. There was no lounge as such just a couple of seats at the back of the restaurant almost forcing one to take a table.

It's a good hike outside the town and halfway up a mountain, or so it felt, so exploring could be daunting even without the torrential rain. Yes, I know, there was nothing the hotel could do about the rain.

The food was very good and with the kitchen in full view of the restaurant, one could, if so inclined, watch it being prepared.
title: Just an ok hotel but with great food.

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
This hotel is average at best and completely overrated/overpriced. 

Yes the location is nice on the hills above Kandy and yes it is peaceful. It is also clean and the food is good.

But everything else is just average. Hotel is in a mediocre condition, furniture is absolutely cheap and tasteless and staff poorly trained. It is OK if you arrive late and leave the next day early morning. But not more.

All hotels we had in Sri Lanka during the last 10 days were many notches above this, for the same price or less.
title: Average hotel, completely overrated.

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
roomTip: The Penthouse has the best view and give you tons of space!
text:
I visited Theva first when they had just opened.... a tiny little boutique hotel 15mins from the Kandy town with spectacular views. We went in for lunch and has a scrumptious prawn biriyani over looking the misty mountain range surrounding the property. This is why I had to visit yet again....

Whilst the hotel still boasts its charm as it used to.... the service levels had seemed to drop! I experienced quite a bit of miscommunication from when I booked compared to what was made available to me in terms of food. 

This was a work visit as opposed to a holiday and just after hotels reopened after the COVID 19 Closure. We were the only guests staying at the hotel and just the one room that was occupied was the penthouse was by us. Unfortunately, I was refused a Sri Lankan breakfast at 7.30 despite breakfast being available from that time as per the menu. This was the most disappointing part of my stay as I have never been refused food from a hotel that positions it self as a luxury boutique hotel. Definitely something the management should look into. 

Having said that, its a fabulous space for some peace and quite that's a short distance away from the town and they have some nice fusion options for vegetarians
title: Spectacular Views.... Disappointing Service!

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
A great location, and really good food. However, an uninspiring hotel with tired accommodation. It wasn't my idea of a 'minimalist hotel', although if that just meant a lack of furniture in the room.... then that was accurate. Bathroom grout was mouldy, and bath stained. Blinds were on their last legs.
Expensive for what it was. Could be much better with a bit of investment in a refurb.
title: Great for food and location

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: The staff was very nice and the overall view of the Kandy area was pretty.  I was not happy with the menu however as there was no Sri Lankan  food on it.  There was a dog outside our hotel room that barked the whole night and got very little sleep.  Our breakfast on our balcony was nice.
title: Stayed for a night

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
While we enjoyed our one night stay here, I felt it didn't live up to the expectations created by the website and TripAdvisor reviews. 
The hotel looked modern and fresh on the website. In reality, it probably needs an update because the look and feel of the indoor restaurant (it often rains or is cold up here, so you're not always sitting on the lovely veranda with its views down to Kandy) is very dated; and the re-grouting that needs doing in the bathroom and the flimsy aluminium and wood structure separating the bathroom from the bedroom weren't really doing it for me.  In all honesty, while this hotel certainly isn't bad, it was the weakest of all our accommodation while in Sri Lanka. 
On the plus side, it has a nice plunge pool and small sauna, with space to sit outside; and the food for dinner and breakfast was very good - especially the breakfast. We'd had some curries in dodgy road-side restaurants that our Guide had taken us to in good faith, so our Indian style curry at Theva was delicious. The a la carte breakfast really was good and we thoroughly enjoyed it. 
If you want to experience Kandy itself then this hotel isn't in the centre of things, it is quite a way up the top of a big hill but if you're not bothered about Kandy nightlife, then the views from the restaurant are worth it.
title: Needs an update but does a good breakfast

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: We stayed here 2 nights and picked this hotel for the views rather than staying right in the city.  The hotel was up in the hills, approx 10minutes drive from the city (temple of the sacred tooth). The food was superb, however i do still feel very over-priced compared to the food we had eaten elsewhere on our trip (dinner for 2 starter+main+drink was working out to £50 per meal, elsewhere we were paying £15-£25).  The rooms are large with plenty of space and standard amenities.  This hotel was helpful to us as a short stay as we travelled to sigiriya from here, so was a nice a place to unwind after a long day of travelling and walking.
title: Fantastic views and out of the way

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: A modern hotel overlooking Kandy. The hotel enjoys a spectacular position high on a hill above the town.  Sadly the weather was inclement for most of our three night stay.  Unless you have transport you are rather reliant on the hotel kitchen. The food was good but not outstanding.  Our room was large and well appointed. The jaccuzi bath was in the living area but well sited for views over the town! The staff looked after us well but failed to pass a message on to us from our driver which meant we were up earlier than we needed to be. All in all we enjoyed our stay but probably would have preferred a more old fashioned hotel.
title: Stunning position

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: Although this hotel has a great view high up above Kandy we came away rather underwhelmed compared to other hotels we used in Sri Lanka. Our room had a rather tired feel to it, the pool area is cramped and disappointing and the main terrace area is underused. The food is ok, no better, and we felt that the service was disinterested. All in all a hotel which could do with uping its game.
title: A great view but....

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: The view was fabulous and our room smart but the overall feeling was that compared to other boutique hotels in Sri Lanka  the whole place needed considerably more tlc.  Staff were lovely.  Food was ok.   If it had been about 15% cheaper I’d be giving it 4 stars.
title: Good but not special

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
This hotel is situated at the top of a hill just outside Kandy. It has an outside dining with a fantastic view, particularly of the setting sun. You can also take breakfast outdoors and watch birds flit from tree to tree.

Beware that there is not much of interest right by the hotel, you will need to use a car.

Dining is expensive as there is only an a la carte menu.
title: wonderful views!

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: A boutique hotel about 10 minutes from Kandy. The rooms are clean with modern decor and almost no water pressure in the shower. Dined at the hotel patio restaurant and the average meal at best.  Breakfast was excellent.
title: Nice view

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: This hotel has a fabulous position looking down onto Kandy, but sadly just misses out.  Frankly the rooms are sparse and the food was not great.  I think that there are other hotels in the area that would be better.
title: Fabulous position

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
We had two nights at the Theva. It does have a great terrace that you can use first thing in the morning and late afternoon/ evening when it’s not raining. Otherwise it’s too hot and sunny with no shade. We expected it to be somewhat isolated as that’s the price you pay for being at the top looking down. Overall it’s a tidy modern design, somewhat sparsely furnished. 
We had significant reservations about our rooms I’m afraid. We booked two of the three ‘suites’. They were both very different and both had annoying basic design faults, strange for a new build hotel. Room 3 is dominated by a 1970’s style hot tub Bath which leaves no room for any real sitting area. It’s not a suite in normal hotel terms. The bed has no headboard and is set away from the wall behind so there’s no way you can sit up in bed. No where to hang a towel. Doors in the bathroom you have to negotiate around to get to the loo. I could go on.
Room 4 has a dog leg area with a couple of chairs where you have a window and a view otherwise it’s all an internal room. Similar ergonomic problems.
The staff were pleasant and we still had a good time particularly as Kandy is so lovely and the hotel restaurant is good. But it was clearly the weakest of the hotels on our stay in Sri Lanka which were otherwise really fantastic.
title: Great views but bizarre rooms

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text: The view was the reason that we booked to stay here for one night of luxury, on our Sri Lankan tour. The photos looked brilliant on TripAdvisor but obviously none were taken from our room! Half of it was taken up with plastic grass and the corrugated roof of the restaurant below. There was also a satellite dish beside the window that unfortunately took up another portion of it. Picture attached. The actual room however is beautiful although getting in and out of the concrete bath can be a bit challenging even for the fit and able! The pool and pool area is stunning but very small for the size of hotel and there was only room for 6 or 7 sun loungers on the edge which are crammed together so you can’t move in and out of the shade leaving you to bake in the corner if all other loungers are full. If you are not coming in peak season and are looking for somewhere away from the traffic. Then the people and place is very nice especially the view from the restaurant.
title: Disappointing view

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
Pros
Location - in the hills outside of kandy for peaceful enjoyment. I encourage other visitors to take a walk around surrounding streets & hills! 
Chef - great dinner, especially Chicken masala 
Good cable network 

Cons
Rooms feel sterile 
Hot water system intermittent 

Suggestions
More Sri Lankan options on the menu - too focussed on western tastes. Travellers want to experience local cuisine when travelling - not food they can get at home! 
Have some in room snacks available - eg Pringles, peanuts that can be purchased from mini bar to tie you over thru to dinner 

Note we were there during 2 days of constant rain so probably didn't get to experience the best the hotel had to offer (pool, balcony & restaurant views). Overall a pleasant experience though nothing of major note. Would recommend as a safe & reliable option to friends.
title: Good experience - as expected

placeInfo/address: 6th Lane 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd, Hantana, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: 11 B5 / 10 - 1, Off Upper Tank Rd, Off Circular 2 Rd
placeInfo/locationString: Hantana, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
This hotel is above Kandy and provides spectacular views over the valley.   Rooms cascade down the hill and each has a private terrace.  There is a small but pretty pool with sun loungers,  

The restaurant has an extensive and eclectic menu; the dishes are beautifully presented and mostly delicious.  I was a little put off by the smell of their cleaner (I think) but my husband barely noticed it so that may be personal.

However, there are a number of issues with the hotel that impact everyone.  The first is that the rooms are tired.  Our bath relied on copious quantities of silicone grouting.  There were no bedside reading lamps in our room.  Although the beds were comfortable the furnishings were basic.  

The second issue was that the place was a little soulless partly because it was nearly empty.  We returned from dinner at 21.30 to find the restaurant and bar completely dark and locked up.  We wanted to book an alarm call but the remaining member of staff just didn't have enough English to understand,  

So I would summarise that this hotel is a compromise between relatively low cost and some terrific views versus a tired property with cheerful but limited service.
title: Compromise

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Nydeligt lille hotel med god beliggenhed. Dejlige værelser og fine  badeværelser. Skøn gård og fine detaljer med det blå porcelæn overalt. Hvorfor indgangs parti og Cafe så fremstår så kedelig og afskrækkende kan man undre sig over. Med en afskærmning af generatoren på terrassen og placering af lidt borde, stole, parasoller og lidt planter kunne man komme langt. Også en opgradering af caféen med lidt mere af det blå porcelæn på evt. vægge og sideboards samt nedhængte lamper over bordene, ville man kunne hæve indtrykket og oplevelsen af hotellet væsentligt. - men som over alt - meget sødt og venligt personale
title: Skuffer ved første blik, men egentlig ok.

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Lovely little hotel, we did move room as air con in original did not work well. All fine after move, in fact bathroom even better.
Did not eat here in evening however breakfast was really good Sri Lankan option.
Very peaceful and quiet and easy walking to the town bars and shops.
title: Lovely little hotel

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Beautifully appointed hotel and warm friendly staff. I enjoyed the breakfast style and the real coffee!
The air-conditioner was very noisy and there seems to be no option to turn off its light.
It would be good if the staff explained the use of the hot water system, as we had cold showers! A hair-dryer would be good too.
title: Beautifully appointed, comfy bed

placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Opt for a room on the first floor. In the lower floor one is disturbed with loud food steps from the floor above.
text:
Well located in the Galle Fort & beautifully decorated in shades of blue & white Yara is an ideal stay in the Galle, but the property management is a bit lax.
 1) We were greeted with a used diaper in our bathroom bin, not cleaned after the previous guests. 
2) On check in we had clearly mentioned that we will be leaving early for whale watching the next morning & would need an early, packed breakfast. The reception staff made a note of it too. But to our surprise there was no one at the reception the next morning. We got to know the staff was still sleeping and we had to leave without our breakfast. The staff profusely apologised for the mistake later and made up for it with a good lunch but the overall experience left us a bit disappointed, forcing me to give a 3 star rating where I would have loved to give a 5.
title: Beautiful property, not so great

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Peter H,

First of all I would like to thank you for your detail review on your one night stay with us. Kindly note my comments below;
Google Earth - 1st and the last google street view shoot was done back in March 2016. Hence we have to wait google to update it as we cannot update it locally from our end.
Reception – Regarding the issue during the booking that you encountered, I would like to point out that the $50 charge is not an additional charge but to the second person per night. Had you gone ahead with the booking for a double room initially on your email we would���ve quoted the same amount of $50 per person. Also, Having an additional guest in a room will cost us in many ways such as water, amenities and linen consumption is double than a single occupancy and Air Condition burns extra electricity to cool down a room with double occupancy than a room with a single occupancy.
Bathroom – We are glad to inform you that we have already installed a shelf in shower are a to keep your shampoo, shower gel etc. this was brought to our attention by our guests however it took little time than expected as we couldn’t find the right quality before. 
Amenities including Entertainment – We have 4 movie channels, 5 Sports channels, 13 Variety channels in 6 different languages, 5 Travel / Living channels, news channels and kids channels. We have more than 25 International channels and 6 Sri Lankan TV channels. Hence we are unable to understand what you meant by ‘basic Channels’
Food Offering- We regret that we were not able to exceed your expectation. However our breakfast was a hit on many guest reviews.
Security - We would like to put on note that the hotel is under CCTV surveillance 
Value for Money – You were allocated Room no 103 one of our best Superior rooms. We fail to understand what made you to call it Inferior room.

We hope you will give us another opportunity to serve you at Yara Galle Fort.

Thank You.
placeInfo/address: NO 40 Middle Street Fort, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid rooms with direct access to the courtyard
text:
Location and Access – The hotel within the walls of Galle Fort and within easy walking distance of the historical centre and the ramparts. Close by are shops, banks, restaurants and bars

Google Earth – The un renovated hotel can be seen on Street View

Architectural Style – Low rise characterful recently renovated Colonial building

Reception – I had experienced some difficulty with my booking.com reservation but reception had responded speedily to email enquiries prior to my arrival. However, my original booking had been for one person but due to a change in circumstances check in was to be for 2. This resulted in an additional surcharge of $50 which I considered quite expensive bearing in mind the only additional expense the hotel would have was an extra towel and a breakfast

Public Areas/Decor – In the entrance a small restaurant /bar with tables also outside on the roadside garden. Internally a garden courtyard with seating area. Décor fresh with antique objet

Guest Rooms – Several types of room advertised on booking websites. Not sure I was allocated the one I actually booked. This was adjacent to the reception area and proved to be quite noisy

Decor/Maintenance/Cleanliness – Everything was fairly new and in reasonable condition

Furnishing/Bed –king size bed with side tables, wardrobe and work top/dressing table

Bathroom – Well appointed with good quality fixtures and fittings. Walk in shower. Reasonable powerful hot water. Ample towels and complimentary toiletries. However, lacking attention to detail no shelf in shower area for soap, shampoo etc.

Space – Adequate

Amenities including Entertainment – TV with basic Channels, Wi-Fi, tea and coffee making, complimentary water, mini fridge. Plenty of electrical sockets capable of charging personal devices

Lighting – Not a lot of natural light. Bedroom faced onto the courtyard corridor and for privacy it was necessary to have the blinds closed most of the time. Artificial lighting was reasonable

Air Conditioning – Effective

Noise – Some disturbance from other guests in corridor/courtyard outside room and at reception

Food Offering – The breakfast was standard

Security – In room safe

Value for Money – The additional supplement charged for an extra guest and the fact I believed that I had been allocated an inferior room left me with the feeling that I had not received good value for money 

X Factor – The location within the historical Galle Fort is a plus point for the hotel
title: Location in Historic Centre

text:
Overall experience was good. Food was amazing, great seafood selection for dinner and wonderful pools. Staff was very helpful.
On cons; stayed in a triple bed room, however the spare bed was very uncomfortable. I have been in many stars hotels and the spare bed were always top notch, quite disappointed considering hertiance.
There was multiple power cuts trough out the night, so had to constantly call the reception, not the best night sleep with combined with the bad bed.
Other than that, pretty much a nice relaxed stay.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to share your detailed feedback following your recent stay at Heritance Ahungalla.

We are truly grateful for your kind words about our team. It brings us great joy to hear that our staff – from the Guest Experience Officer to our bartenders, cooks, lifeguards, and security – contributed so positively to your stay. A special thank you for mentioning Captain Nelka, Captain Kalinga, Jogatia, and Thamsha from the pool bar. We will be sure to pass along your compliments to them – they will be delighted to know they made a meaningful impact.

We’re pleased that you appreciated our beachfront location, tropical surroundings, and distinctive architecture, as well as the overall ambiance of your room.

We also sincerely thank you for your honest and constructive observations regarding areas where we can improve. We understand your concerns about the room lighting design, the occasional presence of insects during the rainy season, and the organization of entertainment and activities. Your feedback regarding food quality and variety is also noted and will be shared with our culinary team for review.

At Heritance Ahungalla, we constantly strive to elevate the guest experience, and your insights are invaluable in helping us do so. While we are glad that you found value in our location, beach, pool, and – most importantly – our people, we also recognize the areas you feel fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that your comments will be carefully reviewed with the relevant departments to ensure improvements are made.

Thank you once again for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your honest reflections. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a more enhanced experience in the future.

Warm regards,
Purnima Weerasinghe,
Front Office Manager,
Heritance Ahungalla.
roomTip: If you want to tip anybody, better start with 500 Rs per tip.
text:
Let's start with the best part of our experience - super friendly staff. We had lots of nice interactions with everyone starting from the Guest Experience Officer lady, through bartenders and cooks, finishing on life guards and security. We want to emphasize work of guys from pool bar (and probably misspell their names :) ) - captain Nelka, captain Kalinga, barman Jogatia and Thamsha. Unquestionably staff is the strongest point of that hotel.
Hotel is located next to the wonderful sand beach with tropical flora and fauna. It doesn't look like another boring hotel from Turkey, Spain or Greece. Its architecture is something refreshing and memorable.
Rooms also look very pleasant and not cheap. However the first problems appear there. It takes time to understand how light switches are organized and there is no main light source on the ceiling. Instead we got a big fan which was pointless with working air conditioning. Also if you are scared of insects better be prepared to meet some in the bathroom after rains. Hotel staff proposed us change of the room but we chose just additional insect spraying. If you want to go to tropics, expect tropical animals. :)
Huge disadvantage of this hotel is lack of any activities. Live band performances were the only thing happening there. We saw an animator maybe once when they were flying kites with kids. The animation plan in the hallway had nothing to do with reality. If you want to only sunbath, swim and chill it could be the advantage but it is not what is being sold here.
Food was mostly good but there was also some inedible foods. South Asian cuisine itself is very tasty and you will be able to experience that here. However some pork was impossible to bite and chicken almost always contained little bones which can make you choke to death.
Overall this hotel is nice but it is not a five star experience. It was just like an average three star hotel in Europe but located in more exotic location. Friendly staff is the biggest jewel in its crown. Next are beautiful beach and big main pool. Beside these three things Heritance Ahungalla doesn't offer anything memorable.

In the end it is important to mention locals selling trips and clothes next to the hotel. You will always encounter them when going to the beach or even walking next to the fence. They are very friendly but remember that every interaction is meant to sell you more stuff with relatively high price. But if you negotiate prices and stay assertive, you can have a great experience for relatively low cost.
title: The best average hotel

ownerResponse/text:

Assistant Vice President / Cluster General Manager 
Heritance Ahungalla.
roomTip: The hotel hosted several beach private parties for outside clients but luckily they usually finished quite early so the music stopped then.
text:
This hotel is situated on a beautiful beach and surrounded by nice gardens. It has two pools , one of which is much quieter than the other and where you can sit and enjoy the tranquility.  The wooden sun beds are showing a lot of wear and tear and would benefit from being replaced. 
However whilst the hotel is supposedly five star , it is definitely not a five star hotel. The entrance area is very nice but elsewhere the whole place would benefit from repainting  as there are a lot of scuffs and marks on the walls/floors upstairs. In our room the curtains had a lot of marks on them - the screens were broken and the bathroom had lots of marks on the walls and tiles. The tea and coffee in the room only offered English breakfast tea and caffeinated coffee. Decaf was not available anywhere in the hotel and only offering one type of tea where it’s grown we thought quite strange. The air conditioning in the room was very good. The plug sockets in the room looked dangerous and were hanging out of the wall but one plug was an international socket which was really helpful. The staff are mostly very nice and friendly, not so much the male waiting staff in the bar and restaurant. Speaking of the restaurant , the food offered was quite repetitive and in our opinion the quality of the meat in the dishes was not the best. The desserts were ok ! 
However , the one shining star of this hotel is Jayaru - the guest relations executive - she was absolutely delightful, a huge help with everything. We definitely could not have managed all the things we wanted to do without her. She arranged a private driver (Sampath) for us to take us to the elephant orphanage, Kandy and to a very interesting tea plantation at Pitigala. It was certainly a much nicer way to see these sights than with a dedicated tour bus ( the buses become quite uncomfortable after several hours of driving). Also it was cheaper to do it this way too. 
Sampath can be contacted via WhatsApp on +94 76 540 2575 for private trips.
title: Heritance hotel Ahungalla March/April 2025
