text:
It was our first trip to Sri Lanka, NH Collection Hotel in Colombo, Golden Crown Hotel in Kandy were both excellent and valued for 5Star, but this hotel is not desirable at all, the highest rating I can give it is 3 stars, this hotel being 5 stars is a childish joke. 
Resturant service is terrible! The staff is completely primitive, the room is like a motel!? Do not choose this Hotel if you are looking to rest in a 5 Star Hotel.
title: This Hotel is 3-4 star, I won’t recommend it.

Heritance Ahungalla
text:
Das Hotel macht auf den ersten Blick einen guten Eindruck. Tolle Hotelhalle mit einem fantastischen Blick auf das Meer. Begrüßung sehr freundlich. Wir sind in den frühen Morgenstunden (6h) angereist und unser Zimmer war noch nicht verfügbar. Auf Nachfrage hat man uns ein Zimmer, bis unser Zimmer verfügbar war, zu einem Preis von 10$ die Stunde angeboten, was wir als sehr unverschämt empfunden haben. Nach  Rücksprache mit unserem Reiseleiter ging es dann doch ohne Berechnung. Zimmer sind sehr schön, wir hatten eines mit Meerblick, sauber und gute Matratzen. Die Anlage ist alles im allem in einem sehr guten Zustand,  2 sehr gepflegte Pools, eine Poolbar und Liegen ausreichend vorhanden. Wir hatten AI Verpflegung inklusive Getränke,  die beinhalteten Getränke waren aber sehr übersichtlich. Cocktails an der Bar eher mässig für AI, für gute Cocktails musste man extra zahlen. Es gibt eine sehr große Auswahl an Speisen im Restaurant, aber weniger wäre manchmal mehr. Außer Lifecocking alles kalt und keine Abwechslung, viele asiatische Speisen, was gut war,aber sehr scharf. Es gibt die Möglichkeit draußen zu essen, was wir sehr genossenhaben. Restaurant innen sehr kalt, wenn man bei Regen innen essen muss. Man konnte auch draußen frühstücken,  Kaffee und Tee leider ungenießbar. Weitläufige sehr schöner Strand, baden im Meer ist kaum möglich, da starke Strömungen, daher sehr gefährlich.  Es gibt immer wieder Badeunfälle. Sehr aufdringliche Strandverkäufer, die auch immer wieder ins Hotel kommen, was sie gar nicht dürften.Man kann am Strand auch Ausflüge buchen, sehr zu empfehlen ist Berty, faire Preise und gut organisiert. Spricht auch deutsch. Service im Restaurant und überall sehr freundlich, allerdings reagiert auch hier die Trinkgeld- Mafia. 
Alles in allem war u ser Aufenthalt sehr schön, wenn auch mit Abstrichen.
title: Schönes Hotel mit Abstrichen

Heritance Ahungalla
roomTip: Read the reviews carefully and take them at face value. They are accurate.
text: Heritage Hotel Ahungalla.  A hotel that presents itself as 5 stars, but unfortunately, after my experience there, I can barely give it 3 stars.  The location is wonderful, green in abundance and the animals and birds are in their natural habitat. It sounds like it was a dream vacation. Unfortunately it wasn't. There are people on staff who do the right thing because they have to.  Then there are the staff people who do what they do for the tip.  And there are dedicated people who do everything in their power to make you feel welcome.  The room was fine although the furniture is old. The shower door was moldy and one of the hinges was almost out of the wall. And yet thanks to ROMESH, the guy who cleaned every day, I got over how the room looked.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart ROMESH, for your dedication and for all the animals made daily from towels but especially for the flowers you brought me and thus made the room look welcoming.  Let's talk about food.  I knew that we were going to Asia and that the food was very hot and spicy there. It would be fine as long as those dishes were marked as spicy. They only marked the dishes that contained chili as spicy. The vegetables were al dente to raw, the pasta was almost uncooked, and the other types of stews were swimming in oil.  When i asked the person who was serving there about correct etiquette, he replied that it was just a little spicy ,not understanding that due to a health problem I am not allowed to eat spicy at all. Thanks to miss JAYARU, who got in touch with the head chef Mr. HISHAM, I had something to eat for the rest of the stay.  About these two people, miss JAYARU and Mr. Chef HISHAM, I can say that they are the 5 star people in this hotel.  Thank you for putting up with my complaints, showing me understanding and I apologize for all the trouble I gave you. I would like to congratulate the head pastry chef NUWAN for the best bread and delicious sweets.   As for the main bar staff, some move faster, others only if they get a tip.  So thank you for all the drinks you served me: SHANIKA, KAWESHA, RAAWESHA, THARUSHA, THULITHA. The bar at the 2nd pool at the back, the one at the rooms, was always closed with no one there.  If you wanted something to drink, you had to go to the front, to the big bar, so you had to walk 3 minutes for a drink.  Several times VISAL came and stayed there, bringing us drinks from the other bar. Thank you VISAL for all the trips made. Another dissatisfaction was the lack of an animation team.  There was a boy who did aqua gymnastics in the morning and a boy who held the yoga sessions.  And that's about it.  The evenings were very boring although there was live music every night.  The problem with these singers was that they all had the same playlist.  Old music from the 70s-80s.  So boring as hell.   Since it was not possible to swim in the ocean, we had to stay at the pool.  The cleaning of the pool was done daily, but it was done perfectly by only one employee named CHATURANGA.  The rest were doing a salvage job, even leaving dead crabs on the bottom of the pool.  The sunbeds were old, many of them in a pitiful state, the screws from the wheels were coming out and if you weren't careful you could scratch yourself in the nails used to repair them. Another problem was the lack of sun umbrellas.  Indeed there were plenty of shade trees, but there were also places where shade was needed.  I can't believe that a 5-star hotel, as this hotel presents itself, has only 7 sun umbrellas that were moved depending on who came and occupied the first place.   So..... as far as I'm concerned I spent a disappointing holiday in a 5 star hotel.
title: 5 star once, 3 star now Too bad.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Yoshi,
Thank you for your detailed and constructive feedback. We truly appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. We're sorry to hear that the service and facilities did not meet your expectations. We value your comments on the entertainment, food, and overall guest experience, and will certainly take them into consideration as we work to improve our services.

We're glad to hear that you had positive interactions with some of our team members, and we'll make sure to pass on your thanks to Chaturanga, Shanika, Jayaru, Nelka, Romesh, Ashen, and the rest of the staff you mentioned.

Mnagement Team.
text:
We stayed at this hotel between 31.01.25-17.02.25.

The rooms are equipped with TV, refrigerator, air conditioning, a kettle, old but all functional and clean.
Unfortunately the service is slow and the A.I. system is strangely designed, for each order you are presented with an invoice, in which you have to note the room and sign for it. 
We are not big drinkers of alcohol, we only consumed water and beer, sometimes mocktails.

At this hotel there is nothing related to local culture, no activities, only live music, pretty much all local artists use approximately the same playlist, what you heard last week you will hear next week.
Animation team is composed from only two employees, one is in charge of Yoga, the second one is in charge of volleyball, water gymnastics and other activities.
There is no bingo night, or even the slightest effort to involve tourists in any activity, sometimes boredom just watching a wall dry paint on it is more fun.

The food is repetitive but you can find what to eat, the only problem is that the A.I. restaurant labels are not properly displayed.
Try to find a system that will be efficient, it's a pity about all the prepared food, labor and energy.

The bread is very good (the best bread I've ever eaten in my life), the desserts and fruits, everything else is personal, whether you like it spicy or not.

Potatoes with pepper? Why? At every table you have pepper and salt. Raw chicken served raw in a restaurant because it didn't sit in the oven long enough? Sometimes the potatoes and vegetables were uncooked, leave them 2-3 min more, at least try it...

I know that in Sri Lanka they eat spicy and very spicy food, but if it's spicy food at least put the correct sign at the A.I. restaurant, or test the food before you fill your plate, as I have seen other Russian tourists do, then seeing that the food is very spicy they quit eating, simply wasting food in the garbage for nothing.

Be careful - if the hotel is fully booked there are not enough sunbeds and umbrellas.
Some of the sunbeds needs a repair, or replacement, umbrellas are damaged.

On the day we were supposed to leave we could not have late checkout. We had to take our luggage and move it to a room next to the reception. We spent a couple more hours in the hotel after 12:00, but unfortunately there is no system, even for a fee.

Pool 2 was not cleaned every day, depends on worker and mood.

What are kids under 5 doing in pool two when they belong in pool one?

However the hotel is in need of a general refurbishment, improvement of services and entertainment programs. 

All in all it was a mediocre vacation, staff is not really customer minded, no matter if you give tips or not, some of them are working hard but you cannot have 1 people working correctly and 2 pretending to work.

Special thanks:
Chaturanga - for maintaining the 2nd pool as best as he can, working hard every shift.
Shanika - for service.
Jayaru - customer support, trying but the changes are not visible, maybe in time the management will realize it is an international hotel and act accordingly?
Nelka - poolbar.
Romesh - thanks for a clean room, flowers and towel decorations. I hope you will enjoy his services too.
Ashen - for the eggs prepared every morning.
Visal, Rawesha, Tharusha, Shudat, Jagath, Kalinga, Waruni, also the Trainees.

Sorry for this but if you have no other options, give it a chance, otherwise look elsewhere. In Europe this hotel will be ranked at 3*

*why only 3 stars for this review?
- No shows, no entertainment or involvement from the staff to involve the guests, no local traditions presented to tourists.
- Food is hit & miss, depends on personal choice.
- Poor services, also the second poolbar from the second pool was closed most of the time. You have to walk for 5 min to get a drink from the first poolbar and off course sign the bill.
title: Was 5 stars was a long time ago, now it's only for mass tourism.

roomTip: I wouldn't recommend booking this hotel. It is aimed at locals more and is a bit tired. Old bedroom furniture, old towels by the poolside.
text:
This was the last stop on a busy 2-week Group Tour of Sri Lanka. It was our least favourite hotel. It looks tired in places. 
We had a spacious ground floor room with a small triangular shaped bathroom. The shower doors looked in need of a good clean. Our patio doors we discovered hadn't been locked properly so anyone could have pushed them open. In the early hours of the first morning we heard 2 distinctive taps on the patio doors which was unnerving. We didn't get up to investigate but whilst the hotel is behind gates and security at the front it seemed to me that there was nothing stopping anyone wandering in off the beach area.
This hotel is very popular with locals especially at weekends so when we arrived the hotel was packed with a large group of young men playing volleyball in the main pool. All sunbeds were taken by families sitting round chatting. As this was the only day of R & R part on our trip it was a bit concerning but by Sunday afternoon things had quietened down.
This is a very large busy hotel so breakfast was a bun fight and it took us 10-15 minutes to get served tea or coffee.
Nice outside seating area by one of the bars. 
As you are nearer Colombo you will get pestered on the beach to buy things.
The sea was too rough to swim in and there are dangerous rip tides.
There is nothing to do locally but we did visit the Victor Hasselblad Sea Turtle Research And Conservation Centre just 3 miles up the road. Well worth an hour's visit to see the wonderful work they are doing.  None of the multiple hotel staff hanging around reception had heard of it even though it is literally up the same road. But a taxi driver Googled it for us and took us there and back. 
The Hotel is off one busy road with shops and other Hotels but not in a specially pretty area. 
This area was impacted by the tsunami so you will see little graveyards and monuments in memory of people who lost their lives. Especially on the train that got swept off the track.
title: Popular and busy hotel with locals. A bit tired.

text:
ツアーで宿泊。5つ星とのことですが、歯ブラシやスリッパが無かった。シャンプー等が陶器の入れ物に入っており使いにくい。部屋は広く快適、ロケーションは素晴らしい！食事のブュッフェは他のホテルとあまり内容が変わらない。スタッフは親切。
最後にホテル見学ツアーに参加後、アンケートと言うことで携帯を取り上げられ、Googleに勝手にログイン、ホテルスタッフが評価を全て良いにチェックを入れていた。
受付女性スタッフは、コメントだけはこちらの意見を入れるようお願いしていたが、男性スタッフは全て良いにチェックを入れた後コメントも入れさせず、閉じて返してきたので驚きました。
何をしているかわからないと思っているのか、バカにしていると思う出来事でした。
title: 普通

text:
Плюсы: 
1. Приятный персонал, готовый помочь во всех вопросах (если им дать чаевые, а они этого ждут).
2. Красивая территория со множеством животных (вараны, пальмовые белки, обезьяны)
3. Неплохие бассейны

Минусы:
1. Все номера расположенные вокруг лобби вынуждены до 11-12 вечера слушать ОЧЕНЬ громкую музыку (у нас буквально чуть ли не кровати вибрировали). Нам пришлось переселяться подальше, потому что отдохнуть было невозможно.
2. Выбор еды только кажется большим, нигде не указана острота, поэтому приходилось брать наугад. Для детей нет ничего вообще. Если у вас есть проблемы с желудком - выбрать вам будет нечего.
Фрукты по факту были только папая, ананас и пресные арбузы. На завтрак иногда бананы. 
3. Персонал в столовой очень медлительный - напитки иногда приносили уже к моменту окончания трапезы
4. Экскурсии не стоит брать у парней на пляже - они выставят вам цену в два раза больше и будут пытаться завозить вас в каждое место, где у них есть откат. Лучше выйти из отеля и договориться с тук-тукерами там.
5. Чтобы пройти к океану надо прорваться через толпу очень навязчивых местных, которые пытаются вам всучить всё подряд - под конец отдыха уже начало раздражать.

Не минус самого отеля, но поплавать в океане у вас не получится - волны и довольно мелко.
Сдачи нет ни у кого, поэтому рассчитывайте и меняйте на мелкие деньги сразу, а то тоже будете переплачивать.
title: Красивое место, но отель с существенными минусами

Me and my family visited Heritance Ahungalla.I have visited two times previously to this hotel. compare to previous visits this time is worst one. Rooms are not clean, and bathroom does not have hygienic seal and  bathroom amenities such as toothpaste, toothbrush, slippers, water glass. But I love this hotel very much and food is tasty but does not have more verities except lunch. Restaurant is lonely place especially action station area has lack of persons to serve customers, awaiting lengthy period to taste food. I appreciate service of lifeguard who work at main pool on 16th October 2023.
But overall, it was an enjoyable day, and we enjoyed a lot because this time we have room which have both sea and pool view. Beautifully design swimming pool is another attraction has large beach front. I Highly recommended this hotel, but you must improve your customer care and room service. Further I think it would be better if the old boat which is previously locate near the pool is restore because it is iconic attraction of the hotel.

roomTip: Go outside the hotel and get a tuktuk to the bazaar - cheap exotic fruits.
text:
The hotel itself is more than enough for a great holiday. You have your pool, your beach, and your room. The staff is polite and friendly. The food is good to great. Lots of meats and veggies. We only had breakfast and dinner - both were good. 

However, there were many problems. The rooms are somewhat clean. I believe Sri Lanka was open for tourism long enough to learn how to properly serve customers, but they are still… bad. So don’t expect a perfect room. Rukmal - good cleaner who tried his best to make our stay more pleasant. Appreciate the towel elephant) 

Also - as long as you are not afraid of wild animals (monkeys, monitor lizards, insects), you will be fine. Otherwise, there are not many places to go to on the hotel premises. These animals are everywhere and I personally was terrified. Nevertheless, great opportunity to get close to wildlife! 

Overall, the weather and the ocean were unbelievable! Everything else is just a minor inconvenience. Would recommend!
title: Not bad but desperately needs improvements

text: We had the opportunity to stay for one night. The pool and beach were truly exceptional, providing a delightful experience. The variety offered in all three meals was impressive, with a wide range of flavors that were quite enjoyable. However, I must express my disappointment with the accommodations. The room we were assigned felt quite dated, and the beds were not particularly comfortable. Additionally, the air conditioning unit's controller was malfunctioning, which affected our comfort. The bathroom was notably small, particularly the shower cubicle, making it inconvenient for a comfortable bathing experience. It's worth mentioning that the absence of a hand shower in the bathroom was a drawback. Regrettably, we also found that the staff did not display the same level of friendliness towards locals. Considering our experience, I would suggest this establishment for a day outing rather than an overnight stay.
title: Good for day outings

text:
I am still here, few more days left!

The food is lovely, and the staff are brilliant - always there to support. The breakfast and dinner buffets were out of this world. The only minor improvement needed is for the lunch buffet, as it's not actually a buffet - you have to order the main meal, which can take a while. The rooms are clean and well kept, but they do look tired. Don't forget to bring your plug adapters. The only quirk is that without the Venetian blind, there's visibility into the toilet and bathroom, so it's more suitable for partners.

What might need improving, room facilities, the bathroom/toilet.

Can see into the toilet and bathroom, unless you have the blinds down.

Lunch is not a buffet. You will have to order from a  set menu.

text: As a well travelled guest, Heritance Ahungalla was one of the worst hotels I have been to. My friends and I arrived at the hotel after a long day, expecting the welcome they advertise. But we were greeted with nothing and yet I noticed the foreign tour group next to us at the hotel were getting a great welcome. The foreign guests were given a welcome drink in front of me and even when j was checking in, nothing was really done. This was extremely disappointing to see as their attention was on the foreign guests, even though the hotels are kept afloat by locals even in times of crisis. In a sense, it felt as if I and my friends were purposefully ignored at the welcome to focus on white people. Next, the rooms were OK and clean with the needed amenities. The pool was ok and the environment was relaxing and calm. But the Jacuzzis are broken and one was unusable. This really dampened the experience. Thirdly, the buffet. The food experience was TERRIBLE. I stayed ful board for 2 days and the food was the same everytime. There was not much variety and so, it was really disappointing. At one point during lunch, I found MOLD in my food!!! The same night during dinner, my friends and I ate carved roast pork and the meat was rotten. It smelled bad and when I ate a bite, it was so rotten and I had to throw it away. The breakfast buffet had some diversity and was enjoyable. The staff is nice and accommodates our wish. The bar makes a really good cocktail called the green pool. Other than that, it was a poor experience. Serving bad food to guests and ignoring local guests to focus only on foreign guests was what made me write this review. I never badly review anyplace I travel to unless its horrible, like ahungalla was. It did not serve a purpose to my business trip either. Would never visit again.
title: Terrible treatment and rotten food!!

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Keep all windows closed & do not feed the monkeys.
text:
I recently stayed at this hotel, and I have to say that the potential is there for a fantastic experience. But it was, unfortunately, overshadowed by the overall run-down condition of the property . I was surprised to see the condition of the room. It's seems like basic requirements are not  met. The telephone is full of dust, and the mini bar is filthy. Few toilet bulbs aren't working.Its seems like no one checked the room prior to the arrival. But I was pleased with the breakfast offerings. There were a variety of options available that all of us enjoyed . 
The hotel is a hidden GEM that desperately needs more attention . I hope they invest in  improvements soon before it's too late.
title: Great Hotel with a Run Down Feel

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
The Heritance Kandalama is undeniably beautiful. Geoffrey Bawa’s architecture is nothing short of phenomenal and remains inspiring decades on. The setting and design are breathtaking, and the staff are consistently warm, helpful, and professional. The buffet is vibrant and full of variety, but unfortunately the set menu doesn’t quite live up to the same five-star promise.

However, as you spend time here, the hotel's age begins to show. Key areas feel tired, and despite the presence of other guests, the ambiance is surprisingly lifeless. The grand sculptural entrance leads to an empty café and a bar so underwhelming you might miss it altogether. What this hotel needs is a serious interior refresh and an injection of energy to match the brilliance of its architectural foundation. It's a place that deserves to feel as alive as it looks.
title: Architectural Masterpiece in Need of New Life

text:
Certes l’hôtel et l’architecture sont magnifiques. La vue des singes de la chambre également. Maintenant l’hôtel est le même depuis 15-20 ans je pense. Les troues dans la salle de bain sont à peine comblés avec du silicone. Les installations sont très vieillissantes et nécessitent une rénovation. Il n’y a jamais de lumière dans l’hôtel. De plus, les buffets sont assez cher et en plein air sans extraction. Vive les odeurs de viandes et de poissons très fortes dès le matin.
Expérience très mitigée au regard du prix de l’hôtel.

text: Brutalist & James Bond! Half expected someone to say “we’ve been expecting you Mr Bond”! Sense of arrival & views throughout the hotel are spectacular & definitely deserves a 5* + rating. Sadly this is where the 5* rating ends. The rooms are in desperate need of a full refurbishment, with most 5 star amenities missing (no robes, no slippers, no mini bar - just an empty dirty fridge, spartan towels, no soundproofing on the doors & you can hear every footstep). As for the dinner & breakfast buffets these offered an extensive range of dishes but sadly none of them were of a particularly decent standard. At times it felt like feeding time at the zoo. Not a place I’d recommend to fellow travellers, especially at the prices they charge
title: Disappointing - it’s all about the view

ownerResponse/text: Dear Jelsby…… Thank you very much for taking the time to share your feedback. We truly appreciate your observations, as they provide us with valuable insights on areas where we can improve our offerings. We are genuinely disappointed to hear that your experience did not meet your expectations, especially considering the friendly staff, beautiful location, and good food you mentioned. While we are proud of our panoramic rooms, we understand that their minimalist style and age may not have fully met your personal preferences. As you noted, the panoramic room is part of our superior category, and we are continuously working on upgrading and maintaining the balance between preserving our original charm and adding modern facilities for greater comfort. We are sorry to hear that the noise from the corridor disrupted your rest. We understand how important it is to have a peaceful environment, and we will look into ways to minimize the noise impact for future stays. Regarding the pool, as part of our commitment to sustainability, we aim to reduce our energy consumption, and thus do not use heating systems in the pools. We understand that this may not have been ideal for you, and we are grateful for your understanding of our eco-friendly approach. We also take note of your comments regarding the limited loungers and will consider options to improve the poolside experience. It is unfortunate that our bar did not offer the inviting atmosphere you were hoping for. We are always striving to enhance the guest experience, and your feedback will guide us as we continue to improve our spaces. We do take your feedback seriously and will continue working toward offering the best experience possible while maintaining the essence of our location and values. Once again, thank you for your thoughtful review. We hope to welcome you back and provide a much more enjoyable experience in the future. Warm Regards, General  Manager
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Infinity is small but cold..
Get half board deal if possible as there is nothing around/
text:
For a room rate of around 400$ a night for a panoramic room I was disappointed.
The hotel while visually impressive is also old and faded and was quite disappointing.
1) room is very small and aging..it needs updating.
2) it is very noisy as all rooms back on to a corridor and the rocks makes every waking past speaking travel. Lying in bed I do not want to hear the noise of everyone in the corridor.
3) the infinity pool while nice is cold and has only 8 loungers which are ripped.
4) the bar is very soulless..does not invite one to sit and enjoy.

Positives staff are friendly-food, location and view seems ok but for me for the price a real disappointment..
Note there are no restaurants in the vicinity so best to eat here.
title: Lovely isolated location but dated, noisy and needs some upgrades for the price

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Heritance Kandalama offers an exceptional experience surrounded by nature and stunning views, making it a beautiful getaway. The staff here are incredibly friendly and helpful, which seems to be a hallmark of this place. They go above and beyond to make guests feel welcome and attended to at every moment. The location itself is breathtaking, with lush surroundings and views that seem to blend the architecture seamlessly into the natural landscape. The boat ride offered by the hotel is an absolute must-do, providing a unique perspective on the area and a peaceful escape.

The food at the Main Restaurant was another highlight. Every meal was delicious, with an impressive variety and a great balance of local and international dishes. It truly added to the luxury experience, and it’s clear the culinary team puts a lot of effort into their craft.

On the downside, there were a couple of areas that could be improved. There was a 35-minute delay in the check-in process, which was a bit frustrating after a long journey. Additionally, the TV positioning in the 317 Suite room felt awkward, making it difficult to watch from the bed comfortably.

Overall, Heritance Kandalama is a fantastic destination with a few minor setbacks, but the beautiful setting, friendly staff, excellent food, and relaxing boat ride more than make up for it.
title: Average

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The infinity pool at the front of the hotel only has a few loungers which get full very quickly
text:
We stayed here for five nights as a base to explore the cultural triangle. Our booking was through Booking.com and  as is common in Sri Lanka, we paid the full amount a month or so in advance. 

The hotel is reputedly one of the best in Sri Lanka, the jewel in the crown of the Aitken Spence Hotel group. Opened in 1995, it was designed to blend seamlessly into the natural environment; in this it succeeds very well.

However, the hotel is suffering from under investment and once away from the reception, bar and restaurant areas, this is very noticeable. And the room we were given also showed signs of dilapidation: very stained loo, cracked tiles on the floor and shower of the bathroom, no chrome left on the taps, a very scuffed bedroom  floor and furniture that looked as old as the hotel. 

We booked a Luxury Panoramic King bedroom at just over £200 per night incl Breakfast. The room was large with a wide balcony and an amazing view from the 7th floor of the Dambulla wing. Our King bed however was two twins pushed together with a groove down the middle (this was not what we expected or paid for), there was no safe in the room (one was installed a day later) and no physical information about the hotel anywhere in the room. We downloaded pdf files from their app but there was no pdf map of the hotel, no Beverage menu (just wine and cocktails) and no information at all about restaurant opening/closing times or which menu related to which dining area. In addition, there were no price or information at all about their main buffet dining restaurant. 

Our check-in experience was awful. We arrived just before 2pm after a very long drive. We finally were allowed to gain access to our room at 3.25pm. In the meantime we were not offered any drinks or snacks whilst we waited (why not???) so we ordered a very poor sandwich from room service for an exorbitant $15.5 excluding taxes and service charge. 

Breakfast was good although the buffet restaurant was crowded with queues for freshly prepared food and the service was hit or miss. Personally I hate buffet dining so we avoided the $24 per head (excluding taxes and service charge) and ate in their Asian restaurant which was much more personal, far less busy and the food pretty good. Imali our server there was wonderful and staff were generally good. 

Prices of food and drink are not cheap here (or indeed throughout Sri Lanka in 5* tourist hotels and restaurants). We holidayed in Japan in 2023 and found it far better value than Sri Lanka despite the fact typical Sri Lankans hotel workers earn around £2,400 pa. It made me wonder if Tourists and staff are being exploited to the benefit of shareholders...

In our first 48 hours we engaged with management on several occasions. They tried to improve our experience but after multiple conversations we just accepted our fate and tried to enjoy our stay as best we could. (Writing this last sentence is not a great advert for this hotel on which the Heritance brand has been built over 30 years and which the Aitken Spence group have subsequently expanded across the region). 

At check-out, the bill for food and drink was correct but there was no recognition of our unhappiness with our stay (why not???). However, at my request, they ended up deducting the cost of that awful sandwich.
title: Not luxury or 5*

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: The location is amazing, and the Bawa building is fantastic. Gorgeous view, grounds, architecture and nice facilities (pools, spa, gym, bird walks etc). But the hotel is really tired, the food is so-so (watery coffee, one-sided toast, usual hotel buffet fare), and the rooms are by now old and faded (though clean). Sagging mattresses, greying sheets, over-bath shower that floods the floor, etc. I've been coming to Kandalama for years now - it used to be a high class, luxury hotel that was known for its food. Now it's more geared towards the mass tourism market - lots of huge coach tours, high volume / low cost food, minimal expenditures on maintenance. Lovely staff, but very young and untrained. With a bit of investment it could be good again, but for now, it'd be wise to manage your expectations. Aitken Spence are not really maintaining it.
title: 5* location/biulding, 3* hotel and food

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Listen to their advice on the monkeys!!
text:
A quite spectacular setting with incredible panoramic views across the lake and beyond. The layout and design is very clever as the hotel blends into its surroundings. 
On our two night visit, we found the hotel staff to be courteous and polite. It is very heavily staffed and needs to be as it’s a very busy hotel. Constant arrivals and departures. 

The room outlook was spectacular and it was spacious. It was showing many signs of wear and tear though. A squeaking bed to poor decorative patching in the bathroom to a heavily marked floor + other areas that need improvement. We looked at another room and it was also showing signs of heavy wear. The room looks tired. 
The room servicing was to a very high standard though and special thanks to the housekeeper. 

For a hotel charging this money, the service needs to be more accurate and consistent. Some examples:
the menus for the hotel are viewable via a QR code in the room - you are told to scan on arrival. The menus are wrong. 
The service around the pool can be slow and inattentive. 
The standard of the evening buffet was poor  quality for vegetarians. 
It is wrong to asks guests to pack and vacate their room when the room has been paid for until the evening. Especially when confirmed at booking in time. 
The tax on alcohol is 38% in addition to the menus prices, so be aware! 

Overall we were not impressed with this hotel considering rating qualification and the price. 
The attitude of the staff is not in question. More a training requirement, some modernisation to rooms and an overall effort by all the hotel management to ensure detail is correct.
title: Amazing setting and deserving of a better guest experience.

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
We were somewhat disappointed with our stay at the Heritence Kandalama . The hotel is quite a distance from the local sites and about a twenty minute drive down a bumpy dirt road to reach it . 
We had a so-called luxury room which was more of a three-star standard.  The hotel was built about twenty-five years ago and starting to show its age. It seemed to cater to tour bus groups.   Our luxury view was simply a bunch of trees in front of our balcony so I wouldn’t recommend paying the extra cost for that.  Since we would be arriving a few hours before the standard check in time, we decided to pay for two nights so we could have an earlier check in.  The hotel agreed to comp one breakfast since we were actually not there. 
The food at the dinner buffet is excellent but the breakfast was of a completely different standard.  
The staff literally took the plates from our table as we were actively eating.  I complained because we needed to replenish our plates, only to come back to find our table cleared.  That’s one example of several service failures we incurred during our stay.   
Upon check out, they then refused to comp the breakfast which they had already agreed upon, since we had paid for two nights but only stayed for one.   After a thirty-minute discussion, they finally agreed.  
This hotel is famous but, in our opinion,, highly overrated.   As is the case everywhere in Sri Lanka, nearly all skilled hospitality workers have left the country due to the ongoing financial crisis.  The lack of training was all too evident at this hotel.   Once was enough.
title: Overrated-Poor Service

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
I had high expectations for the this hotel. It is one of the most expensive in Sri Lanka (exceeded by AmanWella and AmanGalla) and I expect much out of them as a result. Alas this was not the case. 

The negatives.
- Although architecturally designed, it is practically a let down. We had two different rooms during our stay (for the why see note below), and they were both noisy (you can hear through the next room connecting door and through the room entrance door). The second night, our room was on the 6th floor, and its floor was directly above the 5th floor corridor so you can hear loudly people rolling their suitcases to and from rooms. 
- It seems there is expediency in dealing with customers;  For example, during breakfast the check was brought as we started eating the breakfast! Can't they wait till we finish our breakfast? 
- There are few if any 240V sockets available in the rooms (sockets are British style), and not a single USB outlet anywhere. There is a USB outlet on the TV but you need to have the TV on, to charge your phone. This is 2024; a USB outlet is a must for such an expensive hotel. 
- There was a smaller TV in the more expensive room (Panasonic) and a larger one in the cheaper room (Samsung). We use the TV screen to watch video film we prepare during our travels. 
- The hotel is not very flexible. We booked a night first and then another second night at a different price. Even though we suggested the hotel leave us in the same room - the lower price room with no credit expected - we had to move rooms. 

The positives.
- The hotel is architecturally designed by a well known Sri Lankan architect, Geoffrey Bawa. It is built on the side of a rock outcropping and merges with the surrounding landscape. It is composed of two wings, with the main floor is on level 5. We stayed on levels 2 and 6. We suggest you stay in the Sirigiya wing, facing the east side as it's much nicer and away from the hotel drive way and arrival/departure noise. The buffet restaurant is above the Sirigiya wing as well. 

- There are three pools, in the center(recommend as it has nice view), on the 7th floor (rock pool - very shallow) and at the end of the west wing (the biggest pool). 

- The restaurants are excellent, full of choice. The buffet (which has a seating area near the rock wall across a short walk) costs about 7100 rupees/person for lunch and 4200 rupees/person for breakfast. The a la carte restaurant on the 7th floor has a variety of courses. Soups start around 1200/person; other dishes are more expensive. It was quiet since most visitors come in packages that includes buffet. 

- There is included accommodation for the drivers; ours said he had a nice place to stay and nice food available to him. 

- As usual with Sri Lanka, the staff is very friendly. A gentleman called Dominic came and spoke to us in fluent English providing information on most things. 

All in all a nice stay; there is plenty to improve and we hope they do that soon.
title: Great location with improvement potential.

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
When you drive into the hotel, and as you first walk into it, it is just breath taking. The natural beauty of the surrounding as well as the way the whole building is built is quite a sight to behold. What immediately strikes you as walk about and are given the orientation is just how big the property is. The wings are way longer than I imagined, a truly architectural marvel. The building I believe was built ~30 years ago and I could only imagine how magnificent and ground breaking it must have been back then when brand new. They have done astoundingly well to preserve the nature around and let the nature abound in and on the hotel itself. We were in a top floor room and it is amazing when walking in the open hallways to be right at the height of the canopy. In the mornings and evenings it is quite the bird watching tour you can do for yourself just strolling the property. And the views from the lobby and the pool area deserve a special mention. You can see straight through to Sigirya behind, as well the big lake and the mountains carpeted with thick jungle. One is well advised to carry your binoculars when visiting as there is many a bird to spot here -- Brahmin kites, eagles, grey hornbills, bee-eaters, pelicans to name a few.

The shame here is that the property is a bit dated, and there are bits which really need a bit of sprucing up or at least basic maintenance. This is an open jungle hotel (of sorts) so my expectation isn't that you fumigate the corridors so there are no critters, that's fine and in fact part of the whole experience. But this is a jungle there is a load of critters, and the walls in the corridors some of them are plasters from top to bottom with bugs smashed up (presumably flying in at night), I didn't get why they don't bother just cleaning it up. Things like that don't really add any charm. The rooms as well while comfortable are probably 5 or 10years too old. The bathrooms could really do with a bit of refurbishment. Similarly the pool area, its so beautifully set but the access is all muddy and messy (when it rains). Surely it is possible to maintain an easy path to and from the pool. Not to exaggerate but I don't really want to slip in my flip flops on the way to the pool.

Lets get to the food next. This was my first stop in the Sri Lanka trip and I was very excited about all the great food I'd have. So in short, this is not the place for good food. The food was just disappointing. The snacks at the lobby bar are super average, nothing like a 5 star standard. We didn't want the buffet so we had a-la-carte the first night. What an experience. We ordered, and then waited and waited and waited for 60 minutes !! And the food, it was so average, so tasteless. It gave me 0 confidence to try the buffet of course. The next day we just has the very average pizza at the lobby and some ice cream and just skipped the meal altogether. The breakfast buffet is extensive but average, unfortunately nothing to write home about.

This could be such a super hotel as the building blocks are all there. They need some investment to spruce things up. They need to change up the kitchen and the food completely. And then what they also need is more staff and better trained waiting staff. To be clear everyone is polite and helpful as they best can be. But this is not a five star hotel level of food & service. I expect so much more! I hope the management takes note.
title: Great architecture, Spectacular location, Disappointing food/service

placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring a kindle if you want to read in bed lighting is poor
text:
You can't fail to be in awe of Geoffrey Bawa's vision and the architectural masterpiece he created. The engineering is quite something nestling the Heritance against the hillside with beautiful views of lake Kandalama at the front. A wildlife paradise for all to view. Inside it is very minimalist with something to see around every corner. Sometimes it felt like we were part of a sci-fi movie. There is a book in the library describing the vision and building process. 
We were greeted warmly on arrival and ushered into the cafe for the registration. We ordered a couple of snacks (Our first 2 choices were unavailable) service was slow, arrival drinks forgotten. The chicken spring rolls were delicious getting a plate to put them on proved difficult.
Our room was the smallest of the 7 we have stayed in in Sri Lanka and as others have reviewed a little tired with poor lighting and in need of a deep clean. There was lots of dust under the waste paper basket and the curtains were stained. A few items were missing - only 1 water glass, no laundry bag which we needed, no robes or fridge. All were promptly rectified. Initially we were informed there was a charge for the fridge however this apparently is only in December phew. 

Now for the food, we're not big fans of buffets so elected for the a la carte restaurant on the 7th floor. Tastefully appointed and never busy it was our choice for 4 nights. The first night the service was very slow and we were mistakenly presented will the bill before we  had seen any food. The couple at the next table received the wrong bill and left. When my meal arrived it was cold, it was reheated but by then I had lost my appetite. The manager very kindly took it off the bill. We found all the mistakes over the next few nights quite entertaining just like an episode of Fawlty Towers. 
Breakfast is in the buffet restaurant there is a huge choice. Some of the windows have blown so you miss the beautiful view. Often staff would try and take your plate when you were still eating or stretch over you to remove something whilst you were taking a sip. Overall the food was ok but by no means the best we have tasted in Sri Lanka.
 Chamara was our favourite waiter always greeted with a smile and showed great attention to detail. We both said several times the staff " just didn't get it" he did. 
Better attention to detail and improved training for staff would hugely improve the Heritance experience.
title: Like marmite love it or hate it!

We take these concerns seriously, and we will be addressing them promptly to ensure a more comfortable and enjoyable stay for our future guests.

Regarding the ambiance in the bar and the dining options, we regret that your experience did not meet your expectations. We are committed to providing a relaxing and pleasant atmosphere for our guests, and your comments about the lack of ambiance and the quality of food and service will be shared with our  team to make the necessary improvements.

We appreciate your kind words about our friendly and welcoming staff. Providing excellent customer service is our top priority, and it's heartening to know that our team made a positive impression on you.

Your valuable feedback is invaluable to us, and we genuinely appreciate your insights as they help us enhance our guest experience. We hope that you might consider giving us another opportunity to serve you in the future, and we will strive to make your next visit more enjoyable.

Once again, we thank you for sharing your thoughts with us, and we hope to welcome you back in the near future.

Warm regards,
Asela Wavita
General Manager

Regenerate
placeInfo/address: Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Nice hotel, but needs some serious updating. When we arrived, it was dark outside. The room looked amazing, but waking up we saw a lot of flaws. The concrete outside our balcony is completely tumbling down  (even “bars” were missing —> see picture). The toilet seat is in urgent need of replacement (it looked very dirty). The room itself, one thing missing: sockets. We couldn’t charge anything, unless we unplugged the bedside lamps. There were some sockets in the middle of the bed, but we couldn’t reach them. We live in a time of multiple devices, so plugs are a necessity. 

The bar. Well, for a hotel of this standard, it felt like we were in a convention center. Zero atmosphere, just chairs in the middle of a dark room (no candles, no plants, no nothing)

The restaurants. As it’s “impossible” to leave the hotel in the evening (elephants passing the road, which is amazing!) you need to eat in 1 of the available restaurants. There are 3 options: the buffet restaurant (not our thing, very crowded), one a la carte restaurant (nobody was sitting there. It was completely empty) or the bar (very unpleasant to sit —> see picture). The prices are very high and the quality to be honest not of a high standard for the price requested.  They take advantage of you not being able to leave. We had dinner in the bar one evening; my partner got his salade 15m before I got my club sandwich (which was cold pre-made, so I don’t get why we had to wait so long). And what I found very strange: while eating we had to sign the bill.. feels very strange.

Important to mention: the staff is very welcoming and friendly.

One more remark: they were delivering fresh fruits to some rooms. Still wondering why not our superior room for which we paid a lot of money.

So in general: nice hotel in an amazing setting but in urgent need of some 2023 updates. Not a 5 star hotel for us.
title: Nice hotel, but in urgent need of some botox

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Have your own lights.
text:
When you arrive in a place named « eco lodge » you are expecting some positive attitude towards environnement…

How then can we explain air conditionning under a tent?? It is useless.

Another negative point is lights. We can barely see what we have around us inside tent. Same in restaurant if you do not choose a table below light.
But no problem of light on the path…

The only positive point is the way they organise safari in Yalla.
title: Not Eco at att

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
This ecolodge glamping concept is splendid but just not in the right place.
Mosquitoes everywhere prevented any outdoor enjoyment.
We were offered arrival cocktails by the fire pit but couldn’t sit for longer than a couple of minutes.
Our accommodation was first class, but the tent had 3 zipped layers that had to remain closed to prevent mosquito access. We couldn’t sit outside to admire the locality.
Staff very friendly and all food excellent.
We used this as a base to visit Yala national park, but it’s quite a long trip even by car and jeep.
If you can tolerate mozzie bites, the lakeside situation, top notch tent accommodation with 4 poster bed, friendly staff, lots of local wildlife (birds, monkeys, lizards) and great food choices, this is the place for you😎🦟🦎🐒🦜
title: Lovely place, great concept. Mosquitoes!!!!!!

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It’s an hours drive from Yala National Park
text: Glamping in a lovely setting by the lake with excellent facilities and friendly helpful staff. A great place to see birds and get close to nature. The food is good too. The downside is that it is close to the main road and we were kept awake by the wailing from the local temple at night. A lot of mosquitoes too which made getting in and out of the tent challenging especially in the evening. Thankfully we did bring an insecticide spray with us.
title: Lovely environment but noisy at night!

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
2 nuits horribles a cause du bruit de la route et de hauts parleurs de temple 
Obligé de mettre la Clim pour couvrir le bruit 
Absolument rien à faire autour et 50 minutes de Yala !!!’
La vue n’a rien à voir avec le site internet
Et c’est une ambiance triste 
On paie cher une écologie!!
title: 2 days in Lodge

ownerResponse/text:
Hi

Greetings from Flameback Eco Lodge!

While appreciating your kind comments about the tented lodges, food and service, we deeply regret if you were sleep deprived due to the reasons mentioned. While we do not have any resident dogs within the hotel premises, as it's a open space, I believe a stray dog would have entered the property. We always ensure to provide the utmost care and service to our resident guests and should this issue have been brought up, our staff would have taken steps to prevent same. There are community events very occasionally in the nearby village which is not within our control but we do apologize once again for any inconvenience caused to you

Dulani
placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Research the location before you book
text:
We stayed at the Flameback for 2 nights after touring the cultural triangle and the tea country. Our first impression was that the resort did not reflect the impression from the website. The proximity to the road that runs across the lake takes away the authenticity. The tents are quite simple but comfortable, food was quite good.
Power and WI FI was always cutting out. The resident dogs that live in the camp seemed to follow us around.
On our second night we were exhausted from our early morning game drive and so After dinner we returned to our tent only to find the dog sitting on our deck and we could not get it to leave. We went to bed just before 10 pm. I fell asleep and was woken by the dog growling loudly 15 minutes later. This was followed by a loud event across the lake with drumming and singing until 2 am. Coupled with the dog circling our tent howling like a wolf. We had no sleep and left feeling exhausted. In my view this camp is not in the right place to offer an authentic experience with nature.
title: Noisy location

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text:
Small tented ecolodge near causeway but we were not troubled by traffic noise. 
Comfortable beds, effective air con and powerful shower. 
A number of easily rectified issues. 
1. Service hit and miss 
2. Broken chairs on verandah
3. Broken sun loungers of which there are only four
4. On return from safari would be good to be met with cold wet towel
5. Inadequate lighting in bedroom 
6. No offer of Towels being  replaced 
7. More charging points e.g an extension lead
8. Dinner menu choice ordered at lunchtime on one occasion they had forgotten and served wrong meal. 
Sri Lankan food good 
Good location for Bundala and Katharagama
title: Has potential but ……

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: Wir wurden sehr freundlich empfangen. Das Konzept passt zu einer Safari-Tour. Wenn man keinen Komfort und bei der Sauberkeit nicht so empfindlich ist, ist es sicher ein Hotel für Abenteurer. Bettwäsche war nicht sauber, sonst war das Übrige noch im grünen Bereich gewesen. Ungeziefer/ Insekten sind normal bei der Vegetation, besonders weil das Wohnzelt am Boden nicht besonders gut abgedichtet ist. Koffer in solchen Ländern sollten stets nach Gebrauch geschlossen werden.  Nachts waren wir durch die vorherigen Hotels auf Sri Lanka von lauten, aber angenehmen Naturgeräuschen verwöhnt worden. Im Wohnzelt konnten wir die Nacht nicht schlafen, da es undefinierbare und laute Geräusche gab, die einen Menschen haben wachsam lassen. Frühstück und das Abendessen waren sehr gut. An der Sauberkeit des Geschirrs kann man noch arbeiten. Für eine 5 Sterne Reise war das ganz sicher kein geeignetes Hotel gewesen
title: Passt zu einer Safari-Tour

ownerResponse/text:
Hi

Greeting from Flameback Eco Lodge!

Thank you for choosing our hotel during your visit to the deep south of Sri Lanka! Also, for your kind review on our food, location, accommodation, service and activities. 

As with our motto of being an eco -friendly hotel and being one with nature, we try to minimise use of energy in our operations. While we have instilled eco-friendly air-conditioning and geezers which are essential to provide  comfort to our guests to meet their expectations of a luxury glamping experience , we have opted not to have televisions and fridges in the Deluxe lodges to preserve energy.

placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka

text:
only small site of 7 "tents" in nice location by lake. Very peaceful and relaxing. swimming pool / fishing/cycling.

upsides- good food and service-very helpful staff. tents modern

downsides- it is ECO so no fridge or tv, and limited hot water.

site not big enough to walk round, but we enjoyed our 2 night stay.
title: better than expected

ownerResponse/text:
Hi

Greetings from Flameback Eco Lodge, Sri Lanka!

Thank you for staying with us during your visit to Sri Lanka and for the in-depth review of the property. We welcome reviews such as yours as the management and the team always strive to enhance our product and services to make Flameback the best Eco Safari Lodge in the deep south of Sri Lanka!

We found your comments very applicable and hope the below justifies your concerns;

Fans in the rooms - As you have rightfully mentioned, all our lodges are equipped with Air-conditioners (With 0% gas emission in order to minimize environmental impact) for the comfort of the guests if they wish to use the A/C as we are located in the dry zone of Sri Lanka and the whether can be very humid at times. 
But as with any glamping tent, the tent flaps can be opened up anytime to use natural ventilation and a 'fan is provided' on request from the housekeeping department(Our staff has been briefed to mention this at the check-in and apologies' if it wasn't done). However - we have addressed your concern and placed standing fans in all the rooms in order to minimize the hassle of requesting a fan. You have made a valid point and we appreciate that for the future benefit of our potential guests.

We are located in the Weerawila Bird sanctuary about 100 meters from the ella-wellawaya road and the beauty of our concept is we are located in 4 acres of lush green surroundings and while our guests do not have to travel a long way inland to get to us, once they are inside the property , they get to experience a sanctuary of it's own. We are proud to say as with our efforts to conserve nature, we are in the process of planting more trees within the sanctuary in our efforts to conserve the lake and the birding population around the area

Thank you for your wonderful remarks about our staff who always strive to ensure our guests have a memorable experience and delighted you enjoyed the Farmer's breakfast during your village tour and you have contributed to their livelihood in doing so as part of the proceeds go to the local family you visited. This activity is a favorite among most of our guests

Warmest Regards
placeInfo/address: Bird Sanctuary, Weerawila Estate, Weerawila 82632 Sri Lanka
text: The staff is superb, and very friendly. The tents have a great design, the view over the lake is wonderful. But Flameback was definitely not our best Sri Lanka experience. The most important reason was lack of a simple fan in the tents. At night the temperature at the lake shore drops a few degrees, but not enough to be able to sleep with tent-doors open (klamboe closed off course) to enjoy the early morning birds. But Flameback tents are designed to close complete off and put A/C on. And that is exactly not the reason we choose for tents. Glamping (glamour tents) should enable us to really be in touch with nature, specially at night. The humming of an A/C with everything complete locked blocks that idea. Another thing which made us feel less in touch with nature is the main road, which is just a 100 meters away. There is not a lot a traffic, but the road does not add to the lodge and being isolated concept. Lunch was okay, dinner superb, with prices a bit expensive. Wine bottle cost over 6000 SLR. So were the room rates if we compare it with similar lodges. We really enjoyed the farmers breakfast: 30 minutes easy bike ride away: learn and see how local people live and work, with a superb breakfast and fresh buffalo milk.
title: Flameback: good but some concept issues

roomTip: Don’t be scared of all the bag checking and scanning in Galle hotels. Apparently it’s normal to have security with guns go through your stuf
text:
We stayed at this hotel during the final leg of our Galle trip, as it was also the venue for a friend’s wedding. Sadly, what should’ve been a memorable night turned into a disaster — myself, my daughters, and around 20 other guests came down with food poisoning after the wedding dinner. Instead of enjoying our last day, we spent it recovering in bed and bracing for our flight out. Not exactly the send-off we imagined.

Because of that, I’m rating our stay 2.75 stars. Without the food poisoning, I would’ve given it 3.5 stars, thanks to the beautiful ocean views and charming colonial aesthetic.

That said, there were a few letdowns beyond the food. Our expectations were admittedly high after staying at a nearby five-star resort — but things like bird droppings on the balcony, confusing hot water taps, a worn-out pool area, and checkout staff who didn’t bother asking if we were okay or offer help with bags fell short. To top it off, we later found out other guests received breakfast boxes upon checkout — which we were never offered. A small thing, but it left a sour note (no pun intended).

The standout, however, was a wonderful housekeeping attendant on level 2, whose name I wish I’d written down. He went above and beyond — helping us get ready for the wedding, swiftly replacing vomit-soiled carpets the next day, and even bringing us flowers. His kindness and attention to detail were the only redeeming parts of our stay, and if it were up to me, he’d get 5 stars and a pay rise!

This hotel has potential — its history and character are undeniable. But if you’re expecting seamless five-star service and luxury, you may be left disappointed. I genuinely hope the management learns from this experience — and recognises the quiet hero on their housekeeping team who made a tough time just a little bit better.
title: This could have been a 3.5 star rating for me, but then we got food poisoning… so I’ve dropped it to 2.75 stars.

Also the staff at reception were very pushy approaching us to try to get us to visit stores etc that we did t want to go to. It ended up being harassment and totally unprofessional and unacceptable . Galle Face management should put a stop to this behavior

text:
The famous old Colombo hotel, perched on the Indian Ocean, in the heart of the city.  Not quite so grand these days, but a lovely experience, all together. 

Rooms are specious and functional, balcony large. Reasonably comfortable room/bed. Hotel features  couple of restaurants and bars. All very average in terms of food and drinks quality. The Verandah is the best in terms of food quality and good service. 

The so called heritage pass is useless, so don’t worry about it. Drinks served on the chessboard by the sea, perfect for sunset. 

Overall, should be visited especially if on your first visit to Colombo. Can be pleasant. Not great value for money.

text:
I am gutted to give a 3 as this is such a beautiful 5 star hotel. The oldest in Colombo and gives the full colonial experience. Service very old school and a pleasure to see. Room very spacious with all mod cons. I suppose that in giving a 3, I want somebody from the hotel to read this! Our problem was when we came to eat? We had already been to the pool-the biggest in our whole trip, with possibly the grumpiest lifeguard-but I will forgive him that! So, we looked at the menu at Firebeach and went back there…..what a mess! Maybe half the tables were filled. Nobody served us, so I got my own menus. I noted a gentleman on the next table also with a room key (a hotel guest) looking frustrated. Eventually I waved to somebody and at this point, the other gentleman is (‘quite rightly) upset as he has been waiting even longer than us! All of us expressed our feelings at not being served. We got a sort of an apology but nothing off the bill or a free drink. The food was average.
I could not identify who was in charge…and that was the main problem-it was completely disorganised. The staff in general seemed more interested in chatting to each other and nobody was ‘watching the room’. I am not a huge complainer, but this really hacked me off, because it was so unnecessary…..but the reality is that it is an integral part of the hotel-maybe the senior management don’t get down to the poolside too much?
We would have liked to have had breakfast which undoubtedly would have helped, but unfortunately we had a very early flight.
title: Lovely historic hotel- I think we were just unlucky!

roomTip: Avoid New Year's Eve, when the hotel gives itself over to a thumping outdoor party between 7pm and 6am, from which hotel guests are excluded
text:
The hotel is undeniably impressive, steeped in history and ambience as it is. But there is a fine line between characterful atmosphere on the one hand, and tired and shabby on the other. I think this hotel is complacently trading on the former, but falling into the latter.  

The food is superb - the best dinner and breakfast buffets we had in a month in Sri Lanka, both in terms of quality and scope. The service is by and large efficient and friendly. And the location is wonderful, right on Galle Face Green and the sea.

However, the grubby swimming pool area definitely needs upgrading. The bedrooms are tired and shabby. There is NO sound-proofing between rooms - we could hear every detail of our poor neighbour's upset stomach during the night. And there is absolutely no excuse for copious mould in our ensuite bathroom in a hotel which claims an international standard. Of course none of this really matters, but for the high price they are charging for the rooms. If you  pay an international rate, you ought to be able to expect international standards.
Very disappointing stay, to be honest.
title: Poor for the money spent

text:
The Galle Face is an iconic hotel and I have always loved visiting and staying on my every visit to Colombo, Sri Lanka. This was my 4th visit in the last 4 years and 4th stay at Galle Face. 

But this time I have to say, I did not enjoy my stay and perhaps next time will consider booking another hotel. While the hotel on the exterior is  impressive, the interiors are old and need a serious uplift. The carpets are smelly, the AC has a stench to it, typical to one that is very old. The room's interiors are not great. Except their highest category of room, all the other rooms are not impressive. They maybe bigger rooms comparatively but the quality of the room is low. I also found the rooms extremely used and lived in (not sure if this makes sense) and this gave me a weird feeling. The smell in the room from the AC really started to get to me and luckily I only stayed a night but I felt like I would have got sick had I had to stay another night. 

The hotel does have an unprecedented view of the ocean and its unique location is special, given how close it is to the ocean. That is one of the reasons I like to stay here. But this time, the hotel felt extremely busy, they had a lot of visitors, service was extremely slow and it was painful to keep waiting for a plate or extra cup in the room. The breakfast was below average and so was the breakfast service. Almost every night there was a wedding or event at the hotel, so it felt extremely noisy, busy and chaotic. In peak season time I would not recommend this property. 

I have to say the staff does try their best to make the stay comfortable and are very kind and polite. But the property did feel dated to me and all the flaws in the room did stand out a lot more this time than they have in the past. It still is a beautiful property but the room are just not good.
title: Dissapointing Stay

text:
The hotel definitely needs upgrade. Key door locks are way old fashion, too many steps in room which makes it a safety risk, also steps to the top floor is absolutely absurd in this day and age, we had to request a room chage because of this which the reception obliged.
Lighting in room especially in bathrooms are dim. Service was very slow, had to wait more than 30 mins for luggage to be taken from room by porter only after a reminder. Swimming pool minimum depth was 5 mts which is not suitable for non swimmers also no spa pool which is way below other up and coming hotels. Also ordered king coconut water which was too expensive considering the water tasted awful,  was approximately 2100 SKL. On the positive side staff were very helpful and friendly, breakfast buffet was excellent .  Finally, sorry management ,but I  wouldn't stay there ever again!!!
title: Too expensive for the quality of the hotel

ownerResponse/text:

Noel - Galle Face Hotel
text:
Historic hotel with old world charm, amazing location, well appointed and comfortable rooms. 

The soft infrastructure is severely lacking. Service is poor, inconsistent and chaotic. Breakfast is very poor. Worst hoppers I’ve ever have - brittle and overcooked. Coffee takes forever. You have to ask multiple staff, multiple times for coffee, water, cutlery etc. Same at the hotel bars where the drinks were mediocre and watered down. 

Given the service and breakfast - at this price point - I would say the hotel is poor value for money. Until management changes, I would look elsewhere!
title: Historic hotel but service is poor, inconsistent and chaotic, particularly breakfast

text: This is truly a beautiful hotel with a great location.  The rooms are large and nice.  But the service is woeful.  It is just not that it is very slow, but it is generally unthoughtful.  They don’t clean the rooms in a timely manner.  The room service is slow.  I had ordered sodas and they brought the soda bottles without a bottle opener.  The service in the Fire Beach restaurant is even worse.  They served the main course without the sides and after the main course was finished they brought the sides (which had to be returned).  Not happy at all.  A good hotel only if you don’t expect good service.
title: Beautiful hotel with really bad service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Athula,

Thank you sincerely for your kind review! We are delighted you enjoyed your stay with us.

We also thank you for your candid review and appreciate your comments as feedback from our valued guests is the best way for us to improve our product.

Do feel free to visit us again, and please try our buffets for Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner at the Verandah. You may also want to drop by our other restaurants including 1864, Fire Beach, and Traveler's Bar for a dining experience in true GFH style.

Noel - GFH
text: The Queen bed was exceptionally comfortable, and the pillows were soft and inviting. However, the room itself was small, with furnishings that felt outdated and reminiscent of an antique style. It appeared as though the room hadn't been renovated in generations, and it’s in dire need of serious remodeling to meet modern standards. Considering the nightly rate—which exceeds those of more contemporary hotels in Colombo—the pricing felt unjustified. It seems the hotel's primary appeal lies in its historical charm. On a positive note, the breakfast buffet, included in the room rate, was excellent, offering an extensive selection of dishes to cater to a wide range of preferences.
title: Galle Face Hotel, Colombo Stay

Noel - Galle Face Hotel
roomTip: Don’t be happy about an upgrade. Do t stay in room 1008. The windows no double glazing and the bed is towards a dirty window
text:
From the outside the hotel looks beautiful. Security is top notch . Then we received an upgrade which normally is wonderful. Well, if this was an upgrade I wonder what the normal room would have been like. We had  an early start, no roomservice available before 8am. They did provide a bag with sandwich banana and coconut water for on the road. 
The room was facing the ocean , no double glazing, bar of the beach plays loud disco music until midnight. The phone in the room has no directions of how to call reception.
title: Old style emphasizing old

roomTip: Er zijn mooiere hotels voor minder geld
text:
Van de 6 hotels die we itijdens onze rondreis in Sri Lanka bezocht hebben. heeft Galle Face Hotel de minste prijs kwaliteit verhouding. Zeker dubbel zo duur als de andere bij. en de minste kamer.  Deze keer geen balkon en uitzicht op een hoog buur gebouw en de bouwplaats van het hotel.
Betalen met creditcard diende vooraf te gebeuren (direct betaald,  geen restvering). Bij vertrek was er LkR 28000 te veel betaald,  wat op de credit card terug gestort zou worden.  Het is nu 6 weken later,  msec nog steeds niet gebeurd. Diverse keren mail contact gehad en toezegging gekregen dat het opgelost zou worden,  maar helaas.   Op mail wordt intussen niet meer gereageerd.
Hier ga ik niet meer heen.
title: Niet voor herhaling vatbaar: vergane glorie!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for your kind review, we are thrilled you enjoyed your stay with us.

Do please reach out to us at noel.amath@gallefacehotel.com when planning your next visit to Sri Lanka and we will be delighted to recommend a quieter room for you and make all arrangements to ensure your next stay with us is a memorable one.

Thank You and Best Regards
Noel - GFH
text: This is a real heritage hotel but also a bit dated. We choose this hotel for our first night’s stay after arriving in Sri Lanka. The room was facing the road and it was quite noisy and everything is a bit tired. However the atmosphere of the place was great. Fantastic breakfast on a terrace overlooking the garden and the sea. As it was just for one night we didn’t regret our choice.
title: A bit of faded glory but worth visit

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you for your feedback. We're pleased to hear you enjoyed our dedicated staff, breakfast offerings, and prime seaside location. We appreciate your observations on the building's condition and the noise from the terrace-restaurant. Rest assured, your comments will help us improve our guest experience. We hope to welcome you back for a more tranquil stay in the future.

Warm Regards,

Yohan Gunarathne 
Director Front Office
roomTip: Cuidado con las habitaciones con vistas al mar, son muy ruidosas. Llevar adaptador de corriente, aunque el hotel los suministra sin problema
text: El hotel es un clásico de la ciudad, donde se hospedaban las celebridades en el siglo XX. Supongo que en XXI hay opciones mejores. El edificio conserva la espectacularidad de antaño, pero está muy mal conservado: pintura desconchada, aspecto viejo… Es una pena, porque su ubicación al borde del mar es perfecta. En la parte positiva: un personal entregado y competente y un desayuno magnífico, con oferta local e internacional. Hay una terraza-restaurante instalada en una de las fachadas, con música alta hasta medianoche. El problema es que las habitaciones con vistas al mar dan a ella, de manera que quienes busquen tranquilidad deben pedir expresamente habitación que de al otro lado. El hotel está situado cerca de un montón de restaurantes, tiendas y de un centro comercial enorme para el que le vaya ese rollo.
title: Para no exigentes

roomTip: Indian don’t come here specially vegetarian.
text:
The property is average and not worth visit second time. They even charge for extra bottles of  water in room . I have been 15 days in Sri Lanka and changed 8-9 hotels nobody ask money for water bottles. What’s special about them that they charge for it. 

Food taste for Indians is not good. Indian vegetarian was there but no good taste . Only dosa was one good dish to eat and that saved us from being hungry. Nobody interested in asking whether food was good or bad. They really don’t care for it. Vegetarian Desserts were horrible.  Overall I think Indians should avoid this hotel. Breakfast have no milk shakes . Had bread and butter in breakfast . 

They have more liking towards Other European and Americans menu. And taste
title: Not recommended For Indians. The food is not of good taste and even the desserts were very. Bad in taste.

placeInfo/locationString: Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
I visited the ayurvedic spa today for a foot reflexology treatment session for me and my husband. 
While the masseuse Renuka was very professional and did her best, sadly the setting of the massage room was not very relaxing or at least welcoming. 

While the previous occasions I stayed at the hotel (not the spa, this was my first time) was super great, this was a bit dissapointing. From Amaya Hills we expected better. 

To start with the massage room was really small and had hardly any space to move freely. The air was not so great to breathe, and i expected it to be aromatic or at least calming. I wasn't offered a robe and was seated on an arm chair, which wasn't comfortable at all.

While I got the relaxation through the massage, I developed a back pain by sitting in that ergonomically dead wrong chair.

Anyway the masseuse Renuka did her job well. Apart from that the only plus thing I saw about the whole thing was the prompt and flexible communication of Dr. Nirmani.

In a nutshell, the hotel management best attend improving the quality of the environment to be suited for a 4 star hotel spa.
title: The environment and the amenities in the massage rooms at the Amaya Hills spa could really use more improvement

roomTip: Positives are food, location and luxury. Negatives are pool accessablity, steep steps, scary roads up the hill
text:
A scary trip. The driver circled the lake 4 times and was constantly on his mobile phone while dodging traffic, dogs, tuk tuks and buses. We left Wattala prior to 10am but didn't arrive until 4.15pm.
The hotel is stunning, reception and location romantic, bed linen housekeeping amazing.  Restaurant the best I experienced. Views are incredible. However...today I attempted to visit the pool. Elderly, disabled with difficulty walking couldn't find a dry towel, couldn't find an attendant, eventually offered a lounge along the deep end. Involving wiggling past the deep end.  I rely on my arms to lower myself.  Where's the shallow end entry? On the far side meaning wiggle past the deep end again at entry and exit. I gave up. Another 13 days Im stuck here , basically in my room as all walks around here are steep steps without rails.  🥹
title: Gilded prison
