roomTip: Taxi/TukTuk in die City über Uber buchen, viel günstiger als über die Rezeption
text: Die Hotelanlage ist wunderschön, toller Ausblick und toller Garten. Zimmer roch leicht muffig und leider konnte man nur in der Badewanne duschen mit kleinem Schutz - Überschwemmungsgefahr. Die Klimaanlage ist in die Jahre gekommen und hat gelegentlich einen unangenehmen Geruch im Zimmer verbreitet. Das Restaurant gleicht eher einer lauten Halle und die Kellner schienen eher gestresst. Essensauswahl okay, man ist satt geworden. Wir waren nur zwei Nächte durch unsere Rundreise hier, dafür war es in Ordnung.
title: War okay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear sasikumars2025,

Thank you for your kind and detailed review! We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed the beautiful garden, food, and the peaceful atmosphere at Amaya Hills. Yoga’s dedication to maintaining the garden is truly commendable, and we will certainly share your appreciation with him. We look forward to welcoming you again for another memorable experience!

Warm regards,
Team Amaya Hills
placeInfo/locationString: Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
Amaya Hills is a truly wonderful place with a breathtaking garden and delicious food. The garden is beautifully maintained, creating a peaceful and refreshing atmosphere. A huge credit goes to the gardener, Yoga, who does an incredible job. He is a very genuine and hardworking man, ensuring that every plant, flower, and tree is perfectly taken care of. His dedication can be seen in how neat and well-arranged the entire space is.

Maintaining such a large and beautiful garden is not easy, but Yoga handles it with great passion and commitment. His work adds to the charm of Amaya Hills, making it a perfect place to relax and enjoy nature. Along with the stunning surroundings, the food here is also amazing! Every dish is prepared with great taste and quality, making the dining experience even more enjoyable.

I truly respect Yoga for his hard work and dedication. People like him, who put their heart into what they do, deserve appreciation. If you ever visit Amaya Hills, take a moment to enjoy the garden and the delicious food. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves nature, good food, and a peaceful atmosphere. It’s truly a wonderful experience!
title: Garden and out look

text:
The drive upto this hotel is difficult. It sit on top of a hill with views over the valley.

On arrival the very dates hotel with young inexperienced reception staff. 
The hotel is laid out in a strange way. The main bar is so small with no music or atmosphere. We had to get chairs and sit in the passageway.

Rooms are dated and bathroom extremely small and dated. The bed was comfortable.
The balcony is too small for a chair. View was great.

On a good note the restaurant food and staff were excellent. The staff were organised and efficient. The food was good and hot.

There pool area looked good but we didn’t try it.
title: Very strange layout.

placeInfo/locationString: Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
An unfortunate incident marred what could have been a very nice stay at the Amaya Hills resort.
While checking out, the person at the counter returned a short amount against the cash I gave. The amount was not  large , about LKR1800. I realised that I had received a short amount when I was just checking my account on the way to the next place in the car. I immediately called the hotel and told them. I do believe they checked with the staff and replied that a bank account number was needed to transfer the money. I gave them the number of the travel agent. Both the agent and I followed up on it every day.Until the last day. Everytime they said it would be taken care of.They never did repay the money.
It left a bad taste in the mouth and did hint at the lack of honesty & transparency,after all it was a small amount. They could have refused at the first go but never did so.
This will always remain a black mark in the mind.
title: Lack of Transparency

text: Having enjoyed our stay at their sister hotel we found this somewhat disappointing in comparison. The hotel is in a great location with stunning views. We were located on the 3rd floor and there was no lift, so a fair few step to get to the room. The dining area was again not great, the buffet items were at best Luke warm unless you went for a personal stir fry. Also in the morning they didn’t display tea bags and the hot water was tepid so you had to speak to 2 or 3 people to get hot tea. The staff were also not as engaging or friendly as at the lake hotel. Beware the price of alcohol as the menu does not include taxes or service which adds a third to the price.
title: Great location but overall disappointing

text:
After 4 hours in a taxi and expecting to be on a stunning mountain top hotel sadly not to be. 

A frosty welcome to the hotel and told sit down whilst they sort out things. 

We were shown to our room and it was dark and dingy , musty and generally not a good advert for the hotel. 

We discussed this with the management and explained the web site photos and what we actually had . Initially we were asked if we had tuned the lights on !!. 

After many conversations and searching other hotels in Kandy we were offered a different room ( a suite ) - this is exactly the same but with a large bay window and seating area which made it brighter. 

The website offers , gowns , slippers , toiletries but none to be seen in the first room. 
The second room did have ( albeit the web price that afternoon was the same as the price we paid for a lesser room.) 

All in all please give customers what they pay for and do t make them feel embarrassed for asking for it. 

Meals were fine and the takeaway breakfast for our early start was acceptable. 

Not the best hotel in kandy for sure but the website pictures do make it look so
title: Could be so much better

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback on your recent stay at our hotel. We appreciate your observations regarding the structure, room amenities, and dining options. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced and will take your comments into consideration for future improvements. Management - Amaya Resorts & Spas
placeInfo/locationString: Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province
text:
La struttura dell’hotel si presenta formata da una serie di edifici contigui appollaiati sulla cima di una collina a mezz’ora da Kandy. Il luogo è decisamente affascinante, il panorama - foschia permettendo – è un vero sballo. Fanno da cornice picchi e valli di un verde esagerato.
Le ali dell’hotel sono a più piani ed ospitano le stanze in sequenza, arredate in modo sufficiente in stile old fashion anche se il mobilio presenta segni di stanchezza per l’onorato servizio, almeno in quella che mi è stata assegnata (N° 06).
Le camere non sono molto spaziose (circa 20 mq.) ed il layout rispecchia quello tradizionale delle più note catene alberghiere.
Il bagno è piuttosto piccolo – una persona ed è pieno – ed è corredato da una vasca tradizionale a fondo leggermente curvo, senza dotazioni antiscivolo, col rischio concreto di cadere e farsi male. Scatta perciò l’“operazione asciugamano” che steso bagnato sul fondo ripristina l’accident prevention. Anche qui vale la regola inglese di bidet = optional e si è provveduto ad aggiungere accanto al water il solito patetico spruzzino alternativo.
Il lavello, probabilmente in origine incassato nel ripiano, è stato nel tempo sostituito : il bordo di quello attuale appoggiato sopra (e con tracce di ruggine sul fondo esterno) arrivava a circa 110 cm. di altezza. Perfetto per un pivot, ma mia moglie ci arrivava a malapena in punta di piedi !!!
All’arrivo in camera ho verificato la presenza della cassaforte prevista e la gradita la dotazione di due bottiglie di complimentary water subito messe nel frigobar per bercele in freschezza. L’aria condizionata, non indispensabile per l’altitudine, era però utile per il controllo dell’umidità : a raccordare il contrasto c’era un avvolgente soffice piumone.
La ristorazione offre in prevalenza cucina singalese e trascura quella internazionale, quasi inesistente. La scelta di cibi in generale, anche locali, è molto meno ampia e curata della consorella Amaya Lake. Per dovere di cronaca va detto che era disponibile il …. gelato.
La colazione ha identiche caratteristiche di scarsità di scelte e qualità.
Il personale di tavola è veloce ed efficiente. Il vino (ovviamente a pagamento) veniva servito nel secchiello con ghiaccio.
Il bar occupa un ambiente interno risicato e anche i dehors non sono da meno. Abbiamo passato una delle due serale happy hour gustando un aperitivo. L’altra coincideva con la “Festa della Luna Piena” ed era assolutamente …. analcolica (nessuno escluso).
Tenendo conto di quanto riscontrato, la valutazione di **** dichiarata dall'hotel risulta essere sovrastimata di almeno una *.
title: SI PUO' MIGLIORARE

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We appreciate the time you have taken to write a review on trip advisor and we take this opportunity to thank you once again for choosing the Grand Serendib - Kandy for your holiday.

Thank you for your positive feedback and we are delighted that you had a memorable time.
We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Grand Serendib – Kandy.
Thank you,
Management Team - Grand Serendib Kandy
text:
When you first arrive at this location the view and staff smiles are certainly nice. Yet this location does not match five star expectation that you would arrive with. While the properties is well maintained, staff definitely needs better attention to detail and the cook should take one or the other cooking class in the countryside, where Sri Lankan food is often made to perfection (something you would expect from a 5-star hotel).
On the upside, the pool is great and has an amazing view and the sky lounge bar makes up for some of the downsides. For a short stop (two nights) we enjoyed it but value for money is absolutely not where it should be.
title: Stunning view - well overrated

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We are disappointed to find that we did not entirely met your expectations and we would like to apologies most sincerely for this. We have taken into consideration your comments which will be invaluable to our continuous improvement processes.
With the assurance of a better experience next time, we hope you will consider returning to stay with us.

Thank you,
Management Team - Grand Serendib Hotel
text: This hotel was the most expensive of 5 during our trip around SL. On arrival you need to pay in full before going to your room so be prepared if you use Revolut or similar. As is often the way here, you get told nothing at check in and need to work out everything for yourself. Once we were processed and in our room we had half a roll of toilet paper and just 2 hangers for our clothes, which seemed a bit miserly. We ate 2 nights at the hotel. The first night we tried to order a cocktail in the restaurant bar but despite the cocktail menus, no-one there could make them so we went up to the rooftop bar and discovered they also do food up there. I ordered a pork curry which I couldn't eat as the meat was fatty and chewy. My wife ordered the crab curry and was amazed to find that, rather than being served with fresh roti or some other local accompaniment, it came with 4 slices of toast (cheap sliced bread). The following night a lot of places were closed due to the national independence day so we ate again at the hotel and there was a special buffet. It was not bad but when I tried some of the beef curry I had the same issue as the previous night and couldn't eat it. On the positive side, the views are amazing, but many of the staff are quite young and lacking in skills. Basic questions are hard to get answers to, eg "is the breakfast a buffet?". I believe there are probably better places to stay in Kandy, which is a very picturesque city with green hills around a pretty lake, but after 3 nights here we were happy to be moving on.
title: A little disappointing

ownerResponse/responder: Room division manager Grand Serendib Hotel
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

text:
Das Hotel ist nichts besonderes.
Es ist recht klein, was nicht schlimm ist.
Im Erdgeschoss verfügt es  über eine. „Multifunktionsfläche, die alles in einem Lobby, Rezeption, Restaurant und Pool-Area ist.

Der Pool sieht zwar optisch gut aus, ist aber faktisch unbrauchbar. 
Um zum Pool zu gelangen muss man durchs Restaurant gehen, auf dem Rückweg dementsprechend auch. 
Insgesamt nur 6 Liegen und eine Sitzgarnitur stehen am Pool, an der Aussentüre zu Küche.
Diese scheint zwei Kühlschränke in den Poolbereich  ausgelagert zu haben, deren Lüfter den Aufenthalt reichlich beeinträchtigen.

Das Essen ist nicht schlecht, aber auch nicht wirklich gut.
Der Service ist mittelmäßig und nicht sehr aufmerksam. 
Bei der Rezeptionistin muss man leider eine gewisse Arroganz und Unfreundlichkeit  feststellen. 
Das Personal vermittelte, anders als in den anderen von uns in Sri Lanka besuchten Hotels, nicht das Engagement, die Freundlichkeit und die Herzlichkeit. Die Freundlichkeit z.B. an der Rezeption war aufgesetzt und nicht authentisch.

Die Zimmer sind schön und modern eingerichtet.
Die Sauberkeit im Zimmer war ohne Tadel.
Von den Balkons hat man einen reizvollen Blick auf Kandy.
Störend war, dass auf den Etagenfluren, vor den Zimmern, ganztägig viel zu lautes Musik-Gedudel aus den Lautsprechern tönt. Dies ist vollkommen unnütz und geradezu störend.  
Von den 5 besuchten Hotels während unserer Sri Lanka-Reise, kommt das Grand Serendib auf den fünften und letzten Platz.

Da ist noch Luft nach oben, vor allem in einem Punkt, der nichts kostet: Freundlichkeit
title: Das Hotel ist in Kandy und es bietet eine sehr gute Aussucht auf die Stadt. Kurzum: Das war es auch schon!

roomTip: Don’t get a room too close the elevator
text:
The hotel is in a great location and staff goes out of their way. There is a nice little pool and two restaurants (which have the same menu, although they claim differently).
But many of the smaller things could have been done better. The windows have blackout curtains, but you can’t properly close them. There is no suitcase rack in the room. The doors plays a noisy tune when opened, which has no added value and only disturbs the guests in the other rooms. And finally, the rooms are absolutely not sound proof. You can clearly hear noises from all your neighbors and the hallway. And somehow people are pushing furniture around all day starting at 6 AM and ending around 11 PM.
Nice design, nice location, but a bit too restless for us.
title: Nice but no soundproofing

roomTip: Evitar ir de mayo a julio. Llueve mucho
text:
El hotel está muy bien, sin embargo tuvimos un tres inconvenientes: 1) Un mesero nos trajo mal la cuenta en la cena (olvidó poner 2 Coca Colas). Queríamos pagar con tarjeta y nos pidió que si podíamos pagarle las Coca Colas en efectivo, sin siquiera modificarnos la cuenta (es normal pensar mal) Finalmente nos cobró todo en tarjeta por lo mucho que insistimos y tuvimos que bajar a recepción para pedir el ticket corregido. 2) Había obras en el hotel y eran las 10:00 PM y seguían dando martillazos. Tuvimos que llamar a recepción para reclamar y a la primera no hicieron nada, luego volvimos a llamar y finalmente dejaron los ruidos, para empezarlos nuevamente a las 6:00 AM. 3) En el último día de desayuno me serví una especie de pancakes que tenían, que aparentemente no eran pancakes, las cuales me serví con sirope de chocolate, y vino una cocinera a decirme que eso no se comía así, que se servía con curry. No veo normal que el personal de un hotel venga a decirme cómo tengo que servirme y combinar las cosas en mi plato.
Por lo demás, bien. La habitación espaciosa y limpia, cama cómoda y buenas vistas. La piscina también tiene buenas vistas aunque quizás el área se queda pequeño si en algún momento tienen ocupado la mayoría del hotel (durante nuestra estancia estuvo bastante vacío así que no tuvimos ese problema)
El desayuno buffet está bien, no es muy variado pero si vas un par de noches no te aburres.
El restaurante en el rooftop tiene una carta variada y buen ambiente
title: Hay cosas que pueden mejorar

ownerResponse/responder: Room division manager Grand Serendib Hotel
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We appreciate the time you have taken to write a review on trip advisor and we take this opportunity to thank you once again for choosing the Grand Serendib - Kandy for your holiday.

Thank you for your positive feedback and we are delighted that you had a memorable time. 
We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Grand Serendib – Kandy.
Thank you,
Management Team - Grand Serendib Kandy
text:
The good. It’s new, the views are spectacular, monkeys visit your balcony, the breakfasts are enjoyable for variety (even if always slightly warm not hot), a small infinity pool. 
The bad. Endless Richard Clayderman music, over servicing but not serving correctly and forgetting basic things like forgetting your drink or putting an extra placemat down, being asked endlessly what your room number is, a pool that requires you to walk past all the diners in the restaurant and bar, an average dining menu- the pad Thai was dry and literally noodles only and hard to eat (all opposite to the breakfast menu) 
For Sri Lanka, I’m sure based on the higher price paid, this hotel is considered upmarket so I wanted to call it as I see it. There are many things it misses but it may simply be the general hospitality level that Sri Lanka is at. Having said that it was still a more than pleasant stay.
title: It’s the little things that make a place

roomTip: Nice hotel but poorly treated experience with turtle release
text: Can not fault the hotel. The rooms are lovely and the facilities are very good. BUT, the staff “saved” some turtles when they hatched the morning of arrival and told us they’d be setting them off into the ocean that afternoon. That time came, and a tunnel of people was formed for the turtles to make their way down into the sea. The staff thought it would be good to get the kids involved, it wasn’t. They first started their journey to the sea with a dog almost eating them, luckily it was stopped. When the turtles got close to the sea (and everyone was huddled round them trying to record it, probably making it an even more scary experience for them than it already was)  the staff told the kids to help the turtles along (which wouldn’t be the case in a natural birth) then the kids started to grab, squeeze and throw these poor little turtles. To which the parents didn’t stop them and it all got a bit heated. This all should’ve been stopped immediately by staff, which it wasn’t. So what was meant to be a nice release for them to give them an advantage of not being killed before reaching the water, actually resulted in the animals being harmed by disobedient children, parents that fail to control their kids and staff that clearly cared more about getting cute videos to promote themselves on social media than the animals welfare. I spoke to the manager and he didn’t seem to know anything about it, but told me he’d speak to the staff. Hopefully, the manager takes my complaint seriously to stop this reoccurring.
title: Nice hotel and facilities, but poorly treated turtles

text: Отель в целом хороший. Мы его выбрали, тк планируем в апреле месяце поездку с 4-хлетней дочерью, а тут городок и детская комната, что большая редкость для Шри-Ланки. В прошлом году были в Хикка-трансе и я могу сказать, что Аралия ему проигрывает во всем кроме номеров (номера в Аралии новые и довольно большие) и детской зоны ( в хикке ее просто нет). На завтраке бесплатно наливают только проливной кофе, если хочешь капучино или эспрессо, то плати 900-1000 рупей. Но что больше всего не понравилось, это с какой скоростью выполняют сотрудники просьбы… мы уже 3 дня живем в отеле и с заселения просим отремонтировать потолочный вентилятор, нам каждый день кивают-улыбаются, но вентилятор во прежнему не работает! Вчера 3 раза у разных сотрудников просили принести в номер 2 вилки и мочалку, но до сих пор ждём…. Ну а ресторан а-ля карт вообще просто 🔥: пришли мы в него вчера, и говорим хотим поужинать. На что нам сказали, что идите ка лучше на пляж, мы туда вам все принесем) на наш комментарий, что мы хотим поужинать под вентилятором и не на песке, нам предложили сесть за стол, но мы просидели за этим столо�� 10 мин и нам не принесли даже меню! Пришлось идти ужинать в ресторан напротив отеля) Как итог: отель производит приятное впечатление, с претензией на роскошь, пока не копнешь поглубже. Выберем ли мы его для повторной поездки? Я сомневаюсь…
title: Сотрудники не торопятся выполнять просьбы

This is my second visit to Araliya. I had a good experience last time, but this time it felt like the standards had dropped. When I made the reservation a few weeks ago, I requested two rooms next to each other, but this wasn’t arranged. Only one room was ready when we arrived, and the other was given to us later.

The first room we received wasn’t properly cleaned—it had dirt on the sheets and smelled of cigarettes. We called reception three times and even went down to the front desk, but no one came to clean it. The customer service was disappointing, and the hotel didn’t live up to the five-star service it claims to offer.

At the pool area, there were used diapers lying around, which was unpleasant. This place used to be great, which is why I recommended it to my friends. The food was still good, but overall, the experience was disappointing.

roomTip: The clientele is overwhelmingly Russian, so this area is not for you if you have issue with one group of tourists dominating the place.
text:
While the property is probably the most luxurious and definitely well located, with a great view, I would say we didn’t have the best experience staying here.

First we checked in and were just give a room designed for disabled guests. We didn’t know until we got into our room. There are amenities designed for disabled guests. The problem is, the drains were smelly and water went everywhere when we showered. So as it was on the first floor, we could hear the loud disco music from the lobby, not pleasant at all.

We were then give a better room on a higher floor the next day, but the room wasn’t that great too, the shower door stop was broken and there was a heavy layer of dust on some of the shelves. Definitely not what I expect from a resort like this.

We tried to relax on the hotel managed area of the beach but the blasted very loud music, so it wasn’t great if you want to just relax.

Other than that the stay wasn’t remarkable. Food was decent. 

I guess this was more an issue of the Unawatuna area than specifically of the hotel itself, this hotel and the surrounding area was filled with Russians, while I have nothing against them, many of the tourist amenities are geared towards them, and it could mean non Russian preferred options could be limited in the area.

I wouldn’t have chosen the area and the hotel if I knew it would be like that.
title: Slightly disappointed by the experience at this hotel

text:
Отель конечно же лучший на берегу. Логистически находится практически в тупике. Не самое лучшее место что бы выбраться и побродить вечером. Основной корпус шикарный, большие номера, практически без претензий. Рестораны работают попеременно что дает возможность разводить потоки людей и не формируют пустые раздачи. При достаточно высокой цене, отсутствует набор бесплатных опций. Практически все что выходит за рамки номера платное или отсутствует как опция.
Например пиво на берегу нет, надо идти в бар. Зачем то делают коктейли и кофе. 
Алкоголь на ужине платный, сильно дороже чем в кафе на берегу. бутылка посредственного белого вина 13-17 тысяч рупий.
Отсутствие развлечений для детей, нет ни горок, ни анимации, ни меню.
Пляж хорошо оформлен, огорожен. Так как это бухта, там меньше волн чем на открытой воде, как следствие большое количество лодок которые норовят приплыть по голове. 
Номера большие, убирают хорошо, но абсолютно не следят за мелочами, перегоревшие лампочки, отваливающиеся крепление душа, разбитый пульт, нет переходников на розетки, обои в пятнах, на подушках были следы как будто их топтали, протекающая раковина. (все это явно не стоит 200$ за ночь). 
Отелю, стоит поработать над клиентоориентированностью и персоналом. На просьбу продлить номер на 2 суток по цене как указано в букинге, нам отказали, просили 240$ за номер на завтраках. хотя букинг предлагал за 160.
title: Хуже чем на картинке

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Ashan,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay at Araliya Beach Resort and Spa Unawatuna. We genuinely appreciate both your positive comments and your constructive feedback.

I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed the spacious room, stunning beach view, and the friendliness of our staff, especially those in reservations and the room boy. It’s also great to know that you found our clubhouse and beach area to be well-maintained and enjoyable.

However, I am truly sorry to learn about the issues you encountered. Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused:

I understand that being asked to pay at check-in was an unusual experience for you. But we at Araliya Beach resort its a usual practice that we acquire the room payment upon check in. This may vary from hotel to hotel yet most hotels follow the same practice.  

I regret that the damp floor affected your comfort. Your room was released as soon as our housekeeping team have cleaned the room hence the floor dampness was there. 

I am very sorry that our food quality and service did not meet your expectations. Your comments about the saltiness of the food, slow refills, and missing utensils are concerning, and we will investigate these issues with our culinary and service teams to make necessary improvements.

Your feedback is invaluable to us, and I assure you that it will be used to make necessary improvements. We are committed to providing a better experience for all our guests, and your insights play a crucial role in helping us achieve this goal.

Thank you once again for your feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and provide you with an improved experience.

Best regards,

Ruwan Kalugala
Director General Manager
text:
Went with the family for the long weekend after long time for a vacation.  First I called the general number and check the availability and one guy said sir we are fully booked and no rooms available.which I didn’t trust. Then I called the mobile number which they have mentioned on the web site and I was able to make a reservation without any issue. That’s the start of my disappointment.

At the time of the arrival reservation was so busy but they were nice and quickly gave me a room. The reservation staff is friendly and the room boy was so nice he explained each and everything in the room and was very helpful young guy. I was asked to do the payment at the time of the check in it self. Which was my very first experience and I was surprised with that. None of the hotels I have been never ask to do the payment at the check in which I was not so happy about.

The room was very spacious and nice they have mopped the room few minutes before check in and the water and the moisture was on the floor for quite some time which we were not so comfortable of. They have arranged an extra bed as requested  as well. Both the beds were clean and so comfortable where we had a very nice sleep. The view of the beach is was breathtaking which is a plus point.

I had lot of expectations on the dinner but to my surprise it was not tasty at all. My wife was complaining food is salty. There were not much of varieties and not much of a speed compared to the other hotels. We were at the saffron buffet area which is very congested. The staff was very friendly and nice but turned refills of food was very slow and I felt that the waiters were not trained properly as they were struggling while the service was on going. When we finish the salads and went and came to get the meat items, when we came back our forks and  spoons gone missing and it was not replaced. So we had to call the waiters again and again for spoons and forks . This was happened at dinner breakfast and lunch which was very uncomfortable for us. 

The breakfast was comparatively ok. At the breakfast also we experienced the refilling issue they had baked beans which was almost over and it was not replaced till we finished with the juice finishing our meal. We were a bit happy as the breakfast was fair compared to the dinner. But there is no factor to say it’s excellent as we had the issue of the taste of the food same as the dinner.

After breakfast we went to the club house area which was nice and spacious. Then we were in the beach which they keep the area very nice and tidy. We had clean towels friendly staff which made us happy.

At tie time of lunch I saw a bit of a variety compared to a bad dinner. They had mutton instead of pork and the beef was nice. But for dessert they only had watermelon  and pineapple which was not that great as the fruits for dessert. But there were good quantity of other dessert such as cheese cakes etc.
I ad to tell them 3 times to clean the plate wbch we had salad , meat items and d the main dish  was Lon the table while we were having the dessert which made us so unfordable. They took the plates out after telling it to 3 different people 3 times. This was not precessional at all.

Overall what I can say is that the place is nice the rooms are clean and spacious with all the required amenities and fully hightech. 

The view is very nice from the room and you can have a good view of the entire area when you go to the viewing deck at the rooftop.

Most of the people are nice and helpful while others were just minding their own business and just running around. 

When it come to food I would give 4 out of 10. Which need to be drastically improved. As the main thing which people check at a hotel is the meal experience. 

The staff needs to be trained more and they have to be more professional as well. I do not think that I will go there again.
title: Not much impressed and I won’t go again

Dear Guest, 

Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your stay at the Mermaid Hotel. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our facilities, food, and the hospitality of our staff.

We regret any inconvenience caused by the timing of the all-inclusive package. Our standard policy is that all-inclusive benefits begin at 12:00 PM on the day of arrival and end at 12:00 PM on the day of departure, in line with international hospitality practices. The late check-out fee applies solely to room occupancy, and we apologize if this was not clearly communicated at the time of booking. We appreciate your feedback and will ensure that this information is made clearer for future guests.

We truly value your input as it helps us improve our services. Should you choose to stay with us again, we would be delighted to assist in making your experience even more enjoyable.

Please feel free to reach out if you have any further questions or concerns.

Best regards,

Thomas Rodrigo

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We are pleased to hear that you found our staff friendly, enjoyed our pool, and had a good experience at our spa.

However, we sincerely regret that certain aspects of your stay did not meet your expectations. Your concerns regarding the room condition, shower, and noise levels have been noted, and we will address these issues with our team to ensure improvements. We also take guest safety seriously and will look into ways to enhance security on the beach.

Regarding food options, we will work on expanding our vegetarian selections to better cater to all our guests. Additionally, we appreciate your feedback on our sports facilities and will consider upgrades where possible.

We truly value your input as it helps us improve. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again for a more enjoyable experience in the future.

Best regards,

Thomas Rodrigo
text:
Pros:
- Friendly staff
- Nice pool
- Good spa

Cons:
- Rooms old
- Shower dirty and flooded the entire bathroom
- Harassed on the beach by random men
- Very loud music at night

Other:
- Food average, very few vegetarian options
- Sports facilities available but outdated
title: I'd rate it "ok"

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We’re glad to hear that you enjoyed our oceanfront location, spacious rooms, and the variety of food options available at our buffet and à la carte menu. Your kind words about our friendly atmosphere mean a lot to us.

We also appreciate your feedback regarding room privacy and bar service. We will certainly look into adding more privacy solutions for our rooms and improving efficiency at the bar to ensure a smoother experience for our guests.

We hope to welcome you back in the future for an even more enjoyable stay.

Best regards,

Thomas Rodrigo
text: Nous avons passé 2 nuits dans le cadre d’un tour opérateur. Hôtel sympathique, situé devant l’océan. Les chambres sont spacieuse et bien agencés, penser peut être à mettre un voilage car on voit directement dans la chambre depuis l’extérieur. Le buffet était correct et la nourriture variée avec en plus des plats à la carte. Petit bémol pour le bar. Malgré la multitude de boissons proposés le service est très long.
title: Pas mal

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay at Mermaid Hotel & Club. We appreciate your honest comments as they help us identify areas where we can improve.

I regret that the dinner and its spread did not meet your expectations. Please rest assured that we will review your feedback with our culinary team to enhance the variety and quality of our offerings. Thomas Rodrigo
text:

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback about your stay at the Mermaid Hotel & Club. While we are pleased that you found the food satisfying and had an overall okay experience, we are genuinely concerned to hear about the issues you encountered, particularly regarding the cleanliness of the commode and the behavior of one of our team members.

We sincerely apologize for any discomfort caused. Our goal is to ensure that every guest, regardless of origin, receives the same level of warmth, hospitality, and care. We will investigate this matter and address the behavior you described to ensure that all guests feel equally valued and welcomed.

Your feedback is important to us, and we will take the necessary steps to prevent such incidents in the future. We truly hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with a better experience during your next visit.

Warm regards,

Thomas Rodrigo
text: There was a bald headed man with beard, I think he is one of the managers at the hotel wearing a white shirt and and a brown trouser. We were not able to catch his name. However, the person was rude to the local guests. He was only catering the foreigners and even not smiling with the locals.
title: Staff was ok except the bald headed manager with beard. Food was satisfying. Commode seat of the toilet was not clean.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback about your stay at the Mermaid Hotel. We appreciate your honest observations, as they help us understand where we can enhance our guests' experience.

We're glad to hear that you enjoyed the variety of food options at our restaurant, including the Sri Lankan and Western dishes, as well as the freshly cooked offerings during each meal. Your positive comments about our well-maintained grounds are also much appreciated.

We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced due to the lack of lifts and the busy nature of the restaurant. Your feedback about the air conditioning and the room amenities, such as the absence of hand towels, has been noted. We will look into these aspects to ensure improvements are made for future guests.

Regarding the all-inclusive package and the wristband policy, we understand your concerns and will review our procedures to make the experience more convenient for our guests.

Thank you once again for your valuable feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and provide an even better experience.

Warm regards,

Thomas Rodrigo
text: There are no lifts at this hotel. Stair climbing is required as the restaurant is up a level up from the ground. The food was very good with a variety of Sri Lankan and western options. The restaurant gets very busy and noisy. The staff were continually busy refilling the buffet offerings which meant it was hotter than at many buffets. Each meal had something being cooked fresh – BBQ at dinner, omelette and bacon at breakfast, noodles at lunch. The room was small. We had a sea view, but many of the rooms overlook the pool and would be noisy. The air conditioning is centrally controlled and too hot for us overnight. There were no hand towels in the bathroom. When we asked for them, we were given face washers. The grounds are very nice and well maintained. The sea was too rough for swimming and the pool full of children (it was a weekend when we arrived). We were on an all-inclusive package and had to wear a wrist band but still had to give our room number and sign for drinks!
title: Big Resort

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We deeply regret that your experience did not meet your expectations and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you faced during your visit.

Regarding your comments about the reception, I am truly sorry to hear that you felt our team was not welcoming. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide. Thanuja, who has received numerous positive comments for her friendly and helpful nature, will be addressed to ensure that all guests feel respected and comfortable at all times. We will also provide additional training to our reception staff to improve their communication and service.

I understand your concerns about the lack of a common changing area. Our hotel policy is to offer day-use rooms for guests who wish to have private changing facilities. Unfortunately, we do not have a dedicated common changing room. However, your feedback is valuable, and we will consider how we might better communicate this information in the future to avoid any misunderstandings.

I'm glad to hear you appreciated the kindness of our play area staff and enjoyed the variety of activities we offer, including volleyball, badminton, table tennis, and water polo. We aim to provide a range of amenities for all our guests to enjoy, and it's good to know that this part of your visit was positive.

Once again, I apologize for the inconvenience you experienced and thank you for your honest feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a more enjoyable experience in the future.

Warm regards,

Thomas Rodrigo
roomTip: Locals please avoid day-outs
text:
Since our first impression itself of the hotel wasn't that good, I will mention the bad stuff first.

Bad:
1.The reception was incredibly rude and mean to us. I don't know if it was because we were locals, but here’s my warning if you are planning to go for a day out: they didn’t have any changing rooms. Not even a common changing area. I asked where my sister and I could change after getting into the pool, and the two ladies at the reception pointed us to the bathroom at the entrance. It didn’t even have a shower—just toilets. They didn’t seem to care at all. The look on the senior receptionist’s face (if I’m not mistaken, her name was Thanuja) was sarcastic, and she had such an attitude. 

It cost us Rs. 6,500 per person, but it wasn’t worth the money. I checked Booking.com too, and there are many bad reviews about the reception. We had an argument as soon as we entered, and it ruined the entire mood. There weren’t even lockers or a safe place to keep our bags. They said we could leave them on the sofa in front of the reception. I think they need to understand that women can’t remove their clothes outside or change in a tiny bathroom that only has toilets. And it’s located in front of the hotel, so we had to walk all the way back to the reception to change.

2. The hotel doesn't look that good as it is shown in the photos.

Good:
1. The staff that was there in the play area (separated from a wall) was so kind to us. They only let us use the bathroom of the spa area to change. That was extremely kind. 
2. They had a lot of games to play like volleyball, badminton, table tennis, a gym, and water polo.
title: Disappointing Experience: Rude Reception and bad first impression

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for choosing Mermaid Hotel to celebrate your first wedding anniversary with us. It was a pleasure to be a part of such a special occasion, and we're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay.

I'm delighted to know that our team, especially Ms. Thanuja, was able to make your celebration memorable with the anniversary cake and decorations. Your kind words about our friendly and helpful staff mean a lot to us, and I'll be sure to pass on your compliments to the entire team.

I'm glad you enjoyed the music event, our breakfast selection, and found the pool to your liking. Your feedback about the dinner buffet menu is appreciated, and we will certainly look into ways to improve it.

We strive to provide a calm and relaxing environment for all our guests, and it’s wonderful to know that we succeeded in making your stay enjoyable. We look forward to welcoming you back for another relaxing and memorable experience.

Warm regards,

Thomas Rodrigo
text: We went to mermaid hotel to celebrate our 1st yr weeding anniversary . Staff is very friendly and helpful  . Special thanks for ms Tjanuja arranging anniversary cake and doco and she is very friendly. We realy enjoyed music event and night .For breakfast collection was superb . the pool also very clean and enjoyed .The only minus thing we felt is dinner buffe menu need to improve . Other than that we really enjoyed all . Calm and nice place to relax .
title: friendly staff nice place to relax .

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback following your stay at the Mermaid Hotel.

We are delighted to hear that you found our hotel to be a calm and quiet place and that you were satisfied with the hospitality provided by our staff, especially Ms. Thanuja. It’s wonderful to know that you enjoyed the recreational activities and had a great time with your kids, and we’re glad that the unplugged music on Saturday night added to your enjoyment.

We appreciate your honest feedback regarding the food. We apologize for not meeting your expectations with the variety and taste of our buffet offerings, particularly during lunch. Your comments are valuable to us, and we will work on improving the taste and variety of our food to enhance our guests’ dining experience.

Thank you once again for your valuable feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back and provide you with an improved experience.

Warm regards,

Thomas Rodrigo
text:
Calm & quite place. Very satisfied about the hospitality as the staff is very helpful and friendly, specially Ms. Thanuja. 
We have received a b'day cake with a short notice. 
There are lot of recreational activities (Play areas for Cricket, Volleyball, Badminton, Table Tennis) with two pools (baby pool).  We enjoyed a lot with our kids. There was an unplugged music on Saturday after dinner until mid night. So , we had a wonderful time.

But we are not happy with the food. There's a less variety of foods in Buffet. The food is not yummy as expected. Lunch buffet is worst. Breakfast & Dinner buffets are some what ok. Hotel should pay attention to the tasty of their  food & increase the food varieties.
title: Great time at Mermaid Hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest. 

Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay at the Mermaid Hotel. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the cleanliness of our Superior room, the excellent food, and the beautiful sea view from your room.

Your suggestion to include more varieties in our food offerings is much appreciated, and we will certainly take it into consideration to enhance our dining experience. Additionally, we apologize for the inconvenience caused by the lack of toiletries such as toothbrushes and shaving kits in your room. This items are available on request, anyway  we will review our amenities to ensure all guests have everything they need for a comfortable stay.

We also appreciate your feedback regarding the photos on our website and will work on updating them to provide a better visual representation of our rooms. We regret the inconvenience caused by the power cuts during your stay and assure you that we are addressing the maintenance issues to prevent such occurrences in the future.

Thank you once again for your valuable feedback. We look forward to welcoming you back to the Mermaid Hotel for a more seamless and enjoyable stay.

Warm regards,

Thomas Rodrigo
roomTip: Room balcony is visible to other rooms.
text:
We stayed one day at mermaid hotel on our vacation on june. We stayed at their superior room. Room seems to be clean, Food was excellent, it would be better if they can have more varieties. 
However toiletries did not in clude toothbrushes and shaving kits. Our room had a good sea view. It is better to include more photos of their rooms in the web site. May be due to the current maintenance there were some power cuts.
title: Good food

Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your recent experience at Mermaid Hotel. We appreciate your kind words regarding our staff members Samy and Cheeky, who have contributed positively to your stay with their friendliness and joviality. However, we are genuinely sorry to learn that you had a less than satisfactory interaction with our managers, We apologize for any inconvenience or discomfort caused during your stay.

Rodrigo
text:
Un hôtel qui est un paradis cependant en demi teinte par un manque de professionnalisme des managers de cet hôtel. 
Arrogants, mal vaillants avec les clients surtout "thomas". Si vous le croisez, fuyez, ce responsable devrait plutôt travailler comme videur dans un rade avec son acolyte, sameera, roi du sourire forcé et spécialiste dans le contrôle des travaux finis... 
Tout simplement INUTILES !!!   Dehors Messieurs.
Heureusement que votre personnel redresse le niveau par sa sympathie et jovialité notamment SAMY et CHEEKY.
Messieurs svp, prenez leurs places et vous magnifierez par vos sourires ce si belle établissement.
title: Le Paradis sans les managers

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest.

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback following your second stay at Mermaid Hotel. We appreciate your loyalty and value your insights on your experience.

It's wonderful to hear that you enjoyed the vast beach resort, coconut trees, and the beautiful ocean views. We are pleased that the recently renovated rooms and washrooms met your expectations. Your comments regarding the need for a full renovation in common areas and the pool have been duly noted. We continuously strive to enhance our facilities, and your input will be considered as we plan for future improvements.

We are glad to know that you found the rooms spacious with basic amenities, comfortable beds, and reliable air conditioning and Wi-Fi. It's also great to hear that our efforts to provide drinking water on each floor were appreciated.

Your positive remarks about the delicious food and attentive restaurant staff are heartening. We will certainly share your compliments with the team.

We appreciate your suggestion for a full renovation to preserve the hotel's beauty and business. Guest feedback is invaluable to us, and we will use it to make ongoing enhancements to ensure a more enjoyable stay for our guests.

Thank you for choosing Mermaid Hotel, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for an even more improved experience in the future.

Best regards,

Thomas Rodrigo
text: Second time visiting this vast beach resort with so many coconut trees and nice views of the ocean. The rooms and washrooms have been renovated recently but the hotel needs a full renovation in order to preserve it’s beauty. Especially the common areas and the pool. The rooms are spacious with basic amenities, beds are comfortable and has good air conditioning and WiFi. Each floor has a water filter to get drinking water. Food was delicious and the restaurant staff was very caring and attentive. A full renovation will definitely help the hotel to preserve the business.
title: A decent stay
